loans.name: Ay

texts.en: Ay A. sells groceries in Angdong Por Village, Kampong Thom Province. She earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns about $2 per day. Mrs. A.'s business is growing and she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase additional grocery stocks for her store. By increasing the variety of products that she can offer her customers, Mrs. A. hopes to expand her business and increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks for her existing business

loans.name: Refika

texts.en: Refika is a 26 year old woman, living in a small village near the town of Ilijas.  She is married with 2 children, and her oldest daughter will be starting school next year. Her husband works, and she also helps support her family through their farming business.  Refika currently raises cows, and sells their milk to local dairies and people in her village. This is her second loan with Zene za Zene, and she is requesting $750 to buy another cow.  Refika thinks this purchase will help improve her overall sales, and will be a good way to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. sells groceries from her house and earns around $1 per day. She lives with her six children in Damreyslab Village, Kampong Thom Province. Three of her daughters work for a garment factory. Their income helps to support the family’s expenses. Mrs. S.’s husband is a motorcycle and bicycle repairman. He provides quality repair services, which attracts customers from far away to seek his expertise. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase raw materials for her husband's repair service in order to meet the high demand resulting from his superior service.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her husband's repair service

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. sells groceries in her village in Andong Por Village, Kampong Thom Province. She has six children, one of whom is married. One of her single children works for a garment factory and uses his income to support the family’s expenses. Mrs. T. would like to expand her business so that she can increase her profits. She is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase more grocery stocks for her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her store

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. sells groceries from her house and earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a cook for wedding ceremonies and earns about $1.80 per day. They live with six children in Baraykork Village, Kampong Thom Province. Because of an increase in customers, Mrs. S. would like to expand her grocery business. She is asking for a loan of $200 to expand her grocery inventory and decorate her store to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for her store and decorate it to attract more customers

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Orm S. raises pigs in a pen located near her house, earning about $2 per day. She lives with one daughter in Veal Toch Village, Kampong Thom Province.
Mrs. S. would like to raise more pigs and is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase more pig feed. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to repair the pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and repair her pigpen

loans.name: Animéyo

texts.fr:
Ms. Animéyo A. is a single mother of three children and lives in Lomé. She was born in Lama-sahoudè in 1969 and while not having traveled too much, she still had the idea to launch something that generated revenue. She buys loincloths at the Lomé marketplace and sells them to target customers in her home area. This sales method has provided her with much success. Faced with a growing business, she seeks her first loan to increase her inventory, which contains 30 loincloths of average quality.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire, mère de trois enfants, madame A. Animéyo vit à Lomé. Elle est née à Lama-sahoudè en 1969 et n’ayant pas du tout fréquenté, elle a quand même sût avoir l’idée d’entreprendre une activité génératrice de revenu. Elle achète des pagnes au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle vend à domicile à une clientèle cible. Cette méthode de vente lui réussi bien. Face à la demande grandissante elle sollicite un premier prêt pour augmenter son stock de 30 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiare.

loans.use: buy loincloth pieces

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay S. O. raises pigs near her house. She has been raising pigs for five years and earns about $3.20 per day. Her husband provides battery-charging services to people who use rechargeable car batteries in his village. People in rural villages in Cambodia use these rechargeable batteries as a modest means to power their homes. He makes about $2.80 per day from providing this service. 

Because of an increase in customers, his machine cannot support the demand for battery-charging services. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $500 for husband to purchase a dynamo and increase the power output of his battery-charging machine. The picture is of Mrs. O.'s husband.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase equipment to increase the output of his battery-charging machine

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en: Rachid , 55, lives in the eastern suburbs of Beirut. As a handicapped father, he raises his 4 children from the only income he has, afforded by an internet café that he is always trying to improve. For this goal, he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to redecorate the internet café and to purchase new computers. This is the first time that Rachid has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to redecorate and purchase new computers

loans.name: Haroution

texts.en: Haroution, 53, lives in Bourj Hammoud which is located in Beirut. This year, he took  out his first loan from Al Majmoua to open a new shop selling Hummus and Foul, traditional Lebanese cuisine. At present, Haroution needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase aluminum display cases for his shop. This step up will allow Haroution to expand his business by attracting more clients.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum display cases

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira, 43 and mother of 3 children, lives in the suburbs of Beirut. She owns a small shoe shop next to her home. Samira, just like thousands of other women, desires to empower herself in society. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to improve her business and develop it. This is the first time that Samira is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her shoe shop

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji, 43, is married and has 3 children. He lives in the suburbs of Beirut. He is the owner of a small printing center. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase new advanced machines for his shop and thus expand his business. This is the second time that Naji has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase new advanced machines for his print shop

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges, 53 and married, works hard to guarantee a better life for his 2 children. Georges lives in the suburbs of Beirut. In view of the high cost of living, the low income afforded by Georges' small shop selling "manakish" (a traditional open-faced sandwich)  does not suffice for the requirements of his family. Therefore, he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to help him to purchase a car to use as a taxi and ensure a second source of income. This is the first time that Georges is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to purchase a taxi car

loans.name: Mahja

texts.en: Mahja, 77, is still ambitious and motivated and seeks challenges in her work despite her age. She lives in the suburbs of Beirut. Her love for life and for work have made her a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 9 years, and she always repays her loans on time. Mahja owns a small grocery next to her home. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to expand and guarantee the continuity of her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory; working capital for her grocery shop

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa, 21 years old, engaged since 3 years despite his young age. He owns a grocery shop in Zoukak El Blat, Beirut. Moustafa is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the improvement of his business which is his only source of income. He wants to get married and therefore needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to furnish the house for his future family. This is the first time that Moustafa requests a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to furnish the house for his future family

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa, 21,  has been engaged for 3 years despite his young age. He owns a grocery shop and is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the improvement of his business which is his only source of income. He wants to get married and therefore needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to furnish the house for his future family. This is the first time that Moustafa is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: to furnish the house for his future family

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji, 35, lives in Beirut. He owns a discothèque shop. Naji continuously develops his business. For this goal, he has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time. Naji will get married soon, and he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to furnish the house of his future family.

loans.use: to furnish the house of his future family

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 35, lives in the Beirut suburbs. He is a men's hair designer. He used to work in a hair salon, but his ambition pushed him to request his first loan from Al Majmoua this year and that allowed him to open his own salon. At present, Ahmad needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase a generator. This equipment will permit  Ahmad to guarantee more convenience for his clients and therefore to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase a generator for his hair salon

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en: Ihsan is 22 years old and lives in Beirut, where he is well known for his gentleness, empathy and kindness. Everyone who knows him likes him, and the ice cream shop he runs is always full of customers. Like many people his age, Ihsan would love to buy his own car. He intended to apply for a loan to make this possible, but his mother has recently been diagnosed with cancer. This makes it urgent that he come up with the money to pay for her treatment. He has applied for a loan for $1,000, his first from Al Majmoua, to make her treatment possible.

loans.use: To cover the cost of chemotherapy for his mother

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan A. is 37 years old and lives in the suburbs of Beirut, where he makes a living cutting and styling men's hair. In the past, Hassan has received two loans from Al Majmoua. The first was to pay expenses associated with opening his business, and the second to develop it. Now he has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to buy more equipment, such as a chair in which to cut and style people's hair.  This loan will allow him to expand his business. Hassan has always succeeded in repaying his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: JamA. A. C. is 60 years old and lives in Beirut. She is married and has one child. JamA. makes a living selling clothes out of her home to friends and neighbors. She needs a loan for $1,000  to buy more products from wholesalers and to expand her business by diversifying the inventory of items she has for sale. JamA. has been a client of A. Majmoua for the past four years, and always repays her loans on time.

loans.use: To buy more products from wholesalers

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana is 46 years old and lives near the town of Zenica.  She is married with three children, ages 13, 17 and 21.  Her husband has some seasonal work, while Mirjana helps raise their cow and calf.  She is able to earn steady wages by selling milk and homemade cheese, and has built up a loyal customer base, selling her goods to many local households around town every week.  She is requesting this first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of $975.  With this loan Mirjana plans to buy another cow, and also to purchase food for the rest of her cows.  Mirjana’s goal is to keep expanding her business and hopes that it will help increase the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy another cow and food for cows

loans.name: Dajana

texts.en: Dajana is a 20 year old woman living near the town of Zenica.  She is married, and her husband has a seasonable job growing mushrooms.  Dajana earns a living raising poultry, fattening them to sell and also selling their eggs.  She has asked for a loan in the amount of $975 to buy food for her chickens.  She wants to keep buying natural and nutritious food to feed them, so their eggs will be healthier for her and her customers to eat.  For the future Dajana also plans to buy more chickens and keep growing her business.

loans.use: To buy all-natural food for her chickens

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Iii Group

texts.en:
Valentina is a 42-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Mancorneta in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Valentina lives with her husband and four children, ages 13, 15, 16, and 19, in a small home. She started a small business two years ago selling fresh fruit to her community.  She is requesting a loan so that she has can buy larger quantities of higher quality fruit to sell.  In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy pieces of fresh fruit on the corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. The money from this loan will help her make more money by enabling her to buy enough fruit to meet the demand she will face. She hopes that her business will continue to grow with the help of this loan, and that with the profits she will be able to continue providing for her family.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Valentina herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.es:
Aníbal is 64 years old and has been married for 40 years to Leónidas who is 68. Aníbal says that he and his wife had three children. The two oldest were identical twins and both were killed in accidents under different circumstances. Their youngest daughter is now 30 years old and she is the one that gives them the strength to work hard every day.

Aníbal is a very self-sacrificing person and has worked since he was very young. Before, he owned a bakery that he had to close due to the fact that it is a business that now has a lot of competition in the city.

Currently he manages a store located in his home and is assisted both by his wife and daughter who is his right hand. With the money earned from their business they were able to help their daughter obtain a university degree in public accounting and she now works in her chosen profession.

In spite of the fact that Aníbal only finished elementary school, he is proficient in business. At this time he needs a loan to buy merchandise including sugar, flour, rice and pasta to have more to offer in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Aníbal tiene 64 años, está casado hace 40 años con Leónidas que tiene 68 años. Aníbal cuenta que él y su señora tuvieron 3 hijos, los mayores eran mellizos y ambos fallecieron en accidentes en circunstancias distintas. La hija menor hoy día tiene 30 años de edad y es la que les da fuerzas para luchar todos los días.

Aníbal es una persona muy sacrificada, trabajó desde muy pequeño, anteriormente tenía una panadería que tuvo que cerrar debido a que es una actividad que actualmente tiene mucha competencia en la ciudad.

Actualmente maneja una despensa que funciona en su domicilio y es ayudado tanto por su esposa como por su hija que constituye su mano derecha. Con los ingresos obtenidos en su negocio logró que su hija culmine la carrera universitaria de contaduría pública y ya ejerce su profesión.

A pesar de que Aníbal solamente terminó sus estudios primarios es bastante hábil con los negocios. En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos, etc. para surtir mejor su despensa.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, baked goods, dairy products, fruits and vegetables among other items to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en: Enisa is a 32 year old woman, living in the suburbs of the town Travnik.  She is married, and her husband has a full time job.  They also have 2 children, who are in the 3rd and 7th grade. She works in agriculture, and has 2 heifers, 2 cows and one bull.  She earns a living mainly by selling their milk at the local dairy.  This is her first loan in the amount of $975.  Enisa will use this loan to buy some food for her cows.  In fact, she needs this loan to keep from selling off her current livestock.  Enisa hopes that one of her cows will get pregnant soon, as she looks forward to expanding her farm. For the future, it is her goal to grow her farm to include up to 20 cows!

loans.use: To buy food for her cows

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is from the town of Travnik.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three young children ages 6 thru 10.  Her husband works in the timber industry, while Hamida works in cattle breeding.  She currently has 4 cows, 2 heifers, and one bull, and earns her income from selling her cows' milk.  She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $975. She will use this to buy food for their livestock.  In addition Hamida hopes to buy a milking machine, as this will allow her to work more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy food for cows and a milking machine

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas I Group

texts.en: Altagracia and her husband live in a very poor community called Mancorneta, which is on the outskirts of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Altagracia operates her own `fritura´, a small business that makes homemade snacks such as empanadas and minced meat. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more flour, oil, pork and chicken so that she can meet the demands of her customers. After preparing the food in her house, she goes out into the community to sell. In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. Altagracia has continued to grow since her first loan of $100.  Her loan amounts and ability to repay have increased over the years and she is now on her 7th loan in the amount of $900. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan. In her free time, Altagracia enjoys spending time with her 8 grandchildren.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Altagracia herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, flour, and oil

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo is a young businessman, 33 years of age. He has lived with his partner Rosa, who is 25 years old, for five years. From their union a beautiful boy was born and he is now five years old and attends school.

Arnaldo has a store in his home that he has managed for six years. He says that before, he worked as a traveling salesman until the day he met Rosa, who was to be his hardworking companion.

After they got together they decided to set up a small store in their home and with the income that it generated for them they were able to get ahead. The business has grown tremendously and they are increasing the size of the room since they are planning to grow a little more.

At this time Arnaldo is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, flour, rice, pasta, canned goods and meats so that he can offer more in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Arnaldo es un joven comerciante de 33 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 5 años con Rosa que tiene 25 años de edad. De la unión de ambos ha nacido un hermoso hijo que hoy día tiene 5 años y ya va a la escuela.

Arnaldo tiene una despensa que funciona en su casa desde hace 6 años. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante hasta el día que conoció a Rosa, quien sería luego su compañera de lucha constante.

Una vez juntos decidieron montar una pequeña despensa en su hogar y con los ingresos que le generaban la misma lograron salir adelante. El negocio ha crecido bastante y están ampliando la habitación debido a que piensan agrandarla un poco más.

En esta oportunidad Arnaldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos, enlatados, carnes, etc. y así surtir un poco más su despensa.

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, pasta, soft drinks, dairy products, canned goods, meat, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica started her business a few years ago due to financial concerns. She noticed that her husband's salary was not sufficient to meet all their living expenses plus that of their three sons: Juan Antonio, Cristian Alberto, and Estefan, who are all students. This being the case, Veronica decided to start an activity that generated income but still allowed her to take care of her children. She searched until she came across an opportunity to sell used clothing in the markets. She started this business and little by little, she has made some sales.

She needs a loan of $300 which will be repaid in 4 months. The loan will be used to buy more clothing as summertime is approaching and there is more demand for this season's attire. With your help, Veronica will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Veronica incio su negocio hace un años debido a necesidades economicas ya que con el sueldo que percibe su esposo como empleado no les alacanzaba para soleventar los gastos de la casa y los de sus 3 hijos: Juan Antonio, Cristian Alberto y Estefany, ya que ellos se encuentran estudiando. Fue asi como Veronica decidio emprender una actividad que le permitiera generar ingresos sin tener que descuidar a sus hijos, buscando que podia hacer surgio la oportunidad de vender ropa usada en los mercados y decidio comenzar a hacerlo, poco a poco ha ido progresando y elevando sus ventas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas ropa ya que se acercan las vacaciones de verano y es cuando tiene mas demanda. Con tu ayuda Veronica saldra adelante.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 48 years old, is a divorced woman with two children. She says her divorce was triggered by a minor misunderstanding between herself and her husband ten years ago.

Juliana enjoys selling food, from which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, spices, skimmed powdered milk, palm oil, and peanuts, among other items. She sells her goods at her table in the community market. Because of her good customer relations, Juliana has many customers who buy from her stand.

Juliana wants to use this loan to buy an increased stock of rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, spices, skimmed powdered milk, and other items to serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Lydia ‘mma’ Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, spices, skimmed powdered milk and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a forty-six-year-old woman, is married with four children. Her children are currently in school. Mary is very resourceful mother. She works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with better life opportunity in the future.

Mary owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, and evaporated milk. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk and cartons of vegetable oil among other items. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the education of her children.

She belongs to the community group called Lydia ‘mma’ Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Mary is in the photograph, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk and cartons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Married with four children, Margaret is thirty-eight-years-old. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking,’ which means door to door sales.

Margaret is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers.

She is a member of the community group called St. Benedict Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment of loans. Margaret is in the photograph, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with two children, both of whom are currently in school. She is a thirty four year old business woman. She started trading twelve years ago and she enjoys trading. She trades in garment clothes and lace materials.

Gladys believes in hard work and dedication. She amassed lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in Obuasi market. She believes that with this loan she will be better able to supply her customers with quality products. She hopes to raise increased income, since quality comes with price. She wants to use the loan to buy more pieces of garment clothes and lace materials.

She belongs to the community group called St. Benedict Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans. Gladys is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of garment clothes and lace materials.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto is 50 years old and he has lived as a couple for 20 years with Elba who is 47 years old. They both have 3 beautiful daughters who are between 18 and 9 years of age. The oldest has already reached her secondary studies and she traveled to Argentina to carry on with her studies, the two young ones are still in school. His daughters are his hope and his reason of living. He mentions that he worked as shoemaker in Argentina for 20 years. He managed to save a fair amount of money and he decided to return to his country in search of better future 3 years ago. With his savings he constructed his own house and he rents several rooms, also he bought a car, which he uses as taxi. He also has a cafeteria that is in charge of his partner while he is working the taxi, in which he transports all kinds of passengers. According to Benedicto, he is very happy to have returned to the Paraguay, because he is doing really well. He does not complain about the life he has had; and when he recalls that he had to leave his country when he was 25 years old because there was no work sometimes the sadness invades him, but he affirms that the sacrifice was worthwhile because today he has all the comfort needed to have a good life. This time he is requesting a loan to buy new seat cover for his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Benedicto tiene 50 años y vive en pareja hace 20 años con Elba quien ya ha cumplido los 47 años de edad. De la unión de ambos han nacido 3 bellas hijas que tienen entre 18 y 9 años de edad. La mayor de todas ya culminó sus estudios secundarios y viajó a La Argentina para continuar estudiando, las dos últimas aún van al colegio y escuela respectivamente. Sus hijas son su esperanza y su razón de vivir. Comenta que trabajó como zapatero durante 20 años en la Argentina, logró ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero y hace 3 años decidió volver a su país en busca de mejores horizontes. Con sus ahorros construyó su casa propia y alquila varios salones de la misma, también compró un auto, el cual utiliza como taxi. Posee un copetín (comedor) que queda a cargo de su pareja mientras él hace los recorridos con su taxi, en el que transporta todo tipo de pasajeros. Según Benedicto, está muy feliz de haber vuelto al Paraguay, debido a que le va muy bien, no se queja de la vida que llevan y cuando rememora que tuvo que dejar su país con apenas 25 años cumplidos debido a que no había trabajo la tristeza lo invade a veces, pero afirma que el sacrificio valió la pena debido a que hoy día ya cuenta con todas las comodidades para el buen vivir En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su taxi.

loans.use: Buy new seat covers for his taxi.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 30-year-old young merchant. She married Benjamin 11 years ago. Her husband is 35 years old. She has a 10-year-old son who is still in school. She has a booth where she sells all kinds of clothes in the municipal market of Itá. She tells us that that previously she used to do door to door sales until one day she decided to set up her own steady business seven years ago. She tells us that she is doing well and that she already has a good clientele. She sells all kinds of clothing like: T-shirts , shoes, jeans, shirts, etc. that she buys at the capital city. Her husband works as painter in Argentina and he comes every three months. Also he usually brings some goods to her, therefore she has exclusive clothing that you cannot easily buy in the area. This time she need a loan to buy of goods like: blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es una joven comerciante de 30 años de edad. Está casada con Benjamin hace 11 años. Su esposo ha cumplido los 35 años de edad. Tiene un hijo de 10 años que aún va a la primaria y es la adoración de la pareja. Tiene un puesto de venta de ropas de todo tipo que funciona en el mercado municipal de Itá. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante, hasta que un día decidió montar su negocio estable. De ese momento ya han transcurrido 7 años. Cuenta que le va muy bien y que ya tiene una clientela muy bien formada. Vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir como: remeras, calzas, jeans, camisas, etc. que compra de la ciudad capital. Su esposo trabaja como pintor en la Argentina y viene cada tres meses. También suele traerle mercaderías de dicho país por lo que tiene prendas exclusivas que no se consiguen con facilidad en la zona. En esta ocasión necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como ser: blusas, remeras, jeans y todo tipo de ropas de estación.

loans.use: Buy blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is 30 years old. For six years, she has lived with her partner, Cayetano, who is 32 years old. They are a united couple who have raised a beautiful 5-year-old son who already attends pre-school.

Liliana owns a shop which she has managed for five years. Previously, the shop belonged to her mother, who left it because of health reasons.

Previously, Liliana worked as a maid in the capital city. That work was tough because she had to get up very early and she did not make a lot of money. Her partner works for a well-known company located in Asuncion, the capital city of Paraguay.

Today, things are going well. The income that the small shop generates goes toward buying food and providing an education for their son -- something that Liliana never had since she came from a humble family, and she only got as far as the 5th grade.

At this time, Liliana needs a loan so that she may buy merchandise like flour, sugar, rice, noodles, etc. so she can stock her business better and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana, tiene 30 años de edad. Vive en pareja hace 6 años con Cayetano que tiene 32 años de edad. Forman una pareja muy unida y han criado a un hermoso niño de 5 años de edad que ya va al pre - escolar de la educación escolar.

Liliana es dueña de una despensa que administra desde hace 5 años ya que anteriormente el negocio pertenecía a su madre, quien se lo dejó por motivos de salud.

Cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica en la ciudad capital, el trabajo era muy sacrificado debido a que debía levantarse muy temprano para acudir al mismo, además la remuneración era muy poca. Su pareja trabaja como empleado de una conocida empresa que funciona en Asunción, ciudad capital del Paraguay. .

Hoy día le va bastante bien, los ingresos que generan su pequeña despensa le dan para comer, además de brindarle una buena educación a su pequeño hijo, cosa que ella no logró debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde y solo hizo hasta el 5to. Grado de la primaria.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc. a fin de surtir mejor su negocio y de esa manera poder aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, noodles, drinks, meat, and bread.

loans.name: Florisa

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30373&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Florisa lives with her boyfriend, is 28 years old and has one 10-year-old daughter. Four times a week, Florisa travels to different markets in the region including Cangallo, Ceccelambras, Huamanguilla and Putaja markets, where she sells groceries and sodas. She transports her merchandise in her mother's car. Her mother also has this type of business.

Florisa needs a loan of 1,600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk and noodles.

Florisa's dreams are to own her own car so she can transport her products, grow her business and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30373&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Florisa es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Florisa es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija de 10 años, Florisa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región cuatro veces a la semana a las ferias de Cangallo, Ceccelambras, Huamanguilla y Putaja donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, su mercadería lo transporta en el carro de su mamá, quien también se dedica a este negocio.

Florisa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo.

Los sueños de Florisa son tener un carro propio para trasportar sus productos, ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Florisa needs a loan of 1,600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk and noodles.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is married with two children, who are currently in school. She is 42 years old. To raise money to support her children in school, Afia sells foods like boiled rice with stew and ‘ampesi’. Ampesi is local dish prepared from boiled yams or plantains. It is taken with sauce made from tomatoes or cabbage. Afia wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, plantains, yams, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Afia hopes to raise increased income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is not asleep) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and offer peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, plantains, yams, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Communal Development Bank. Juana lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. She lives in the Conchopata neighborhood with other relatives.

Along with her husband, she produces handmade bricks and has help in this from unskilled laborers who make the bricks. She sells her work to intermediaries within her community.

Juana needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of dirt for making bricks.

Juana dreams of having her own home, improving her business and providing a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos. Vive en el barrio de Conchopata junto a otros familiares,

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para la fabricación cuenta con la ayuda de peones que labran el ladrillo, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad a intermediarios.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra para la fabricación de los ladrillos.

Los sueños de Juana son tener casa propia, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase dirt and clay for making bricks.

loans.name: Juana Claudia

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Communal Development Bank.

Juana is married, 57 years old and has 9 children. She lives in a small house with her children. She travels to different markets in the region to buy grains, which she later sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells candy as a ambulantory vendor as well as makes cotton candy, which she makes with sugar and food coloring.

Juana needs a loan for 1,200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat and barley.

Juana´s dreams are to improve her businesses and to have more money.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Juana es casada, tiene 57 años y 9 hijos, Vive en una quinta junto a sus hijos, viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales que posteriormente venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además venD. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria, caminando, también elabora un dulce llamado algodón que esta elaborado con azúcar y colorante.

Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. maíz, trigo, cebada.

Los sueños D. Juana son mejorar sus negocios, tener mas capital.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=32462&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Liliana is a partner in the Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Liliana is a 23-year-old single mother who has one daugther. Alongside her mother, Liliana sells fresh and frozen fish from the door of her home under an improvised tarp, which protects her from the sun. She runs this business on Saturdays and Sundays. During the week, Liliana works as a waitress in a "cebichería" (restaurant offering the traditional Peruvian dish).

Liliana needs a loan of 1,400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of fish and shellfish.

Liliana's dreams are to have her own home, provider a good education to her daughter and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=32462&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Liliana es madre soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija, Liliana junto a su mamá vende pescado fresco y congelado en la puerta de su casa en una carpa improvisada que le protege del sol, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, además Liliana los días de la semana trabaja como mesera en una cebichería.

Liliana necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado y mariscos.

Los sueños de Liliana es tener una casa propia, brindar una buena educación a su hija y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Liliana needs a loan of 1,400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
First loan:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30765&_tpos=5&_tpg=1

Teofila is a partner in the Banco Comunal Bienestar.

Teofila is a married 42-year-old with four children. She lives in Asociacion Covadonga and has a shop where she sells meat, produce, and groceries. Besides depending on demand, she provides products to Pronaa (a public institution of social support). She acquires products from markets. On some occasions, she processes grains depending on the demand in the market. Gradually, Teofila is growing her business.

Teofila needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley and maize.

Teofila's dreams are to get ahead with her children, provide them a good education and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30765&_tpos=5&_tpg=1

Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.

Teofila es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Teofila vive en la Asociación Covadonga, Teofila tiene una tienda donde vende carne, verduras, abarrotes. Además dependiendo de la demanda provee productos a Pronaa (institución publica de apoyo social), los productos lo adquiere de las ferias y chacras, en algunas ocasiones procesa los cereales dependiendo de la demanda del mercado. Teofila poco a poco esta implementando más su negocio.

Teofila necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz.

Los sueños de Teofila es salir adelante con sus hijos, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Teofila needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of  wheat, barley and maize.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank.

She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Teodora has a well-stocked store-restaurant, where she sells groceries and in the same place sells a variety of food. She also has photocopying services and in the afternoons sells drinks. These businesses are run by her with help from her young daughter. Her store is located near the city of Ayacucho´s municipal cemetary.

Teodora needs a loan for 3,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pastas, mile and drinks.

Teodora´s dreams are to have her own home, buy a car, expand her business and to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Teodora tiene un tienda - restaurante muy surtida donde vende abarrotes, en el mismo local vende comida variada, también brinda servicios de fotocopiado, además por las tardes vende bebidas, estos negocios son administrados por ella con el apoyo de su hija pequeña, su tienda esta ubicado cerca del cementerio general de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Teodora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche y bebidas.

Los sueños de Teodora son tener casa propia, comprar su carro, implementar más su negocio y seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, pastas, milk and drinks.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Nemesio is 50 years old, he married Ricarda, who is 52 years old, 12 years ago. Together they have raised 4 children who are between 21 and 12 years of age. Meanwhile the oldest works already on his own, the rest still live with them and they are still in school. Nemesio possesses a van that he uses to do all kinds of deliveries in different areas, in the city of Itá, and other nearby cities. Also he buys and sells all kinds of metal articles as: grills (used for food baking by means of coal, used as kitchen stove in many humble houses of our country), platters, casseroles, etc. This time he is requesting a loan to do some maintenance work to his vehicle and to buy goods because during the winter he has more demand than usual.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Nemesio tiene 50 años, está casado hace 12 años con Ricarda que tiene 52 años de edad. Juntos han criado a 4 hijos que tienen entre 21 y 12 años de edad. Mientras el mayor de los hijos ya trabaja por cuenta propia, los menores aún viven con ellos y siguen estudiando. Nemesio posee una camioneta que utiliza para realizar fletes de todo tipo y por distintas zonas, tanto de la ciudad de Itá, como por otras ciudades vecinas. Además compra y vende artículos de hojalatería de todo tipo como: braseros (instrumento utilizado para la cocción de alimentos a base de carbón, utilizado como cocina en muchas casas humildes de nuestro país), bandejas, cacerolas, etc. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para hacer algunos arreglos de mantenimiento a su vehiculo y para la compra de mercaderías debido a que durante el invierno tiene más demanda de la usual.

loans.use: Repair his vehicle and buy merchandise like grills, platters, casseroles, etc.

loans.name: Pascuala Yamileth

texts.es:
In Villaneuva in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Pascuala R., with much effort and dedication, is devoted to raising pigs, a business that she runs out of her home, selling pork as well as selling the pigs themselves.

With the need to improve her business' conditions, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan which will allow her to purchase pigs to sell. She confidently hopes that her loan will be granted and that she can continue the upkeep of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Pascuala R. con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se dedica a su negocio de crianza de cerdos el cual los comercializa en su casa de habitación vendiendo la carne de cerdo y además ofreciendo los cerdos propiamente.

Con la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ha acudido a Ceprodel para recibir un crédito que le permita la compra de los cerdos para comercializarlos. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y así continuará con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase pigs.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia A. works very hard to continue repairing her home, which is located in the Villanueva minicipality of the city of Chinandega in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Today she comes to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase construction materials to continue doing much needed repairs and improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Claudia A. es una dama que se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el propósito de continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha iniciado a reparar en su localidad en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega del bello país de Nicaragua.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Isidro Augusto

texts.es:
Isidro P. earns a living farming in the Villanueva municipality of the city of Chinandega. This is the only source of income he receives to maintain his humble home. Since he lives in a very remote area he does not have access to electricity. Due to this he has purchased a solar panel.

He has now come to Ceprodel to request a loan so that he can pay this debt and continue to maintain his home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Isidro P. se dedica a su negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega siendo este el único ingreso que él percibe para mantener su humilde hogar de habitación. La necesidad atravesada por él es que por vivir en una zona muy alejada, no poseen energía eléctrica y por este motivo ha adquirido un panel solar para iluminarse.

La necesidad que él atraviesa hoy en día es que necesita cancelar esta deuda y para ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual pagar esta deuda y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel for his home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 51 years old. She is married with five children. Four of her children have completed senior high school and are waiting for their script to enter university next year.

Mercy owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies and biscuits. She wants to use this loan to buy a bulk stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders and other items. She wants to increase her stock in the current season to avoid price hikes due to the food crisis. Mercy hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to finance her children’s education and to provide them with life opportunities better than what she has had.

She belongs to the community group called Humility Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy a bulk stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders and other iteams

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, thirty seven years old, is married with four children. All of her children are currently in school.

Ruth has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past eight years. Ruth is very skillful and a talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. She wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators. This will allow her to avoid shortages and poor service.

Ruth hopes to raise a good income to finance the education of her children. She is a member of the community group called Humility Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral access to loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista Ríos works very hard to be able to make improvements to his home, which has been damaged by natural disasters for a long time. To be able to continue with the repairs he has reached out to Ceprodel to obtain a loan. He will use it to purchase construction materials. He hopes he can obtain the loan to continue supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Juan Bautista Ríos es una persona que se dedica a laborar arduamente con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda el cual por mucho tiempo ha sido maltratada por los fenómenos adversos.

Por esta razón ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para continuar con la reparación ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus materiales de construcción. Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para así continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase contraction materials

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria O. lives in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She works very hard to be able to make improvements to her home, which has been in disrepair for a long time.

She is the mother of two children and she wishes to provide appropriate living conditions for their development. This is the reason she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan. She will use it to purchase construction materials to continue remodeling her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Maria O. se dedica a trabajar fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo se ha encontrado en mal estado en su localidad.

Ella es madre de dos hijos y con la necesidad de brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Por ello se apoya de Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con la remodelación de su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 53 years old. She is married with three children. All of her children are in school.

Dora is a petty trader who supplies dry pepper, salt and spices to food vendors and local restaurant operators. She obtains her supplies from the local farmers in the surrounding villages. She sells to food vendors at wholesale prices. Dora wants to use this loan to buy a bulk supply of dry pepper, salt and assorted spices to serve her customers. She believes this will help her to raise more income for her family. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Wonderful Jesus Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of dry pepper, salt and assorted spices.

loans.name: Ivania Esperanza

texts.es:
Ivania I. works very hard to improve the condition of her home which has been affected by natural disasters for a long time.

Irina has multiplied her efforts to continue rebuilding her home, as she is responsible for providing shelter for her children. She now comes to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase the building materials necessary to repair and maintain her humble home, located in the Villanueva municipality, in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ivania I. se dedica a laborar fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado grandes dificultades ya que ha sido afectada por los fenómenos naturales.

Con la responsabilidad de albergar a sus hijos ella, ha multiplicado sus esfuerzos para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa. Por este motivo ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar en su mantenimiento de su humilde hogar y con una alta seguridad para su pequeño en su sector de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Rosemary has been trading in the local market of Koforidua in Ghana. She is a thirty-four-year-old woman and she is married with two children. Both of her children are in school.

Rosemary is a busy petty trader, who sells palm oil, rice, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize and dried fish, among other items. She sells them at her table in the local market. She is convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. Therefore, she wants this loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
In Villanueva municipality, located in the city of Chinandega lives Santiago Álvarez. He works very hard to better his living conditions.

Santiago and his family have endured a lack of electricity in their home for a long time because they live in a very remote area. For this reason, Santiago bought a solar panel that allows them to have power in their home. Now Santiago has come to Ceprodel requesting a loan to pay for the solar panel and in this manner continue to make improvements in his home and support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Santiago Álvarez se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones necesarias de su hogar.

Por mucho tiempo él en conjunto con su familia ha atravesado la problemática de no tener energía eléctrica por habitar en una zona muy alejada. Por esta razón es que adquirió un panel solar para obtener la energía eléctrica y de esta manera iluminarse. Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para el pago del panel solar y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su vivienda y su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel for his home.

loans.name: Constancia Maria

texts.es:
Constancia María V. comes from the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She has three children whom she supports and provides for, in hopes that they do well in school.

Currently she is starting to repair her house which has been damaged by natural disasters. For this reason she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase the building materials she needs. In this manner she will be able to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Constancia María V. es originaria del municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre de tres hijos los cuales mantiene brindándoles todas las necesidades para que estos se desarrollen en sus estudios. Hoy en día ha iniciado a reparar su casa de habitación por haber estado con grandes fallas producidas por los fenómenos naturales.

Por esto es que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción y para continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali F. is 33 years old, married and the father of four children. He and his family live near the town of Tyr in south Lebanon. Ali owns a bakery, and has applied for a loan of $1,200 to complete the purchase of a piece of land. Owning this propriety will help Ali improve his family's life. Ali has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past three years, and always repays loans on time.

loans.use: To complete the purchase of a piece of land

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad D. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and six children in the town of Tyr in south Lebanon. Jihad is an animal farmer. He owns cows and sells their milk, while his wife makes dairy products like labneh, a type of yogurt that the people of Lebanon love to eat for breakfast with Arabic bread.  Because expenses are high and income low in this line of work, Jihad believes that he must find another source of income to guarantee a better life for his family. That is why he has applied for a loan of $1,200, his first from Al Majmoua, to buy a herd of sheep.

loans.use: To buy a herd of sheep

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa A. Z. is 28 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in a village near Tyr in south Lebanon. Moussa makes a living running a grocery store, and has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods to sell to his customers. This is the first time that he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim H. is 31 years old, single and lives with his parents in a small village near Tyr in south  Lebanon. Ibrahim is a mechanic who repairs and resells cars, and he needs a loan for $900 to buy used cars and spare parts for them. This loan will help him improve his business. Ali has been a client with Al Majmoua for the past four years, and has successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy used cars and spare parts for them.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. is 40 years old, single and lives in a village near Tyr in south Lebanon.  He has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past four years. Ali is a hairdresser for men and looks forward to meeting all the needs of his clients. To do this, he has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy new equipment for his shop. Ali is a responsible man who has successfully repaid previous loans.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for a hairdressing and barber shop

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad S. is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Al Houch in south Lebanon. Fouad is a car mechanic who specializes in repairing tail pipes. Lately, this business has suffered from high costs and low profits, so Fouad is looking for a new source of income to expand his business and guarantee a better life for his family. That is why he has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy, repair and resell used cars. Fouad has been a client with Al Majmoua for the past eight years, and has always proved to be a trustworthy and reliable customer.

loans.use: To buy, repair and resell used cars

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar M. is 20 years old, single and lives in a village close to Tyr in south Lebanon. Despite her young age, Samar is ambitious, brave and loves challenges. She has opened a small beauty salon where she does hair, and needs a loan for $1,000 to complete the purchase of equipment for her new business. This is Samar's first loan application with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To complete the purchase of equipment for a new beauty salon

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 45 years old, single and lives in a small village near the town of Tyr in south Lebanon. Mahmoud is a contractor, and wants to get married soon. He needs $1,200 to finish building his own house, and has applied for his first loan Al Majmoua to make this possible.

loans.use: To finish building his own house

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 40 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives with his family in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Mahmoud owns a café, and his enthusiasm and energy continually help his business grow. Mahmoud needs a loan of $1,000 to buy large umbrellas, more tables and chairs and more goods to sell from his café. There is a clear demand for his services because during the summer season, Mahmoud's is not able to satisfy all the people who would like to eat and drink in his cafe. This is his first loan application with Al Majmoua, but he is confident that this loan will allow him to meet the demands of all of his clients.

loans.use: To buy umbrellas, more tables and chairs, and more goods to sell from his café.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is 57 years old and he married Martiniana, who is 48 years old a long time ago. They both have raised two children who still live with them. Both Pablo and his wife were working as civil servants until they retired and decided to open a business selling all kinds of electrical appliances. They both feel the desire to keep on working. Pablo mentions that they went through many difficult moments because his wife fell ill and had to continue several long and costly treatments. Nowadays they have overcome the above-mentioned problem and they thanks God for it. His dream is to consolidate in his business branch and to constitute an important business of selling of electrical appliances in his area. This time they need a loan to buy of more electrical appliances because he has a high demand of his goods.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Pablo tiene 57 años de edad y está casado hace bastante tiempo con Martiniana que tiene 48 años. Ambos han criado a dos hijos que aún viven con la pareja. Tanto Pablo como su esposa trabajaban como funcionarios públicos hasta que se jubilaron y decidieron abrir un negocio de venta de electrodomésticos de todo tipo. Ambos se sienten con ganas de seguir trabajando. Pablo comenta que pasaron por muchos momentos difíciles debido a que su esposa enfermó y tuvo que seguir varios tratamientos largos y costosos. Hoy días tienen superado dicho problema y dan gracias a Dios por haberlo logrado. Su sueño es afianzarse en el ramo y constituir un negocio importante de ventas de electrodomésticos de la zona. En esta oportunidad necesitan de un préstamo para compra de más electrodomésticos debido a que tiene bastante demanda de sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Buy appliances like blenders, tvs, etc.

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama H. is 41 years old, has four children and works as a janitor for a building in Saida in south Lebanon. He makes a living offering his services to residents and commercial tenants in the building. Oussama's house was destroyed during the war of July, 2006, and he needs a loan of $1,000 to renovate it and thereby assure a better life for his family. This is Oussama's first loan request from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Mehyeddin

texts.en: Mehyeddin K. is 27 years old, married and has three children. He and his family live near the town of Saida in south Lebanon. Mehyeddin owns a café, and needs a loan of $700 to expand and diversify the inventory of items he has to sell, especially his selection of hubble bubbles, a type of hookah. This is Mehyeddin's first loan request from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To diversify the inventory of items he has to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamed S. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Mohamed is a very hardworking man who is determined to make a difference in his family's life. He owns a coffee shop located next door to his home and is well known for the excellent taste of his hubble bubbles, a type of hookah. He needs a loan for $1,000, his first from Al Majmoua, to restore his house and thereby improve the life of his family.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Abdellatif

texts.en: Abdellatif B. is 32 years old, single and lives in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. He is a hair stylist and barber for men, and is known for the special creativity and cleverness with which he approaches his work. He has applied for a loan of $1,200, his first from Al Majmoua, to buy the ingredients he needs to make his own line of hair gel.

loans.use: To buy raw materials needed to make hair gel.

loans.name: Bienestar En Dios Ii Bank Of Hope Group 7

texts.en:
Aida lives with her husband and three children, ages 8, 7 and 2, in a rural area outsiD. of the city of El Seibo, along the road to L. Romana. She has a small business selling clothes and gasoline from home. Neighbors can buy clothes from her easily without having to travel into the city. Because she lives along a main road, there are many travelers who stop at her house for gasoline. She enjoys being able to work from home because she can spend time taking care of her kids, cooking and cleaning the house.

This will be Aida´s first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use the loan money to buy more clothes and gasoline to grow her business and make more money. She wants her children to be able to continue their studies and graduate with a good degree so they can have a better life. One day, she would love to be able to have her own house, since right now they are just renting.

Note: This is a group loan for Aida and four of her neighbors. This group has recently been added to the Bank of Hope called Bienestar en Dios II ( Contentment in God), a larger collective of groups of five that work in solidarity to be able to pay off their loans.

loans.use: To grow her clothing business and better provide for her 3 kids.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat E. is 51 years old and the father of seven children. He lives in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Izzat makes a living repairing cars. Because costs have been high and income low in his current line of work, he is considering a new source of income. He has applied for a loan of $1,000, his first from Al Majmoua, to buy, repair and resell a used car.

loans.use: To buy, repair and resell a used car.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim A. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. He has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past seven years, and has consistently proved his trustworthiness and his strong commitment to raise a happy family. He works as a taxi driver, and needs a loan of $1,200 to buy a new motor for the vehicle that is the sole source of revenue for his family.

loans.use: $1,200 to buy a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 55 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Khaled repairs cars for a living. In order to earn more money for his family, he also works as a taxi driver. He needs a loan of $1,000 to buy new equipment that will help him expand his car-repair shop. Khaled has been client with Al Majmoua for the past four years and always repays his loans on-time.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for a car-repair shop

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamed is 41 years old, the father of two children and lives in the suburbs of Saida in south  Lebanon. Mohamed owns a coffee shop, and has used previous loans from Al Majmoua to start his business and improve it. He now needs a loan of $1,200 to buy aluminum display windows for his shop. This is a step up because it will allow Mohamed to attract more clients. Mohamed has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past two years and has always made payments on time.

loans.use: To buy aluminum display windows for his shop

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamed is 26 years old, single and lives in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Mohamed is a very responsible man whose #1 priority in life is improving his business. He owns a car-repair shop and also manages a small animal farm. He has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy spare parts to use in his car-repair business. Mohamed has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past two years, and always repays his loans on time. The first loan he requested from our organization was to buy livestock to establish his farm.

loans.use: To buy spare parts with which to repair cars

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 27 years old, single and lives in Saida, in south Lebanon. He is an ambitious young man who supports himself making various products out of wood. He has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy more inventory, which he will use to expand his business and guarantee its sustainability. This is the first time that Ahmad has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a woodworking shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa has sold candy and orange juice for five years. She began making breakfasts, which she has stopped selling for the moment, for health reasons.

Nevertheless, every day Rosa goes out and sells from five in the morning until 1 in the afternoon on the main street near her home. The loans that Rosa has requested are for the purpose of building rooms in her home so that she can rent them out. Her husband is a bricklayer and he has been put in charge of the construction. She would like to have a soda fountain in the market where she could offer all types of juices.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende golosinas y jugo de naranja desde hace 5 años. Empezó haciendo desayunos, los cuáles ha dejado de vender por el momento, por motivo de salud. Sin embargo, Rosa todos los días sale a vender, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, en una avenida principal cerca de su casa. Los préstamos que Rosa ha solicitado le han servido para construir cuartos dentro de su casa y poder alquilarlos. Su esposo es albañil y él se ha encargado de la construcción. A ella le gustaría poder tener una fuente de soda en el mercado donde ofrecer todo tipo de jugos.

loans.use: Build rooms in her home so that she may rent them out.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa was selling pasta wholesale, but her business failed due to debt. Then she had to start all over, washing clothes for third parties. However, two years ago, Felipa received a little capital from her sister-in-law in the form of repayment for a loan Felipa had made to her. With this money, she decided to put a mini-store in her house. Over the months, she managed to build up her business so that now it is well-stocked with products thanks to the loans she has received. She wants to keep building up her business and sell more necessities, and she would like to put in a public telephone.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa vendía fideos por mayor, sin embargo su negocio quebró por motivo de deudas. Tuvo que empezar desde cero, lavando ropa para terceras personas. Sin embargo, hace 2 años, Felipa recibió de su cuñada un pequeño capital de dinero, en retribución a una ayuda prestada. Con este monto, ella decidió poner una mini-bodega en su casa. Con el pasar de los meses, Felipa ha podido hacer crecer su negocio, que ahora luce surtido de productos, gracias a los préstamos que ella ha solicitado. Ella quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y vender más productos de primera necesidad. Asimismo, le gustaría poner un teléfono público.

loans.use: To build up her business and buy merchandise

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar has been a taxi driver for 12 years. For the last two years he has also been selling beer in his house and in sporting events happening in his neighborhood. For this, he brings his tent, tables and chairs, and sells liquor at the regional championships.

Julio loans money on his own to third parties.

The loans which he has solicited have allowed him to buy the beer, and in turn, give loans to his acquaintances.

Julio Cesar would like to have a place to start a bar and liquor store.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio César es mototaxista desde hace 12 años. Sin embargo, desde hace dos, él también se dedica a vender cerveza en su casa y en eventos deportivos realizados en su barrio. Para esto, él lleva su carpa, sillas y mesas, y empieza a vender licor en los campeonatos vecinales.

Asimismo, Julio César presta dinero a terceras personas.

Los préstamos que el ha solicitado le han servido para pagar la cerveza y, a su vez, dar préstamo a sus conocidos.

A Julio César le gustaría tener un local en donde montar un bar-licorería.

loans.use: To buy beer and loan money to his acquaintances

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: José Elias

texts.es:
José Elías G. is a father of three children and is responsible for taking care of and providing for them. To improve their quality of life, José has begun to rebuild their house, which currently isn’t in good condition. To do this he has relied on loans from Ceprodel to get ahead.

To continue rebuilding his house, Juan again has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to buy construction materials. With this goal in mind he hopes his loan will be approved so he can continue improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El caballero José Elías G. actualmente es padre de tres hijos con la responsabilidad de mantener y brindarles la cobertura que ellos necesitan. Para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, al no tener buenas condiciones su vivienda, ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación y para ello se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para salir adelante.

Para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación, una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los matearles de construcción. Por este motivo es que espera confiadamente en que su crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has been dedicated to sewing for 20 years. She used to sew uniforms for a company. She then started to sew clothing that she gave to her friends, who would sell it at markets.

Currently, her neighbors and her husband's co-workers order clothing from her. Mercedes has three sewing machines, and her daughter helps her with her work.

The loans that she has requested have served her to have her sewing machine repaired and to purchase fabric.

Mercedes would like to keep making clothing, but she would also like to start a business with her daughter. She has thought about starting a detergent store or a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes se dedica a la costura desde hace 20 años. Antes cosía los uniformes de una empresa. Luego empezó a coser ropa y se los daba a sus amigas, quienes lo vendían en los mercados.

En la actualidad, sus vecinos y los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo le hacen pedidos de ropa. Mercedes cuenta con tres máquinas de costura. Su hija le ayuda con los trabajos de costura.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para mandar a reparar su máquina remalladora y para comprar telas.

A Mercedes le gustaría seguir confeccionando ropa, pero también quisiera poner un negocio con su hija. Ha pensado poner una tienda de detergentes o un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: To have her sewing machine repaired and to purchase fabric

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victorino is a 47-year-old sacrificed tailor. He married Lidia, who is 42 years old a long time ago. He has only one son who is 22 years old and helps him with his daily works, in addition to his studies at the university during the nights. Victorino tells us that he went through difficult times when he got married because he did not have a steady work, therefore he decided to go out to look for work abroad. He had a job in Buenos Aires for several years until one day he decided to return to the country to set up his own tailoring workshop with the money he saved during all this time. He has had his jacket-tailoring workshop for 12 years, which he delivers to a well-known store in the business. He mentions that he is doing well thanks to the fruit of his efforts and sacrifices. He has managed to construct his own house and to support all his family. His wish is to build a room at the back of his backyard where he would use for his workshop, because at present he is using his living room.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Victorino es un sacrificado sastre de 47 años de edad. Está casado hace bastante tiempo con Lidia que tiene 42 años de edad. Tiene un sólo hijo que hoy día cuenta con 22 años de edad y le ayuda en sus labores diarias, además de continuar con sus estudios universitarios por las noches. Victorino comenta que pasó momentos difíciles cuando se casó porque no tenía trabajo estable, por lo que decidió salir a buscar trabajo fuera del país.
