Consiguió trabajo en Buenos Aires por varios años hasta que un día decidió regresar al país para montar su propio taller de costura con lo ahorrado durante todo ese tiempo. Hace 12 años que cuenta con su taller de confección de sacos, los cuales entrega a una conocida casa dedicada al ramo. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que gracias al fruto de sus esfuerzos y sacrificios ha logrado construir su casa propia y dar de comer a toda su familia. Su anhelo es construir en el fondo de su patio un salón, el cual destinaría para su taller, debido a que actualmente trabaja en la sala de su casa.

loans.use: Buy different type of fabrics, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Mayerling

texts.es:
In the area of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Mayerling C. is dedicated, with much effort, to her agriculture business. This is the only source of income to support her family, which is made up of two small children who she loves so much.

Right now she is in need of a credit to purchase corn to sow, since it is now almost sowing season. She needs to obtain all of the supplies to carry it out. She is confidently hoping that her credit is offered to her, and in this way, she will be able to get ahead with her business and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Mayerling C. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de agricultura siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa es que le urge obtener un crédito para la compra del maíz para la siembra ya que al venir la temporada de la siembra, ella debe de obtener los insumos para llevarla a cabo. Espera confiadamente que su crédito será entregado y de esta manera saldrá adelante en su negocio mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to sow corn

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris has been a seamstress for 8 years, she does sequin embroideries. Since a year, she has been working for a woman who sends her sweaters and Doris’ task is to add them sequin embroideries.

She receives up to 100 sweaters per week. With this workload, she has asked her neighbors to work for her and pays them for the service they provide her.

Doris has already received other loans with which she buys the sequins she needs. Doris would like to continue with this business and work for an even bigger sweater’s company.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris se dedica a la costura desde hace 8 años. Ella ha trabajado haciendo bordados en lentejuelas. Sin embargo, desde hace un año, una señora intermediaria con una empresa le da chompas a Doris, las que tiene que coserlas con aplicaciones de bordado. Doris se encarga de comprar estas aplicaciones.

A la semana, Doris recibe alrededor de 100 chompas, por lo que tiene que buscar más personas que le ayuden en la costura. Por esta razón, ella paga a sus vecinas por el servicio prestado. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar las aplicaciones que cose en las chompas.

A ella le gustaría poder tener trato directo con alguna empresa grande y encargarse de coser aplicaciones de bordado.

loans.use: To buy material for embroideries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria learned to knit handbags in a community center five years ago. Since, she knits approximately ten handbags per week, with the help of an assistant.

Victoria then sells the handbags to friends or acquaintances at the local market and as a side activity, she also does farming.

With the loan, she will buy thread and other material she needs to knit her handbags and will pay her assistant as she would like to have more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria aprendió a hacer carteras en un centro vecinal. Por esta razón, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la confección de carteras a base de hilo. p> Ella teje alrededor de 10 carteras a la semana, con la ayuda de una compañera. Ella vende las carteras a sus amigos y conocidos que tiene en el mercado. Asimismo, Victoria también se dedica a la agricultura. p> Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los hilos y materiales que necesita en la confección de las carteras, y para pagar a su ayudante. Ella quisiera poder conseguir más clientes.

loans.use: To buy thread and other material to knit hanbags

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny has been dedicated to raising rabbits for 10 years. A non-governmental organization (NGO) provided her with the rabbits, which is how she has grown her business. Her customers met her through the NGO. She sells around 50 pairs of rabbits per month.

Jenny is also dedicated to agriculture and sells every day at a kiosk at a school.

The loans that she has requested have served her to expand the farm where she raises rabbits and to purchase candy that she sells at the school kiosk.

Jenny would like to become independent with her business of raising rabbits. Presently she belongs to an association of breeders.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Jenny se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace 10 años. Una ONG le proporcionó los cuyes, por lo que ella fue creciendo en su negocio. Sus clientes la conocieron por medio de la ONG. Vende alrededor de 50 pares de cuyes mensual.

Asimismo, Jenny se dedica a la agricultura y vende todos los días en el kiosco de un colegio.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para ampliar la granja donde cría los cuyes y para comprar las golosinas que vende en el kiosco escolar.

Jenny quisiera independizarse en el negocio de la crianza de cuyes, puesto que en la actualidad ella se encuentra asociada a un grupo de criadores.

loans.use: To expand the farm where she raises rabbits and to purchase candy to sell at her kiosk at a school.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia sells clothes since four years. Her mother in law has a stand at the market and she gives Cecilia a small space so she can also sell her merchandise. Cecilia sells baby clothes, underwear, amongst others.

She has used the loans she has already received to help her kids who go to school and to buy the clothes she sells. Cecilia would now like to have a market stand of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años. Su suegra tiene un puesto en el mercado, allí Cecilia tiene un pequeño espacio para realizar sus ventas. Ella vende ropa para niños, ropa interior, entre otros.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para ayudar a sus hijos en el colegio, y para comprar la ropa que ofrece. A Cecilia le gustaría contar con un puesto de ventas propio.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, to help her kids and to later on have a market stand of her own

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara's mom used to have a store, but she had to leave her business, and her daughter took over. This is how Sara has been dedicated to this type of sales for 15 years. She first had a grocery store, but it wasn't profitable, so now she sells office supplies and candy. She also has a photocopying service because there is a high school nearby.

The loans she has requested have served her to purchase more products for her store.

She would like to start a hardware store because people tell her it is a profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

L. mamá D. Sara tenía una tienda, pero elL. tuvo que dejar el negocio y se lo encargó a su hija. Es así que Sara se dedica a este tipo D. ventas desD. hace 15 años. Primero tuvo una bodega, pero no le resultó rentable, por lo que ahora se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. oficina y golosinas. También hace servicio D. fotocopias, ya que hay un colegio cerca.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para L. compra D. más productos para su tienda.

ElL. quisiera poner una ferretería, ya que le han comentado que es un negocio provechoso.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy sells clothing closures wholesale. She buys the parts and then assembles them. She also sells self-adhesives for clothing and backpacks. Her husband is responsible for distributing the closures to different Lima markets. Also, for more than 20 years, Nancy has had a sewing shop in which she provides closure repair/exchange services. Her customers are her neighbors. In summer, Nancy makes doggy accessories. They have used their previous loans to buy closures. Nancy would like to build up her business and have more capital to buy more closures in the summer when they are less expensive and have more merchandise set aside for winter when demand increases.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy se dedica a la venta de cierres de ropa por mayor. Nancy arma los cierres, puesto que los compra por partes y por metraje. También vende autoadhesivos para ropa y mochilas. Su esposo se encarga de repartir los cierres en diferentes mercados de Lima. Asimismo, desde hace 20 años Nancy tiene una máquina de coser con la que se encarga de hacer servicios de cambio de cierre. Sus clientes son sus vecinos. En verano, Nancy fabrica accesorios para perros. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los cierres. Ella quisiera ampliar su negocio y tener un capital más grande para poder comprar más cantidad de cierres en verano, temporada en la que los cierres se abaratan. Y así tener mercadería guardada para invierno, cuando la demanda aumenta.

loans.use: For buying clothing closures to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has sold food for 5 years. She learned this business through her mother, who also was dedicated to this activity.

Every evening, starting at 5:30, she puts out tables and chairs on the patio outside her house and sells food until and after 10:00 at night.

Margarita used to work in a shoe store, but she had to stop this work because she had her first daughter. For her, the business of selling food is favorable, because she can stay home with her children.

The loans that she has received have served her to increase her capital and to invest in the purchase of ingredients that she needs to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Margarita vende comida desde hace 5 años. Ella conoció el negocio a raíz de su mamá, quien también se ha dedicado a esta actividad.

Todas las tardes, a partir de las 5.30, ella saca mesas y sillas al patio exterior de su casa, y vende comida hasta pasada las 10 de la noche.

Margarita antes trabajaba en un taller de zapatillas, pero tuvo que dejar este trabajo debido a que tuvo su primera hija. Para ella, el negocio de venta de comida le resulta propicio, ya que puede quedarse en casa con sus hijos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para incrementar su capital e invertir en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para sus comidas.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of ingredients that she needs to make her food

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia sells sea food in the streets. Before, she would sell the food outside of her home but she decided to move outside of the market as she had more clients there.

Silvia works from 9am to 14pm. She has used the loans she has already received to buy a tent and to buy a bigger food cart. She also bought a little display case where she can exhibit and keep the food.

However, Silvia would like now to have her own stand where she can set-up a sea-food restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia vende comida marina de forma ambulatoria desde hace 6 años. Antes ella vendía afuera de su casa, sin embargo, decidió mudarse afuera del mercado, puesto que había mayor cantidad de clientes. Ella trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprarse una carpa y ampliar su carreta de comidas. Asimismo, se compró un toldo y una vitrina pequeña donde exhibir sus platos de comida. A Silvia le gustaría tener un local donde montar un restaurante marino.

loans.use: To buy her own stand at the market to set-up a sea-food restaurant

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Zunilda is a 45-year-old active woman, she has been married to Domingo for 26 years. She has 6 children, they are 26, 23, 20, 18, 8 and 6 year old respectively. The oldest of her children is already working independently because he has a refrigeration workshop at home. The second one is already married and has her own family, whereas the others still live with her and are still in school. She mentions that she studied cooking and baking to help her husband with the family income, since he sells furniture but they needed an extra revenue. She started selling cakes upon request as well as savory and sweet snacks for special events like celebrations, holidays, birthday among others. Her main clients were teachers of a school of her area who were always placing orders to Zunilda. Since her meals are really good they asked her to be in charge of the school’s canteen. Since then 5 years have gone by and she tells us that she has work for a long time because the directors of the school are very happy with her work due to the quality of the food she prepares. Her biggest dream is to be able to construct a room in her house one day, where she might set up a small grocery store and this way to be able to stay more time at home with her children. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy goods as: candies, sodas, French fries, and ingredients to prepare her fast food like meat, egg, lettuce, tomato, flour, oil, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Zunilda es una activa mujer de 45 años de edad, está casada con Domingo hace 26 años. Tiene 6 hijos de 26 , 23, 20, 18, 8 y 6 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos ya cuenta con un trabajo independiente debido a que posee un taller de refrigeración que funciona en su casa. La segunda ya está casada y ha formado su propio hogar, mientras que los demás aún viven con ella y continúan estudiando. Ella comenta que estudió cocina y repostería para ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar, ya que el mismo se dedica a la venta de muebles pero necesitaban de un ingreso extra. Fue así que ella empezó a vender tortas (pasteles) bajo pedido al igual que bocaditos salados y dulces para eventos especiales como festejos, fiestas, cumpleaños entre otros. Sus principales clientas eran profesoras de un colegio de la zona que siempre le hacían pedidos a Zunilda y como su comida era muy rica le pidieron que se encargue de la cantina de la escuela del barrio. Desde aquel entonces ya han transcurrido 5 años y cuenta de que tiene trabajo para rato debido a que los directores de la escuela están muy conformes con su trabajo debido a la calidad de los alimentos que prepara. Su mayor sueño es el de construir algún día un salón frente a su casa en donde podría montar una pequeña despensa y así quedarse más tiempo en su casa para compartirlo con sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: golosinas, gaseosas, papas fritas, e ingredientes para elaborar sus comidas rápidas como carne, huevo, lechuga, tomate, harina, aceite, entre otros.

loans.use: Buy candies, sodas, French fries, and ingredients to prepare her fast food like meat, egg, lettuce, tomato, flour, oil, among others.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
My name is Juana C. G. and I have been a merchant for more than 30 years. I started as a street vendor selling baby clothes in the “El Guarda” market in the city of Guatemala.

After many years, I wanted to expand my business and with my husband’s help, I succeeded in getting my own shop and now we sell bulk clothing,

With the requested loan, I would like to buy more merchandise as my clients have offered me to buy several batches of clothing. However, for that I need an important amount of capital as I have many clients. I thank God because my clients come see me often as I am well located in the market and I like to offer them a good variety of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Juana C. G., desde hace más de treinta años que me dedico al comercio, inicie con la venta de ropa para bebés, en el mercado el guarda en la zona 11 de la ciudad capital y de forma ambulante.

Después de muchos años, he querido agrandar mi negocio y conseguí un local y con el apoyo de mi esposo pudimos poner la venta de ropa clasificada o de paca como se conoce, con el crédito quiero invertir para comprar mercadería para surtir ya que me ofrecen la oportunidad de comprar varios lotes de ropa, pero para ello necesito una buena cantidad de capital, ya que gracias a Dios, mis clientes me buscan mucho ya que tengo buena ubicación en el mercado y quiero poder ofrecer buena variedad a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise as my clients have offered me to buy several batches of clothing

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Selling used clothing is the main activity of more than 10 women who want to improve their standard of living, which is happening thanks to Pro-mujer. More than five years ago, they formed the May First Association in which they have many responsibilities. Every two weeks very early in the morning, they have to get bundles of used clothing, which they wash, iron and sell at the July 16 market in El Alto, an activity that is not worthwhile for the competition, they say. Now they want to buy wholesale to increase their profits, but for that they need capital to invest in wholesale merchandise. That way they can generate more income, which means they will be able to start saving to ensure a more secure future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

El comercio de ropa usada es la principal actividad de mas de 10 mujeres deseosas de mejorar su estilo de vida, que gracias a Pro-mujer lo están consiguiendo. Estas señoras hace mas de cinco años han formado la asociación “Primero de mayo” en la que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. Muy temprano cada quince días deben adquirir de mayoristas, fardos de ropa usada, que luego de lavarlas y plancharlas las venden en la feria “16 de Julio” de la Ciudad de El Alto, actividad que ya no es muy rentable por la competencia, afirman. Ahora ellas quieren comprar al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias, por eso necesitan capital para poder invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ahorrar para el asegurar un buen futuro para sus familias.

loans.use: Need capital to buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Miss Elena P. Díaz is thirty-two years old, is a single woman, who lives in the city of Ybycuí. She has worked as a hairdresser for eight years. As she did not have the opportunity to pursue her studies, from a young age, she had to emigrate to the neighboring country, Argentina, in search of work and better opportunities.

Once she was in Argentina, she found work as an assistant in the hairdresser’s, where she learned the profession. She worked and saved money for a good time until she succeeded in raising enough money to return to Paraguay and establish her own business. Today, Elena has a beautiful salon in the neighborhood that is always busy.

She is very eager to continue expanding her business. As a result, she wants a loan so that she will be able to buy supplies like creams, shampoo, conditioners, brushes, curlers, hair dyes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Elena P. Díaz tiene 32 años de edad, es de estado civil soltera vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí se desempeña como peluquera desde hace 8 años. Como no tuvo la posibilidad de realizar sus estudios de muy joven tuvo que emigrar al vecino país, Argentina, en busca de trabajo y mejores oportunidades.

Una vez en Argentina, ella consiguió trabajo como ayudante en una peluquería en donde aprendió la profesión, trabajo y ahorro por un buen tiempo hasta que logro reunir un capital para volver a Paraguay y montar su propio negocio. Así es como hoy día, Elena, tiene una hermosa peluquería muy concurrida en el barrio.

Ella está muy deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio por lo que desea un crédito para poder comprar insumos como cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores, cepillos, ruleros (tubos para el pelo), tinturas, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy supplies like creams, shampoo, conditioners, brushes, curlers, hair dyes, among other things

loans.name: Jawas Pancarita Group

texts.es:
In the Aymara language, Jawas Pancarita means "Water flowers". It is the name chosen by the 14-woman association, who has worked with Pro-Mujer for 10 years. In addition to the sales of food, cosmetics, and other things, the group's principal activity is the fabrication and sales of clothing. In general, they make jackets for all ages, products that they sell in bulk and individually. A few weeks ago, Jawas Pancarita received a large order for jackets due to higher demand during the winter season, which will double their earnings. In order to fill this large order, they need a large loan to purchase raw materials and supplies. This way they can improve their business and thier standards of living.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Flores de agua es la traducción de Jawas Pancarita, en idioma Aymará, denominación que adopta una asociación compuesta por 14 mujeres que trabajan hace mas de diez años con Pro-Mujer. Además de la venta de comida y venta de cosméticos entre otros, tienen como actividad principal la confección y venta de ropa, por lo general chamarras para todas las edades, productos que los ofrecen al por mayor y también al detalle. Hace unas semanas recibieron propuestas de mayores pedidos, ya que con el invierno sus productos tienen mayor demanda, lo que duplicaría sus ganancias, por lo tanto necesitan mayores créditos para la compra de insumos y materia prima, así poder realizar estos grandes pedidos, de esta manera mejorar sus negocios y su forma de vida.

loans.use: Capital needed to purchase raw materials to increase production.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca Z. is fifty-three years old. She lives with Mr. Simón Galeano Ortiz, who is sixty years old. They live in their own house in the city of Ybycuí. They own a well-stocked grocery that they established thanks to an inheritance that they had received from her father. 

A few years ago, Francisca closed her business because of a grave illness. After she received costly medical treatments, she had a complete recovery and returned to open her business. Because of this, she took out a loan, with which she bought merchandise that quickly gave her profits. 

At present, the business works well, but Francisca wants to continue expanding it. It is for this reason that she seeks a new loan that she will invest into the purchase of more merchandise for her grocery. 

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora  Francisca Z. tiene 53 años de edad vive en compañía del  señor Simón  Galeano Ortiz de 60 años de edad, viven en casa  propia en el centro  la ciudad de  Ybycuí,  son propietarios de una despensa bien surtida que dieron inicio gracias a una herencia que  habían  recibido de su padre.

Hace unos años Francisca cerró su negocio pues enfermo gravemente, luego de seguir costosos tratamientos médicos ella se recuperó totalmente y volvió a abrir su negocio para lo cual sacó en ese entonces un crédito. Con el crédito compro las mercaderías que pronto dieron sus frutos y beneficios.

Hoy día el negocio marcha muy bien, pero Francisca desea seguir expandiéndolo, para ello hoy solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías para su despensa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, meat, canned goods, cleaning products, soaps, snacks, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Marivel Pamela

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34436&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Marivel is partner of the village bank Cielo

Marivel is 24 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner in a house made of rustic material. She bakes bread typical for the region where she is from, using the oven of her father-in-law, and sells it at the Santa Clara market without having a stall.

Marivel needs a loan of 1000 soles which she would be invest in buying flour and baskets .

Marivel dreams of buying a car to being able to sell her bread across the city, having her own house, and getting married.

loans.use: Marivel needs a loan of 1000 soles which she would be invest in buying flour and baskets .

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila A. is fifty-two years old, is married to Crispín Garcete, and has four children, all of legal age. It has been ten years since Petronila opened her grocery in the area of Costa Peña de Acahay with the help of her father-in-law, who gave her a house located in an area well-suited for her business.

In order to start her grocery, Petronila had to sell a cow her family owned. With this sale, she was able to buy merchandise, such as rice, noodles, grass, oil, etc, for her business. Thus, they were able to begin this activity in order to go forward.

Thanks to the profit that this activity has generated for Petronila, she was able to pay for her children’s education, and these children now have families of their own.

Before this activity Petronila and Crispín worked only on agriculture, and according to Crispín, now it is not possible to live only off of agriculture because there is no venue to market the goods. As a result, they work at the grocery so that they can settle their expenses. Their dream is that their grandchildren have a place where they can work and spend their free time.

They are requesting a loan so that they can buy an industrial stove with six burners with which they will be able to cook food and serve it to workers and office workers in the area. At present they are beginning to earn good profits serving food to some workers in the area. As a result, Petronila wants to increase the number of people that eat lunch at her business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer

Petronila A. tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con Crispín Garcete y tienen 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Petronila nos cuenta que hace 10 año abrió su despensa en la compañía de Costa Peña de Acahay con la ayuda de su suegro, que le regaló una casa en un lugar muy bien ubicado para dicho negocio.

Según nos cuenta Petronila, para dar inicio a su despensa, ella tuvo que vender una vaca que tenían con la cual pudo comprar las mercaderías para su negocio como arroz, fideo, yerba, aceite, etc. y así pudieron emprender esta actividad para poder salir adelante.

Gracias a la ganancia que le ha generado esta actividad pudieron pagar la educación de hijos que hoy día también ya son padres de familia.

Antes de esta actividad se dedicaban solamente a la agricultura, y según Crispín hoy día ya no se puede vivir solamente de la agricultura porque no tienen mercado para su comercialización y deben dedicarse a otra actividad para poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Sueñan que sus nietos puedan tener un lugar donde puedan trabajar y ocupar su tiempo libre.

Solicitan un préstamo para la compra de una cocina de 6 hornallas del tipo industrial con el que podrán cocinar comidas y dar de comer a trabajadores y oficinistas de la zona, pues actualmente están empezando buenas ganancias dando de comer a unos obreros de la zona, por lo que Petronila desea ampliar la cantidad de gente que almuerza en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=26732&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Marina is a partner of the village bank “Yachay Wasi” (Quechua for “House of Knowledge”)

Maria is 49 years old, has one daughter and lives with her partner. Maria is a nurse by profession. She sells cosmetic products via catalogue, and natural remedies that she offers to friends, family members and employees of organizations. Maria also produces apple vinegar which she sells to relatives and close friends. She also gives diet advice.

Maria needs a loan of 1500 soles, which would be invested in buying natural products.

Maria dreams of having her own capital, improving her house and creating a business dedicated to diets.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1500 soles, which would be invested in buying natural products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34154&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Cecilia is partner of the village bank Amaquella (Quetchua for “Don’t Loose”).

Cecilia lives with her partner and 4 children. She is 46 years old. Together with her partner, Cecilia sells “cebiche” (a typical Peruvian dish made of fish prepared with lemon) from a tricycle on the street in front of the Univesrity of Ayacucho every day, while her partner sells cebiche from his parents’ home.

Cecilia needs a loan of 1200 soles, which would be invested in buying fish, lemon and sweet potato.

Cecilia’s dream is to expand her business into a big restaurant and to build a house.

loans.use: Cecilia needs a loan of 1200 soles, which would be invested in buying fish, lemon and sweet potato.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
Remigia is thirty-nine years old. She is a single mother of a four-year-old girl. At present, she lives with her parents, who are under her care. Her four siblings had to travel to other countries in search of new opportunities because of the lack of work in their country. They were the main funders for Remigia; with the money that she received from them, Remigia could establish her grocery and could buy merchandise, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

She is a very sacrificing person and is always ready to continue fighting in order to achieve a better quality of life. She considers the loan to be a fundamental tool for her business.

She wants to continue expanding her business. It is now necessary for her to buy a freezer, which would allow her to sell frozen products, especially meat products.

Translated from Spanish by A.Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Remigia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años de edad; actualmente reside en la casa de sus padres quienes están bajo su cuidado. Sus cuatro hermanos tuvieron que viajar a otros países en busca de nuevos horizontes por la falta de empleo en nuestro país; ellos fueron los principales capitalistas para Remigia, ya que con el dinero que recibió de ellos, ella pudo montar su despensa y comprar mercaderías tales como arroz, azúcar, fideo etc.

Ella demuestra ser persona muy sacrificada, dispuesta siempre a seguir luchando para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida, y, considera al crédito como una herramienta fundamental para su negocio.

Ella desea seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio, para ello hoy día está necesitando comprar un congelador (freezer) que le permitirá vender productos congelados especialmente productos cárnicos.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Sabiduría Group

texts.es:
The Sabiduría II Communial Bank is a bank that was started recently with 27 members. Some of the members were invited by members of other communal banks and others were invited by the promoters.

The members have different businesses such as selling fish, fruits, handicrafts, vegetables, groceries, cosmetics by catalog, spare parts and clothing. They sell in different markets in the city of AyaC., in their homes and some sell by traveling from place to place.

The members need loans of different amounts. Some loans are for 300 soles or 600 soles but make up a grand total of 12,600 soles in loans from the communal bank.

The loans will be used to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.

The dreams of the members are to grow their businesses, have their own home, buy nice things and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. El Banco Comunal Sabiduría II es un banco que recién inicia con 27 socias, algunas de las socias fueron invitadas por socias de otros Bancos Comunales, otras fueron invitadas por las promotora.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta pescado, frutas, artesanía, verduras, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, repuestos y ropa.

Sus ventas los realizan en diferentes mercados de la ciudad de AyaC., en sus casas y algunas de manera ambulatoria,

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 12,600 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de tomate, zanahoria, cebolla, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, perfumes, pinturas, pescados, repuestos, chompas y casacas.

Los sueños de las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia, comprar sus artefactos y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Mr. Marcos V. is from Barrio Navidad-Guayaybi. He is twenty-nine years old, is married to Mrs. Teodora Martinez, who is twenty-seven years old, and does not have any children. Marcos has been the owner of a grocery store and a butcher shop with his own premises for two years. His wife helps him by tending to the business. They have a good stock of merchandise and theirs is the best-known business in the area. The townspeople appreciate Marcos and Teodora a great deal because they are good, hard-working, and kind people.

In the future, Marcos would like to be able to buy a car so that he can deliver merchandise to the homes of his customers that live in remote areas. Thus, he will be able to increase his income and his clientele.

Now, he has decided to seek out a loan with which he will supply more merchandise in order to make more income. He would also like to supply a greater variety of products so that his store can continue to be the preferred business of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marcos V. es del Barrio Navidad-Guayaybi, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Teodora Martínez de 27 años de edad y aún no tienen hijos. Marcos es propietario de una despensa y carnicería con local propio hace ya 2 años. Su señora la ayuda con la atención del negocio, tienen buen stock de mercaderías y es el negocio más conocido de la zona, la gente del barrio los aprecia bastante por ser buena gente, trabajadora y amable.

Marcos desea más adelante poder comprar un vehículo para poder realizar trabajos de repartos de mercaderías a domicilio a sus clientes que se encuentran más alejados, y así poder aumentar sus ingresos y la clientela.

Hoy día el tiene pensado solicitar un crédito con el que surtirá de mayor cantidad de mercaderías ya que para obtener mayores ingresos debe surtir más la variedad de productos que vende para seguir siendo el negocio preferido por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy meat, dairy products, products for cleaning and for the home, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Mr. Nelson Ramón M. Cuenca is from Jejui in the district of Choré. He is 27 years old and married to Mrs. Pelagia M. de Irala, who is 28 years of age. They have 2 children and their own home.

In his neighborhood, he operates a well-stocked clothing business, which makes customers giver preference to his shop. His wife helps him run the business, which has been operating now for 2 years. Aside from his clothing shop, he also owns a property in which he raises cattle for both milk and meat sales.

The customer would like to keep expanding his business and increase his merchandise, as well as start selling home products, thus diversifying his selection. Some of the items he will purchase with the loan are t-shirts, pants, winter clothing, buttons, zippers, tablecloths, cups, jugs, and utensils, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Nelson Ramón M. Cuenca es de Jejui distrito de Choré, tiene 27 años de edad, casado con la señora Pelagia M. de Irala de 28 años de edad, tienen casa propia, y 2 hijos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropas en general en su barrio, cuenta con buen stock de mercaderías en su negocio lo que hace que sus clientes tengan preferencia de compra en su local. Su señora la ayuda con la atención del negocio que ya tiene 2 años de funcionamiento. Además de su ropería también tiene una propiedad en donde tiene animales vacunos que cría para la venta de leche y carne.

El cliente quiere creciendo y aumentar el stock de mercaderías de su ropería, y también la venta de otros artículos varios para el hogar, así el diversificará las mercaderías que ofrece en su negocio. Algunas de las cosas que comprará son remeras, pantalones, ropa de invierno, mercaderías para mercería como botones, cierres, manteles, vasos, jarras, utensilios entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and home products

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Mrs. Dominga P. Flores is from the city of San Estanislao. She is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Antoliano Vergara, age 61. They have 4 children and live in their own home.

They have a well-stocked general and notions store called “Luisito” in their home with an established client-base that generates good profits for them.

They have good personal and business references, which has led Fundación Paraguaya to provide them with loans every time they have requested them. On this occasion, she wishes to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to generate better profits, thus improving her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dominga P. Flores es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada con el Señor Antoliano Vergara de 61 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos, y viven en su casa propia.

Tiene una despensa, y mercería que se llama “Luisito” en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, y un buen stock de mercaderías, lo que le genera buenos ingresos.

Tienen excelente referencias comerciales y personales, lo que ha hecho que Fundación Paraguaya le otorgue créditos siempre que el lo solicite. En esta ocasión desea comprar más mercaderías para su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as meat, dairy, sweets, cleaning products, home products, etc.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Mrs. Simona S. de Cardozo is from the Santa Bárbara neighborhood in San Estanislao (Santaní). She is a 57-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Francisco Ignacio, age 63. They currently have 2 children and live in their own house.

They own a general store called “El buen Samaritano” (The Good Samaritan) that they operate in their home. They have been in business for 6 years and are proud to say that they have been prosperous and have many customers.

Simona and her husband are well-known in the area and have very good personal and business references. They would now like to obtain a loan with which they will purchase more goods since their customers are more and more demanding and want a greater variety of products and brands.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Simona S. de Cardozo es de la ciudad de San Estanislao (Santaní) del Barrio Santa Bárbara, ella tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Francisco Ignacio Cardozo, de 63 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos y viven en su casa propia.

Ambos son propietario de una Despensa; llamado “El buen Samaritano” en su domicilio particular, ellos ya llevan seis años de haber emprendido este negocio y cuentan con orgullo que les va muy bien y tienen bastante clientela.

Simona y su esposo son bastante conocidos en la zona y poseen muy buenas referencias, tanto comerciales como personales. Hoy día ellos tienen pensado adquirir un crédito con el que compraran un mayor stock de mercaderías ya que sus clientes cada vez son más exigentes y desean variedad en sus productos y las marcas de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase canned goods (tuna, peas, corn, olives) and assorted goods such as mayonnaise, ketchup, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Mrs. Zulma Beatriz Ruiz D. is from the Ycua Paí neighborhood in the city of San Estanislao. She is a 33-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Dario Asunción Rojas, age 38. They have 4 children.

Zulma has a general store called “Panamby” which means “butterfly” in Guaraní. The store is located in her home and has been in business for 8 years, with a solid client-base and a good selection of merchandise. The business is frequented by the residents of the area who always purchase Zulma’s provisions.

Zulma is currently saving up money with which she would like to build a bigger space for her general store, thus expanding her business and offering a wider selection of goods. She would now like to obtain a loan to purchase goods for her general store so that she can increase her profits and later be able to expand her business space.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zulma Beatriz Ruiz D. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao del Barrio Ycua Paí, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Dario Asunción Rojas de 38 años de edad y tienen 4 hijos.

Zulma tiene una despensa llamada “Panamby” que en guaraní significa mariposa, la misma esta ubicada en su propia casa, tiene 8 años de funcionamiento, con buena clientela y un buen stock de mercaderías. El negocio es muy concurrido por los vecinos de la zona que siempre van a surtirse de cosas en su despensa.

Zulma actualmente está juntando unos ahorros con el que desea construir un salón más grande para su despensa y de este modo expandir el negocio y variar las mercaderías que vende. Hoy día tiene pensado adquirir con el crédito mercaderías para su despensa para aumentar sus ingresos y luego poder cumplir su sueño de construir un salón.

loans.use: Purchase cleaning supplies, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Mr. Alcides Agüero is a 33-year-old man who is married to Mrs. Dionicia Benitez, age 31. They live in the city of San Estanislao with their 3 lovely, school age children.

Alcides owns a well-stocked general store that has an established client-base, which generates good profits for him because of his excellent customer service.

Thanks to the loans that he previously obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, Mr. Alcides Agüero has managed to set up his business, which is his family’s main source of income. Now, he would like to obtain a new loan that he will invest in the purchase of assorted goods such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, and canned goods, among others, thus earning better profits from his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Alcides A. tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Dionicia Benitez de 31 años de edad, viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao, ellos son padres de 3 hermosos niños que aún van a la escuela.

Alcides es propietario de una despensa, que tiene un buen surtido, con clientela ya formada, lo que le genera buenos ingresos, ya que tiene un trato muy especial hacia sus clientes.

Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por la Fundación Paraguaya, el cliente Alcides Agüero ha logrado montar su negocio que es el principal sustento de su familia. Hoy día, el desea poder adquirir un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías varias para la venta en su despensa como azúcar, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, entre otros, logrando así un mayor ingreso en sus ventas.

Su proyecto para el futuro es habilitar una tienda de ventas de ropas en general. El y su esposa tienen excelentes referencias porque son muy trabajadores y emprendedores.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, and canned goods

loans.name: Loreto

texts.es:
Mr. Loreto P. is from the city of Itacurubi del Rosario. He is a 55-year-old man who is married to Mrs. Francisca Capdevil, age 49. Loreto owns a factory in which he makes horsecarts.

He has been in business for 12 years, and has established a strong client-base. He is a very hardworking man who has his entire family’s support. Thanks to his efforts, they are all getting ahead in life. He hopes that his children will be able to pursue a university education in the capital city, and he will give them all the support they need.

With the loan that he is currently requesting, Loreto will set up a car wash—which his son will be running—thus increasing the family income with this new venture. Loreto already has the business space, but what he now needs to kick start the business are things like water hoses, cleaning products, motor oil, office furniture, and industrial vacuum cleaners, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Loreto es de la ciudad de Itacurubi del Rosario. Tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Francisca Capdevila de 49 años. Loreto tiene una fábrica de Carros que son estirados a caballos.

Ya van 12 años que trabaja en esta actividad, y ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada. Es un señor muy trabajador que tiene el apoyo de toda la familia, y gracias a su gran esfuerzo están saliendo todos adelante. Su deseo es que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la Universidad en la capital y poder brindarles todo el apoyo necesario.

Con este préstamo que solicita, Loreto habilitará un lavadero para vehículos donde su hijo estará atendiendo, de este modo incrementarán con un nuevo proyecto los ingresos de la familia. Loreto ya posee el local lo que necesita ahora es montarla con los accesorios necesarios como mangueras, productos de limpieza, aceites para vehículo, algunos muebles de oficina, aspiradoras industriales, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase materials to set up a car wash

loans.name: Comité Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
In the city of Yaguarón, located 15 km away from one of our offices in the city of Paraguarí, women with the desire to start business activities got together in order to increase their capital and improve their families’ living conditions. These women got in touch with Fundación Paraguaya in order to get involved with the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Committee) program. They gladly accepted the opportunity that the Fundación Paraguaya offered them, since no other institution had given them a chance to do so.

The committee is called “Kuña Guapa,” which means “Working Woman” in the Garran language. This group, which is currently in its third cycle with an excellent credit history, is comprised of 15 active and enterprising women. Their businesses include: general stores, fruit and vegetable sales, seamstresses, clothing sales, undergarment sales, handicrafts, soft drink sales, etc.

This group has received loans which are then invested in the women’s businesses as well as used for savings. In order for them to succeed with their investments, Fundación Paraguaya has provided training for the groups.

At this time, they would like to obtain a new loan which they will be able to invest in their different business activities, thus managing to yield greater profits from their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 15 Km. de una de nuestras oficina ubicada en la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Estas mujeres se pusieron en contacto con la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse sobre el programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, quienes aceptaron contentas la oportunidad que les ofrecía la Fundación, ya que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho.

El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa, que en el idioma garran significa Mujer Trabajadora, este grupo se encuentra actualmente en el tercer ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 15 emprendedoras y activas mujeres. Entre las actividades que desarrollan se encuentran despensas, venta de frutas y verduras, costureras, venta de ropas, venta de lencerías, artesanas, venta de bebidas varias, etc.

Este grupo recibe créditos que lo invierten en sus negocios y mantiene un ahorro cada una. Para lograr el éxito de sus inversiones, La Fundación Paraguaya les proporciona de capacitaciones a los grupos de comité.

En esta ocasión ellas desean adquirir un nuevo crédito con el que podrán invertir en sus diferentes actividades y de este modo lograr mayores ingresos para sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as meat, drinks, bread, cooking oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy, saucepans, lingerie, clothing, bed sheets, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
In the city of Paraguarí, several woman with longings of expanding and others of starting micro-businesses met to form a credit committee with the aim of improving their own and their families' quality of life. These women contacted the Fundación Paraguaya to become part of the program "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Committee of Enterprising Women), and they happily accepted the opportunity that the Fundación offered them, since no other institution had done it.

The committee is named "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women), and they are characterized by their good organization and responsibility with their payments. This is the group's fifth loan, and they have an excellent standing. The group is composed of sixteen enterprising and active women. Among the activities that they carry out are: running a grocery store, fruit and vegetable sales, sewing, clothing sales, lingerie sales, artisanship, beverage sales, food sales, chip sales, fishing, etc.

This group receives credits which they invest in their business, and each woman maitains savings. To achieve the success of their investments, the Fundación Paraguaya offers trainings to their committee groups.

On this occasion, they hope to acquire another credit to invest in their different activities, and in this way, achieve better income for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de Paraguarí, unas mujeres con ganas de aumentar y otras de emprender micro empresas se reunieron para formar un comité de crédito, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Estas mujeres se pusieron en contacto con la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse sobre el programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, quienes aceptaron contentas la oportunidad que les ofrecía la Fundación, ya que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho.

El comité lleva por nombre Mujeres Unidas, y se caracterizan por su buena organización y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Este grupo se encuentra actualmente en el quinto ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 16 mujeres emprendedoras y activas. Entre las actividades que desarrollan se encuentran despensas, venta de frutas y verduras, costureras, venta de ropas, venta de lencerías, artesanas, venta de bebidas varias, venta de comidas, venta de chipas, pescado, etc.

Este grupo recibe créditos que lo invierten en sus negocios y mantiene un ahorro cada una. Para lograr el éxito de sus inversiones, La Fundación Paraguaya les proporciona de capacitaciones a los grupos de comité.

En esta ocasión ellas desean adquirir un nuevo crédito con el que podrán invertir en sus diferentes actividades y de este modo lograr mayores ingresos para sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of meet, drinks, breads, oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, fruits and vegetables, fish, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some sack of beans for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a collection of chic purses to resell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in various goods to move a small cafeteria forward.

loans.name: Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
The Pan-American focal center (of Pro-Mujer Bolivia) is located in the city of El Alto. The "Franz Tamayo" association belongs to this center; a group that works with a lot of responsibility toward their loans and internal activities. Among those inside the group, many lack basic services in their houses. For example Doña Catita can not rely on drinking water which should be supplied by public water basins. This is a problem because they only supply water in the mornings and even then only for a few hours. She longs to be able to have this service in her residence.

The main activity of this group is the weaving of blankets and making of ‘polleras’ (typical clothing of some regions of Bolivia) that they then sell in the market called ‘16th of July’ of the city of El Alto. At present they want to be able to expand their merchandise and to offer other types of products, such as shoes and sweaters. They need greater capital for the acquisition of materials to make these. They have confidence to improve their income, and in this manner to also improve the quality of life of their families

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El centro focal de Panamericana se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Franz Tamayo” que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo muchas de ellas carecen de servicios básicos en sus casas por ejemplo doña Catita no cuenta con agua potable por lo que debe abastecerse de agua en piletas publicas, echo que es un problema ya que el abastecimiento solo lo dan por las mañanas y solo por algunas horas, ella anhela poder contar con este servicio en su domicilio.

La actividad principal de este grupo es el tejido de mantas y confección de polleras (vestimenta típica de algunas regiones de Bolivia) que luego las venden en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Actualmente desean poder ampliar su mercadería y ofrecer otro tipo de productos como ser zapatos y chompas por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la adquisición de materia prima para la confección de estos. Tienen la seguridad de mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera mejorar también la calidad de vida de sus familias

loans.use: To buy materials to make shoes and sweaters for sale.

loans.name: Salah Din

texts.en: Salah D. is a taxi driver who has a small family. He works 12 hours in a day. He is a very hard worker. He was faced with some difficulty and he needed money. When he found the AFSG organization, he was very happy and requested an individual loan. He wants to purchase materials that he needs for his car and solve his problem of keeping his taxi working. He wants to make a good income, and he is happy about this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his car.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
Ubaidullo K. is 47 years old. He’s married with four children. His wife looks after their children and their home. Ubaidullo is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. Ubaidullo has a cafe where he is selling national meals and other foodstuffs. He has been in the business for 10 years. Ubaidullo tries to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his cafe and to ensure his clients have a rest. His business is stable and allows him to generate significant income and to ensure the worthy living for his family.

Now Ubaidullo’s children are growing and the expenses for them are growing, too. Thus Ubaidullo wants to increase his business to earn more money to be able to cover expenses. For this purpose he requests $US400 to expand his cafe. He is planning to pay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Expanding his cafe business in order to increase income.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor K. is 18 years old. Despite his young age Bakhtiyor has already been running his own business for about three years, selling women's shawls in the local market of Istaravshan town. His mother is a housekeeper and his father is currently unemployed, thus Bakhtiyor‘s business is now the main source of income allowing him to improve the living conditions and make plans for the future. As any teenager he is dreaming to have his own family and his own house.

This year is very important for Bakhtiyor as he is planning to send his dearest little sister to the school. For this reason he wants to expand his business in order to earn more. For this purpose he requests $US600 for the term of 12 months. He will use the loan for purchasing new women shawls in order to increase the range of goods for selling. Bakhtiyor would like to thank everyone for their support and he promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of new women's shawls in order to increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed M. is 20 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. He has been farming since he was a young boy. He has five years of experience and he has been able to support himself by learning how to manage his crops in the short growing season. His business includes growing and selling crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots and cabbages.

This year is very important for Khurshed as he is planning to enter the University. Khurshed would like to use this loan to purchase more farming supplies such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities in order to manage his crops appropriately and in the end to make enough profit to be able to pay the University fees. With your help he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of herbicides and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Acha

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Acha was married to A. Emmanuel Fonane, with whom she had five children. She is now a widow with five children to look after, and she says being a widow is more difficult than being single. The death of her supportive husband left her in the cold, and she has to start doing some of those things her husband did and that she took for granted. Challenged by these realities, she doubled her efforts at meeting the needs of her children. This led her to join GHAPE.

Given a loan, Acha plans to buy more piglets, feed, and farm supplies. Her community should benefit from her activities, because she will be able to provide them with pork and manure. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed, and farm supplies

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro M. is 29 years old. She’s married and the mother of three children. She has worked in agriculture for 10 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. Her farmer husband helps her with the business. Zuhro is growing the agricultural crops like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and others. She works from 6:00 a.m. till 6:00 p.m and each year Zuhro is growing crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family.

Today Zuhro is asking for a loan of $US600 for the term of 12 months. She would like to use this loan to buy the seeds and mineral fertilizer for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of her yield along with her earnings at the time of sale. She hopes to raise her income in order to pay her children’s school fees. Your support will really help her and you can be an important part of the growth of Zuhro’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan N. is 30 years old. He’s married and the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper, and thus Hasan’s business as a farmer is the main source of income for the family. Hasan is working hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. As well as his children and his wife, Hasan also takes care of his parents.

Hasan's business includes growing and selling of crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers and carrots. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. At the same time Hasan is raising the small cattle and selling them in the market.

Due to the beginning of the sowing season, Hasan is planning to sow onions, potatoes and carrots. That is why he wants to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds and why he needs a loan of $US600 for the term of 10 months. Also with part of the loan he is planning to improve his shed. Hasan is promising to be accurate with paying the loan and he expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Alibek

texts.en:
O. Alibek is 23 years old. He is married and has a son. Alibek is a farmer. He is working the land since he was 18 and during the five years of his activities he has gained much experience and a love for the land. Alibek is growing vegetables like: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber and carrots. At the same time he is raising the small cattle and selling them in the market. When it is the season, Alibek is working in the field from early morning till the late night.

Five years ago Alibek started producing vegetables on a plot of 0.10 hectares. Currently he is growing them on a plot of 0.50 hectares. Now that the business is stable Alibek believes that it will be the main income for him in the future.

Today Alibek requests $US600 for the term of 10 months. Alibek is planning to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and also small cattle. Alibek thanks everyone for trusting him and supporting today. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds, mineral fertilizer and small cattle.

loans.name: Kifoyat

texts.en:
Kifoyat R. is 38 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of two children. For a long time her husband couldn’t find the good job and recently left for Russia to seek out a living. Thus currently Kifoyat's business is the main source of income of the family.

Kifoyat is a farmer. On her plot of land she is growing such crops as potatoes, onion, tomatoes, cucumber and cabbage. Having been working the land for seven years, Kifoyat has gained rich experience. Each day she works diligently to make sure that she takes good care of her crop. Each year she is growing sufficient food for the family consumption and for selling. She is doing all the best in order to give her dearest children a good education and to meet all their needs. With her job, she has been able to pay for the schooling of all her children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land.

Now Kifoyat needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for seasonal planting. She’s asking for a loan of $US525 for a term of 12 months. This amount would help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Sixty-three-year-old Grace is married and has four children. She fell seriously ill and spent all her business capital on hospital bills, but thank God she survived. She had a business selling tapioca, which is consumed on a very large scale in her community. She was about to lose all her customers when GHAPE came to her aid in the year 2001, when she joined the program. She received a loan, which she invested gainfully and opened a pig farm. Her community benefited a lot from her activities, because her products are always available even at home, so community members don’t have to wait until market days before they can purchase tapioca.

With the loan she is now requesting, she plans to farm cassava on a large scale and also pay for labor to hoe the farmland. She also plans to buy piglets and pig feed, as well as produce water fufu (food made out of cassava), which is one of the foods commonly consumed in her area.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months, and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase cassava for water fufu production, to buy piglets and pig feed, and to farm cassava

loans.name: Cham

texts.en:
Cham T., 40, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in an outskirt area. She and her husband, Teng Teth, pictured above, are farmers. She grows rice and Teng plants a kind of mint. On average, they both earn a combination of $4 profit each day. A farmer's life is not easy; they both have to work very hard but earn little. Cambodia is a poor country and most of the provinces do not have irrigation systems yet, so most of the farmers depend on the weather to irrigate their farms. Mrs. Cham T. has six children, two of who are married and live away from home. The other two are employed in a garment factory and earn around $80 each a month.

Cham T., would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow to help in farming.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem Y., age 49, is married and lives with five of her children in Prey Veng province. She works to support the family as a construction worker, making around $3 each day, and her husband, Som Thy, earns $6 each day, from construction work as well. Two of the children are married and live away from home. Two other children are also employed with different work. 

To make it easier to get to work, and not have to spend money on a motor-taxi, they would like to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. (Mrs. Yem and her husband is pictured together at home.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng T., age 36, pictured above, is a widow farmer and lives with three of her children. Living in Phnom Penh, she typically makes around $2 each day and is aided by her two children, who work in a garment factory. Mrs. Eng’s farm is more successful than the others because she owns a water pump and never has to worry about the weather, rain or not. The other farmers that have no water pump have to rely on the weather. The weather conditions have been bad in the past year.

Mrs. Eng wants to start growing more crops to earn more revenue, so now she is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase good seeds for crops.

loans.use: To purchase good seeds to grow crops.

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Samrith Sophet, 28, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. To earn a living, she has been selling desserts since 2002 and earns approximately $2/day. Her husband, Kat Khoeun, is a motor-taxi driver and also earns around $2/day. The couple has two children.

Mrs. Samrith is now seeking a loan of $700 in order to help her husband replace his old motorbike with a newer, more fuel-efficient one. She believes that a better motorbike will help cut costs and better his business.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang V. E., pictured above, is a widow and lives with five of her children. She is a vendor selling fish in the local market, normally earning around $3 each day She has a son who works as a blacksmith. Two of her children are married and no longer live at home.

To make the blacksmith business a success, Mrs. Hang needs a loan from Kiva to purchase blacksmith tools and steel to make windows and doors.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools and steel to make windows and doors.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem R. lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. Mrs. Chhem is a farmer and earns up to $3/day. Her husband, Mom Vun, sells firewood and can earn up to $6/day. The couple has six children, two of whom are single and live with them. 

Mrs. Chem is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase land to farm on. She believes that this will greatly help her farming business and be a beneficial addition to her family support.

loans.use: Purchase land to farm

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan U., 47, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. She works as a city cleaner and can earn up to $3/day. Her husband, Brak Va, is a motorbike mechanic and earns around $5/day. The couple has three children, one of whom is married. One of the children also works as a city cleaner like her mother.

Mrs. Phan is applying for a loan of $500 in order to purchase a trailer for her family. She would like to use a trailer as a taxi to transport workers in the city. She believes that this additional business will greatly help to further support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat Y., 35, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. To help support her family, she sells porridge and can earn up to $5/day in revenue. Her husband earns around $4/day. Together the couple has four children.

Mrs. Sat is now hoping to embark on a new business venture in firewood sales and would like to borrow $300 in order to purchase a trailer. With a trailer, she will be able to transport mass quantities of firewood to sell. She hopes that this new business will be profitable and benefit her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sdeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdeung Y., age 46, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country's famous Angkor Wat Temples. Since 2000, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to earn up to 5 USD per day. Her husband, Chan Ra, is a local doctor who also earns around 5 USD per day. Together the couple has six children, two of whom are married.

Mrs. Sdeung is seeking a loan of 700 USD to help her husband's medical business, with $500 going toward the purchase of a motorbike so he can visit patients in their homes. The rest of the loan will be applied toward medicinal supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and medicine

loans.name: Lort

texts.en:
Mrs. Lort A., 42, is a widow who lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, the home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 2000, she has worked to support her family by weaving and selling baskets in her local markets. She has five children, one of whom is married. One of her children also helps support the family by working in a restaurant.

Mrs. Lort would like to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase land and grow vegetables on it. She believes this is a good new business opportunity, and also a way to help feed her family in a more affordable manner.

loans.use: To purchase land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun H., age 42, is a farmer and lives with her husband. Living in Phnom Penh, she typically earns around $3 each day. Her husband, Mom Van, age 41, is a motor taxi driver. He normally makes about $4 per day. This couple has two children. Mrs. Sun needs to grow more crops to make more money to support the family. A farmer's life is not easy; the family works hard but earns little. 

Mrs. Sun now wants a loan from Kiva to purchase good seed, and the remaining will be used to buy more land for farming. (Mrs. Sun and her husband is pictured at home.)

loans.use: To purchase good seed and land to farm.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Mrs. Tim S., 48, is a widow who lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a chef who is often hired to cook for local weddings. Mrs. Tim has six children, two of whom are married. Two of her children are also chefs and work in restaurants, earning up to $50/month each. 

Mrs. Tim is now seeking to start a new business and supplement her family’s income. She would like to borrow $600 to purchase fruits wholesale and operate a fruitstand in the market. She hopes this will be a profitable new enterprise and will benefit her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell in the market

loans.name: Pea

texts.en:
Pea T., age 60, is a widow and lives in Phnom Penh with three of her children. She owns a plot of land and grows a variety of vegetables, earning around $1.50 each day. Her sons also are farmers, and  typically make $2 per day. One of her children is married and lives away from home.	

To make more money this family needs to have a loan from Kiva to purchase good seed to grow for the next season.

loans.use: To purchase good seed.

loans.name: Sous

texts.en: Sous S., age 50, pictured, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. She and her husband, Phorn Chan, are farmers, earning around $3.50 each per day and they are also supported by two of their children who work at a garment factory. They have six children, one of whom is married and no longer lives at home. The family wants to have a grinding machine and good rice seed to grow for the next season.

loans.use: Sous hopes to use this loan to purchase good rice seed.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em S., 47, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 1998 she has been in the business of producing rice wine, a favorite local drink, and she makes around $4/day in sales revenue. Her husband, Hub Hun, raises pigs for a living and can earn up to $3/day. Together the couple has four children, one of whom is employed and contributes to the family income.

Em is now seeking to borrow $1000 in order to start a new business venture. She would like to purchase a generator for recharging batteries. With the rest of the loan she would like to help support her husband’s business by purchasing more pigs for him to raise.

loans.use: Em would like to open another business by purchasing a generator and to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Kum N., age 53 (pictured at her farmland), is a farmer and lives with her husband and they are farmers who earn around $2 each day. They grow rice and bananas. This couple has five children, two of whom are married and live away from home; and another child is employed in a garment factory. Kum wants a loan to purchase good rice seed to grow for next year.

loans.use: Kim would like to purchase good rice seed to grow for next year.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en: Tak S., 33, pictured, is the mother of four children and lives with her husband and older mother. She and her husband sell a variety of vegetables, typically making around $5 each day. They both want to sell their produce in large amounts so that they have more money to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Tak would like to purchase more vegetables in large amounts to resell.

loans.name: Tav

texts.en:
Mrs. Tav M., 42, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband, Ang Sear, is a motorbike mechanic. The couple has four children, one of whom is employed and contributes to the family’s income.

Tav is seeking to boost her husband’s business operations. She would like to borrow $500 to purchase air pumps and other tools so that he has the adequate equipment to run a profitable moto shop.

loans.use: Tav would like to purchase an air pump and other mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. L. L., 31, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She works in grocery sales and her husband, Tin Then, makes drums to sell. The couple has three children, two of whom are students who work after school selling souvenirs at the temples.

L. is applying for a loan of $1000 to help boost her business. She would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer groceries from the market as well as additional groceries to sell.

loans.use: Lan would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer groceries from the market and to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim L., 34, lives in Siem Reap Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a taxi-driver. The couple has four young children, one of whom attends school. Lim is now seeking work opportunities for herself and her family. She would like to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike that she and her husband could use to commute to work.

loans.use: Lim would like to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheng C. comes from Phkong Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently in the business of farming. Mrs. Pheng C. usually cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, she cultivates rice and during the dry season she grows vegetables. The rainy season is now coming; unfortunately, Mrs. Pheng C. cannot plant rice because she has insufficient draft animals; thus, Mrs. Pheng C. has asked for a loan to buy a new cow to add to her previous cow to use as draft animals.

Her husband, Mr. Nuthien Sok, is a subsistence farmer too. Mrs. Pheng C. is 45 and the mother of seven children, two of whom are working as laborers in a brick factory while two others are assisting their parents on the farm. The remaining three are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Pheng C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to use on her rice field.

Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new cow to add to her previous cow to use as draft animals

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom P., 53, is a subsistence farmer and cow breeder in Toek Laak Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is  a widow. Mrs. Sokhom P. does not have any children and she is not doing well. Previously, Mrs. Sokhom P. obtained a $500 loan from AMK to start a cow breeding business. Since the cow breeding business is doing very well, Mrs. Sokhom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for breeding

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn K. is a villager in Chrork Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Suy Oun, are subsistence farmers. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study.

Even though the family members have various business activities, they are still not doing well. Thus, Mrs. Yorn K. needs to start another business and that would be cow breeding; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy a cow, so Mrs. Yorn K. decided to ask a loan for this purpose.

Previously, Mrs. Yorn K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy timbers to build her new house. Her husband and her younger daughter are shown in the photo with Mrs. Yorn K..

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Savath

texts.en:
Mrs. Savath E. is a subsistence farmer in Phkong Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she runs a kiln where she can make charcoal to sell for an income. Her husband, Mr. Ren Sum, is a farmer and charcoal maker, too.

Mrs. Savath E. does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a new cow to add to her previous one to use as a draft animal.
