Mrs. Savath E. is 25 and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending a local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Pean

texts.en:
Mrs. Pean B. is 26 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She works by collecting and purchasing recyclable items and selling them to companies that recycle the goods. Her husband also works in this line of business. Together the couple has one child.

Mrs. Pean is now seeking to increase her business efficiency and output. She would like to borrow $500 to buy a motorbike and trailer so that she can more easily collect and transport her recyclables.

loans.use: Pean would like to purchase transportation for recyclable goods.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San T., 40, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. Since 2003 she has earned a living selling chickens and can make up to $10/day in sales revenue. Her husband operates a small drink stand from their house. The couple has two children who help their parents’ businesses after school.

San is now seeking to boost her family’s drinks business. She would like to borrow $1,200 to increase their variety and depth of inventory so that her husband can improve business.

loans.use: San would like to purchase more drinks to sell from home.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn U. is a villager in Trea Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently running two businesses: a rice plantation and pig breeding. Mrs. Sarorn U., 49, is a widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others are working as construction workers. The two children working in the garment factory have difficulty reaching their workplace, so Mrs. Sarorn U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her children in order to make it easy for them to travel to work.

Previously, Mrs. Sarorn U. obtained a loan from AMK to start her pig breeding business. Last year, one of her children got typhoid and Mrs. Sarorn U. spent $100 to get her child cured and that is why she is now short of money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam K., 33, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 2000 she has been making a living by selling bamboo shoots, and earns approximately $2.50/day in this business. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and makes up to $5/day. The couple has three young children.

Seam wishes to help her husband’s business and is seeking a loan of $1,000. She would like to use the loan to replace her husband’s old motorbike and purchase a trailer so that he can operate a larger taxi (a motorbike-pulled cart called a tuk-tuk, common as taxis in Phnom Penh) and earn more money.

loans.use: Seam would like to replace her husband's motorbike and purchase a trailer (for a tuk tuk).

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim Y. lives in Threa Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently in the business of farming. Her farm faces a problem since she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Mrs. Nim Y. is asking for a loan to buy a cow to add to her old one for use as draft animals.

Mrs. Nim Y., 49, is a widow with seven children, five of whom are working in various business activities while the other two are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Nim Y. obtained a loan to buy fertilizer to use on her field.

Last year, one of her children got a disease where blood came out of the ears and Mrs. Nim Y. spent $300 to get her child cured. Now, Mrs. Nim Y. has got typhoid and she spent $100 to cure herself. This has caused a big economic problem in the family and it is why they can’t afford to buy a cow with savings.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Sroam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroam P., 26, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since the year 2000 she has been making a living by selling fish and raising pigs. Her husband, Nhek Phen, is a fisherman. Together the couple has two small children.

Sroam is now seeking a loan so that she can enhance her husband's and her business operations. She would like to borrow $600 -- $400 to purchase better fishing tools and $200 to purchase fish for resale purposes.

loans.use: Sroam would like to purchase fishing equipment and fish to sell.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouk K., 55, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a construction foreman. Together, the couple has eight children, three of whom are married. Three of their daughters work in garment factories, and two of the children are students.

Mrs. K. is seeking to help her husband’s work. She would like to borrow $700 to purchase a motorbike so that he can easily commute to work.

loans.use: Ouk would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Chaom

texts.en: Mrs. Chaom S., 27, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The couple has two young children. Chaom would like to help her husband’s business and is seeking to borrow $700. With the loan, she will purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one, as well as purchase a trailer so that he can run a tuk-tuk (a motorbike powered cart) taxi business.

loans.use: Chaom would like to replace an old motorbike and purchase a tuk tuk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Madické

texts.fr:
This young salesman specializes in selling clothing. He has a stand at the Saint Maures de Fossés central market in Ziguinchor. He would like to increase his supply of merchandise and increase his income before the summer vacation starts, as his customers are mostly women.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ce jeune commerçant est spécialiste de la vente des vêtements. Il tient son commerce au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés de Ziguinchor. Il veut renforcer son stock de marchandises et augmenter ses revenus avec les grandes vacances qui s'annoncent, car sa clientéle est constitué pour l'essentiel par la gente féminine.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
This simple woman, a married mother of five, sells millet porridge, or “fondé” in the national language, Wolof. With this business, she manages to support her husband and meet her own needs. She would like to buy more millet and corn to meet customer demand and increase her income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Cette brave dame, mariée et mére de 05 enfants, vend de la bouillie de mil ou "fondé" en langue nationale Wolof. Avec cette activité, elle arrive à soutenir son époux et à subvenir à ses besoins personnelles. Elle voudrait renforcer son stock de mil et de mais pour faire face à la demande mais aussi pour augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Porridge sales

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 49 years old.  She is a merchant.  Blanca owns a pantry where she markets all kinds of consumer staples. She began her business approximately 10 years ago to support her family with the income of the household.  A little time later her husband lost his job in the local railroad station where he was working and nowadays he works in agriculture to support his family in the expenses of the home.
Blanca has three children.  The biggest is a teacher and he helps by selling cell phone cards (to add funds to cell phone accounts).  The second son is working in a small business in the capital city.  The youngest boy of Blanca is her inspiration for the name of the business and his dream is to become a mechanic.
  Blanca works 14 hours every day to provide greater opportunities for her family, but she still needs additional loans to grow the business.  She will utilize the loan to enlarge her stock of merchandise and in that way to improve the quality of life of her family and to support the studies of her smallest son.   
 Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.
Blanca tiene 49 años. Es comerciante. Blanca posee una despensa en donde comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad. Comenzó su negocio hace aproximadamente 10 años atrás para apoyar a su familia con los ingresos de la casa, poco tiempo después su marido perdió su trabajo en la estación local del ferrocarril donde estaba trabajando y hoy día trabaja en la agricultura para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
Blanca tiene tres hijos. La mayor es docente y la ayuda vendiendo tarjetas (saldos para líneas celulares) para celulares. El segundo hijo está trabajando en una pequeña empresa en la ciudad capital. El niño más joven de Blanca es su inspiración para el nombre del negocio y sus sueños es el de ser mecánico.
  Blanca trabaja 14 horas todos los días para proporcionar mayores oportunidades para su familia, pero todavía necesita de préstamos adicionales para hacer crecer el negocio. Ella utilizará el préstamo para aumentar su stock de mercaderías y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y hacerle estudiar a su hijo menor.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store such as milk, fruits, vegetables, meats, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a 61-year-old woman who lives with her husband, daughter, and 2 grandchildren: Augustine, age 9, and Milagro, age 1. Delia opened up her small general store on the side of the main highway that connects two cities: Paraguarí and Villarrica. The general store has been in business for over ten years.

Delia previously sold meals and goods to her neighbors and to the local miners, her husband's co-workers, who work in the quarries even today. Her small business is currently very prosperous. Customers come on weekends to purchase her famous, homemade empanadas (stuffed pastries).

With this loan, she intends to expand her business now that the route is being paved. She would like to increase her merchandise in order to meet her customers’ demands and boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia tiene 61 años, vive con su marido, una hija y dos nietos, Augustine 9 años y Milagro de 1 año. Delia abrió su pequeña despensa al costado de la carretera principal que une dos ciudades, va de la ciudad de Paraguarí hasta la ciudad de Villarrica. El negocio funciona hace ya más de diez años.

Anteriormente, Delia, vendían comidas y mercaderías a sus vecinos y a mineros compañeros de trabajo de su marido quienes trabajan hasta hoy día en la cantera. Su pequeña empresa funciona actualmente con mucho éxito. Los fines de semana, los clientes vienen para adquirir sus famosas empanadas hechos en casa.

Con su préstamo pretende ampliar su negocio ya que la ruta principal está siendo pavimentada y desea aumentar su stock para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y aumentar su movimiento de ventas.

loans.use: Purchase meat, eggs, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Señor Gregoria is 64 years old. He is married to María Mongelós, age 73, who is dedicated to dressmaking, helping economically with the household expenses.

They have one child, of legal age, who helps his father in making and selling the product.

Gregorio began his activity more than 5 years ago, when he participated n a course on the making of cleaning products. After that he undertook the activity in his own dwelling. At present he leaves to sell from a cart, house by house. Already he can count on a numerous clientele due to the quality of his products.

He needs the loan for the purchase of raw materials: colorants, softeners, bottles, etc.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Gregorio tiene 64 años, esta casado con María Mongelós de 73 años quien se dedica a la costura, ayudando económicamente para el sustento familiar.

Tienen 1 hijo, mayor de edad, quien le ayuda a su padre para la elaboración y venta del producto.

Gregorio comenzó su actividad hace más de 5 años, luego participar de un curso para fabricación de productos de limpieza, después de eso emprendió la actividad en su propia vivienda. Actualmente sale a vender en un carrito, casa por casa, ya cuenta con una numerosa clientela por la calidad de sus productos.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de materias primas, colorantes, suavizantes, botellas, etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making cleaning products such as colorants, chlorine, scents, and bottles of different sizes.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 61 years old. He is married to Graciela Brítez, age 58, who helps him with the sales of his products. They live in their own house.

José emigrated to Argentinian lands at an early age where he learned to run a shoe store. Later, after 10 long and difficult years, he returned to his country deciding to invest his capital in starting his own shoe store.

They have two children who, thanks to the effort of their parents, have been able to complete their studies, being already professional and independent.

He needs the loan for the purchase of soles and forms for shoes. In this way he will be able to satisfy the demands of his clientele, since his work is very appreciated for the quality that he presents.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

José tiene 61 años de edad, está casado con Graciela Brítez de 58 años de edad, quien le ayuda en la venta de sus productos, viven en casa propia.

José emigró a tierras Argentinas a temprana edad donde aprendió el oficio de la zapatería, luego de 10 largos y sacrificados años regresó a su país decidiendo invertir su capital ahorrado en montar su propia zapatería.

Tienen dos hijos quienes gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres han podido culminar sus estudios, siendo ya profesionales e independientes.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de suelas y hormas para zapatos, de este modo podrá satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, ya que sus trabajos son muy apreciados por la calidad que presenta.

loans.use: To buy soles, forms and leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Señor Dionicio is 54 years old. He is married to Jorgelina Bejarano, age 54, who works as a employee to help him with the expenses of the house and the studies of their children. They have four children, of which two are grown and professional and two are studying in college.

Dionicio is a plumber. He began at an early age helping his uncle from whom he learned the trade of plumbing. After eight years he became independent, working for his own account. Already he has worked more than 25 years. Nowadays he counts on a clientele drawn by the quality of his work. He is valued by his clients fpor the great sacrifice that he performs, since he lives up to his responsibilities in spite of the cold and the rain. Nowadays he works with a nephew to whom he teaches the profession.

He needs the loan for the purchase of a case of tools for plumbing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionicio tiene 54 años, está casado con Jorgelina Bejarano de 54 años de edad quien trabaja como empleada para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa y estudio de sus hijos. Tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores y profesionales y dos están estudiando en la Facultad.

Dionicio es plomero, él empezó desde temprana edad ayudando a su tío de quien aprendió el oficio de plomería y del cual luego de ocho años se independizó para trabajar por su propia cuenta hace ya más de 25 años. Hoy día cuenta con clientela formada por la calidad de su trabajo y valorado por sus clientes por el gran sacrificio que realiza, ya que cumple con su responsabilidad a pesar del frío y la lluvia. Hoy en día trabaja con él un sobrino a quien le enseña la profesión.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de un maletín de herramientas para plomería.

loans.use: To buy a case of tools for plumbing

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is 38 years old. He is married to Graciela Mendoza, who is in the last year of studying to be a teacher. They have three children, all under age.

Hugo was working in Argentina for several years, then returned 9 years ago and decided to invest his capital to open his own business. Thanks to his effort, his good economic management and the quality of his products, the business has grown considerably. He has managed to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

He needs the loan for the purchase of covers, mufflers, ball bearings, exhaust pipes, cylinders, signals, etc., to enlarge his stock of merchandise and thus to satisfy the demands of his numerous clientele.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Hugo tiene 38 años, está casado con Graciela Mendoza quien está cursando el último año de la docencia, tienen tres hijos todos ellos menores de edad.

Hugo estuvo trabajando en la Argentina por varios años, luego regresó y decidió invertir su capital para abrir su propio negocio hace 9 años, quien gracias a su esfuerzo, a su buen manejo económico y a la calidad de sus productos ha crecido considerablemente logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas, amortiguadores, rulemanes, caño de escape, cilindros, señaleros, etc., para aumentar su stock de mercaderías y así satisfacer la demanda de su numerosa clientela.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his spare parts store such as covers, mufflers, bearings, cylinders, signals, exhaust pipes, etc.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio is 24 years old, he is single and he attends school in the evenings at the University. He is currently taking his third year of his Accounting degree.

Julio started as a very young man as a vendor alongside his father. Later he purchased a motorcycle and started to work for his own accord 4 years ago.

Every day he starts his day at 4:00 a.m. to start making his rounds. He conducts his sales and collects his dues from house to house, travelling many kilometres every day.

He requires this credit for the purchase of merchandise given the grate demand that he sees for his products, including blankets, eiderdowns, blenders, bed sheets, towels, and meat grinders, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero estudia a la noche en la Facultad, esta cursando actualmente el tercer año de la carrera de Contabilidad.

Julio empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, luego adquirió para su moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace 4 años.

Todos los días se levanta a las 04:00 AM. para empezar sus recorridas, el vende y a la vez realiza las cobranzas casa por casa, recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías por la gran demanda que posee de sus productos como colchas, edredones, licuadoras, sábanas, toallas, molinadores de carne, entre otros.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: blankets, eiderdowns, and blenders.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is 37 years old and is married to Juana Espínola who is a housewife. They have two children who attend primary school in the town. They live in their own home.

Guillermo began work as a taxi-driver 15 years ago. Through hard work and good financial management, a few years ago he succeeded in obtaining a plot of land in the town and built his house there.

With this loan, he wishes to buy a vehicle and achieve his dream of being the owner of a successful business. At the moment the vehicle that he drives does not belong to him, and he works on a contract basis.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo tiene 37 años de edad, está casado con Juana Espínola, quien es ama de casa. Tienen dos hijos que van aún a la escuela primaria de la ciudad, viven en casa propia.

Guillermo inicio su labor como taxista hace 15 años. Gracias al sacrificio y sus buenos manejos económicos luego de varios años logró adquirir un terreno en la ciudad, en donde edificó su casa.

Guillermo con la ayuda del crédito desea comprar un vehículo y así poder cumplir su sueño cual es el de ser propietario de un negocio próspero en el cual él podrá ser propietario ya que actualmente el vehículo con el que trabaja no le pertenece y gana de acuerdo a una comisión.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en: Maida lives in the village of Ploćari.  She is married and has two older sons.  Her husband is employed as a seasonal construction worker and also receives a small disability pension from the army. Maida works in a health center to help support the family.  This is Maida’s first loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 600BAM.  She intends to use this loan help grow her orchard.  Right now the orchard produces pears, and she would like to grow additional kinds of fruit as well.  She hopes that this additional business will help increase her family’s monthly income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow more fruit trees in her orchard

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Sra. Estela P. is 32 years old and has been married for 13 years to 35-year old Ever Cristaldo. They have two children aged 14 and 6 years. The older one is in 9th grade and the younger in primary school.

Estela owns a clothing store which she opened five years ago using the small amount of capital given to her by her husband who makes furniture. With the money she bought second-hand clothes, and as time passed, her business became a clothing store.

Estela wants to see her business to expand so that her income also increases. Then in the future her children can go to university, and she will be a well-regarded person. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, footwear, blouses, outfits for children, shirts, T-shirts, sneakers etc. In this way she will increase her stock and offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Estela P. de 32 años de edad está casada hace 13 años con el señor Ever Cristaldo de 35 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 14 y 6 años respectivamente, el primero está en el noveno grado y el otro está en el primer grado de la escuela primaria.

La señora Estela posee una tienda de ropas la cual empezó el negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo que se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, con dicho dinero compro ropas usadas y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.

La señora desea que su negocio crezca cada día y con eso aumentar sus ingresos, para que el día de mañana pueda hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que en el futuro sea una persona de bien. Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pantalones, short, zapatos, blusas, conjuntos para niños, camisa, remeras, zapatillas. Así aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase men’s and women’s jeans, shorts, footwear, blouses, children’s outfits, shirts, T-shirts, underwear, sneakers etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Sra. Juliana O. is 57 years old. For the last 22 years she has been married to 51-year old Adolfo Céspedes whose job buying and selling wood helps support the family. They have nine children, five of whom have jobs outside the country and who also help financially. Their two younger children aged 18 and 20 live with them. The latter completed secondary school last year, and the former is in the second year of media studies.

Sra. Juliana began her business 35 years ago with help from her father. From that time to the present her business has been growing and her client base increasing because of the fine service she offers everyone.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as clothes brushes, diapers, combs, adhesive tape, lighters, jars, tomatoes, onions, rice, sugar, and a variety of drinks. By investing in more stock, she will be able to provide greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juliana O. de 57 años de edad está casada hace 22 años con el señor Adolfo Céspedes de 51 años, quien se dedica a la compra – venta de maderas para ayudar al sustento de la unidad familiar. El matrimonio cuenta con 9 hijos de los cuales 5 se encuentra trabajando en el exterior y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos hijos menores viven con ellos, tienen 20 y 18 años, el primero termino el año pasado su secundaria y el otro está en el segundo de la media.

La señora Juliana empezó el negocio hace 35 años con la ayuda de su padre y de ahí hasta la fecha su negocio está creciendo porque ha aumentado su clientela, debido a la buena atención que ofrece a todos.

Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como cepillo de ropas, pañales, peines, cintas adhesivas, encendedores, jarras, tomates, cebollas, arroz, azúcar, bebidas en general. Así aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase clothes brushes, diapers, combs, adhesive tape, lighters, jars, tomatoes, onions, rice, sugar, and a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Sr. Luciano B. is married to Sra. Luz Villalba. They have two children, an 11-year old boy and a little girl of 6. They want their children to have a bright future, to study hard, and to become professionals.

Luciano has been making roof gutters out of metal sheets for houses since 1989 when he started as an assistant in this line of work.

He plans to use the loan to buy galvanized sheets to make guttering. In his plans for the future, he has said he would like to open his own metalwork shop.

He hopes to see more jobs created in our country, as many of his friends have emigrated to other countries in search of greater work opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Luciano B. esta casado con la señora Luz Villalba, la pareja son padres de 2 hijos, un varón de 11 y una nena de 6 años de edad, a quienes desean lo mejor para el futuro, que estudien y cada uno elija su profesión.

El cliente se dedica a la fabricación de canaletas de chapa para viviendas, desde el año 1.989 cuando comenzó como ayudante en esta profesión.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de chapas galvanizabas para fabricar canaletas. Según manifestó en el futuro le gustaría tener su propia metalúrgica.

Espera que en nuestro país exista más fuentes de trabajo, ya que muchos amigos emigraron a otros países en busca de mayores oportunidades laborales.

loans.use: To purchase galvanized metal sheets.

loans.name: Marilis

texts.es:
Sra. Marilis is 23 years old, married to Sr. Alfredo Bonilla, and they have two children. Marilis is the owner of stall in the local market from which she sells clothing, footwear, and household items. She has been in this line of work for the last seven years.

She plans to use the loan to buy winter jackets which she can obtain for a good price—it is now the best time of year to sell this product.

Marilis told us that over time she wants to expand the business and offer other types of merchandise since there is a lot of commercial activity taking place in the market.

She wishes to see our country improve and to see more investment in public health, education, and safety.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marilis tiene 23 años de edad y está casado con el Señor Alfredo Bonilla, la pareja tienen 2 hijos. La cliente es propietaria de una casilla en el mercado municipal donde vende prendas de vestir, calzados, y artículos de mercería, con una antigüedad de 7 años en el ramo.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de camperas que le ofertaron a buen precio, ya que es la temporada de mayor venta de dicho producto.

Nos manifestó que con el tiempo quiere aumentar el negocio y traer otro tipo de artículos ya que en el mercado hay muy buen movimiento comercial.

Desea que nuestro país se mejore, que haya mas inversión en la salud publica, la educación y la seguridad.

loans.use: To purchase winter jackets.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Sr. Ismael is 32 years old and married to Sra. Edith Benítez. They have two children, an 8-year old son and a 10-year old daughter.

Ismael has been selling clothing, shoes, and various household items on the street for the last five years.

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a small truck. At the moment he uses a motorbike which is now too small as he expects his business to grow. He also has a large number of clients to whom he wishes to offer a greater variety of household items so he can retain them as customers.

Sr. Ismael stated that in the future he wants to have a store in the market from which to sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Ismael tiene 32 años de edad y esta casado con la Sra. Edith Benítez, ambos tienen 2 hijos, uno varón de 8 años y mujer de 10 años.

El cliente es vendedor ambulante, él vende prendas de vestir, calzados, y artículos de mercería, ya lleva en el oficio 5 años de antigüedad.

El préstamo que solicita será destinado para la compra de una camioneta, ya que el Sr. Ismael reparte sus mercaderías en una moto, y este ya le resulta muy chico, atendiendo que cada vez esta creciendo mas su negocio y además tiene una buena cantidad de clientes a quienes desea ofrecer mas variedad de mercaderías para así poder conservar a sus clientes.

El Sr. Manifestó que en el futuro desea tener un local en el mercado para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck to use in his business.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a shopkeeper who sells toys and provides decorations for children’s birthday parties, weddings, quinceañeras, and school graduations among others. He also provides rentals of chairs, tables, silverware, etc. He has been in business for three years.

The loan requested is for the purchase of an inflatable “bouncy house.” Osvaldo has a great demand for this product, and now that he has an established clientele he must have all of the elements required for a children’s party. In order to meets the needs of his customers he must offer complete service so that his customers will continue to be satisfied.

In the future, Osvaldo would like to expand his store in order to be able to better display his products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Osvaldo tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero, vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos.

El cliente es comerciante, vende juguetes, y realiza decoraciones para cumpleaños infantiles, bodas, quince años, colaciones de colegios, entre otros. También tiene alquiler de sillas, mesas, cubiertos, etc., ya lleva en el oficio 3 años de antigüedad.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de un globo loco (bouncy hause), ya que el Sr. Osvaldo tiene mucha demanda de ese producto, ya tiene una clientela formada necesita tener todos los componente que se necesita para una fiesta infantil, para satisfacer la demanda y ofrecer un servicio completo para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.

El Sr. Manifestó que en el futuro desea ampliar mas su local para poder exhibir mejor sus productos.

loans.use: For the purchase of an inflatable "bouncy house."

loans.name: Stella

texts.es:
Mrs. Estela V., 46 years old, is happily married to Mr. Marcial who is 41 years old. Estela has been a merchant for 15 years, since 1993 when she opened a liquor store with her own capital obtained from the sale of a vehicle that had been given to her by her father. It is worth mentioning that her business is strategically located on one of the main avenues in the city. Due to the location and the excellent customer service, she is able to count on a well-formed customer base and more people are always approaching the store looking for their products. Estela expresses her support and places her hope in the new government. She believes that a change for the better is on its way. The client is applying for this loan for the purchase of a plot of land, in order to build a home in which she can also expand her business that is currently in a rented space.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Stela V. de 46 años esta felizmente casada con el Sr. Marcial de 41 años de edad. Doña Estela es comerciante desde hace 15 años, en 1.993 exactamente, inauguró una casa de bebidas propia con un pequeño capital que surgió de la venta de un vehículo que su padre le había regalado. Cabe mencionar que su negocio se encuentra estratégicamente ubicado sobre una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad, por esto y por la excelente atención al cliente ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada y cada vez más personas se acercan al local solicitando sus productos. La Sra. Estela manifiesta que tiene sus esperanzas puestas sobre el nuevo gobierno y sostiene que el cambio para la mejora esta llegando. La clienta solicita este crédito para la compra de un terreno, para edificar una vivienda propia en donde también pueda ampliar su negocio ya que actualmente están en un local alquilado.

loans.use: For the purchase of a lot/land.

loans.name: Umberto

texts.es:
Mr. Umberto C., age 57, is married to Mrs. Wilfrida Goméz, age 60. The couple has 3 children, all of whom are adults and living on their own. Umberto has been interested in natural medicine since he was young, and began to study it while he was working for a woman as a natural medicine assistant. Some time later, after having learned the craft, Umberto decided to open his own office. With a small amount of capital he gathered books and other necessities in order to work as a practitioner of natural medicine. This has been his profession since 1975. Umberto is requesting this loan for the purchase of natural remedies to treat illnesses such as gastritis, diabetes, and also to purchase energy supplements among other things. This will allow him to keep items in stock now that he has an office where he can dispense prescriptions for these remedies that he himself can market.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Umberto C. de 57 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Wilfrida Goméz de 60 años. El matrimonio tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independizados. Don Umberto desde joven se interesó por la medicina natural, y empezó a estudiarlo mientras trabajaba con una señora como ayudante de medicina natural. Tiempo después, una vez aprendido el oficio. Don Umberto decidió abrir su propio consultorio y con un pequeño capital se hizo de libros y de comodidades para trabajar como medico naturalista. Aproximadamente desde 1975 hasta la actualidad. El Sr. Umberto C. solicita el préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para enfermedades como gastritis, diabetes, energizantes entre otros, de este modo para tenerlo en stock ya que el tiene un consultorio en donde les expide recetas de esos remedios que el mismo los puede comercializar.

loans.use: For the purchase of natural remedies for gastritis, energy, diabetes, cholesterol, etc.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo is 50 years old, is married to Marina Paredes, and the couple has two school-aged children.

Bernardo has been a photographer for 25 years, documenting social and cultural events. He has his own shop in his home and completes work for various educational institutions. His wife accompanies him on all of his photo shoots.

Bernardo is requesting this loan for the purchase of a digital camera of higher resolution than the one her currently owns.

Translated by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Bernardo tiene 50 años, esta casado con la Sra. Marina Paredes con quien tiene dos hijos de edad escolar.

El Sr. Bernardo se dedica a la fotografía y filiación de eventos sociales y culturales desde hace 25 años, tiene su propio local en su domicilio y realiza trabajos con varias instituciones educativas, su señora lo acompaña en las actividades que el realiza.

El Sr. Bernardo solicita este crédito para la compra de una cámara fotográfica digital de mayor capacidad de la que actualmente tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of a high-resolution digital camera.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
Geronima is 52 years old, married to Fausto Delgado, and the couple has four children. Two of their children are university students and two are in high school.

For 14 years Geronima has been making and selling various types of sweet baked goods and cakes. She learned the business from a pastry cook she was working for as a salesperson, and then she began to bake at home with her family and would go out to sell the products with her children.

The business has grown quite a bit, and now she has three vendors working for her in the central zone of the country. These sales take place during the autumn and winter seasons. During the spring and summer seasons they make homemade ice creams of different flavors and use the same sales system.

Geronima plans to use this loan in order to buy a greater quantity of ingredients for the production of these products.

Translated by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Gerónima tiene 52 años, esta casada con el señor Fausto Delgado, tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son universitarios y dos estudian en la secundaria.

Hace 14 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de facturas (masas dulces) como tortas, medialunas, bocaditos dulces, etc. Este negocio aprendió de un repostero para el cual ella trabajaba como vendedora del mismo producto, luego Gerónima empezó a fabricar en su domicilio con la familia, y salen a vender con sus hijos.

El negocio ha crecido bastante, que actualmente cuentan también con tres vendedores por la zona central del País. Esta actividad lo realiza durante la temporada de otoño e invierno y para la temporada de primavera-verano fabrican helados caseros de distintos gustos y usan el mismo sistema de venta.

La señora Gerónima con este crédito quiere comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, eggs, sugar, leavening, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. Gustavo Z. is single, lives with his mother, and is a taxi driver. Gustavo is the owner of two taxi stands. He drives one of his vehicles (which he also owns) and the other is driven by a contracted driver. He tells us with pride that it was with great effort he was able to buy the two taxi stands and his two vehicles.

The loan requested will be used for the repair of his home. In the future he would like to open a mechanic shop and be a source of jobs for more people.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Gustavo Z. es soltero vive con su madre, el se y es taxista. Gustavo es propietario de dos paradas de taxis. El conduce uno de sus vehículos y otro vehículo que también es de su propiedad lo conduce un chofer contratado. Cuenta orgulloso que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar las dos paradas y sus dos vehículos.

El crédito que se le otorgo fue utilizado en el arreglo de su vivienda ya que en el futuro desea poder abrir un taller mecánico y dar fuente de trabajo a más personas.

loans.use: Expansion of home

loans.name: Ingenio San Juan Group

texts.es:
Very early in the morning feeling the familiar winter's taste in the city of El Alto, the women that take part ni the Ingenio San Juan association start their day making their traditional «salteñas» (baked pastries filled with beef and/or chicken) that they will later sell in the markets and the main streets of La Ceja of El Alto. The Ingenio San Juan association want to expand their business, wanting to offer their clients another variety of salteñas and improve the quality of thoese they already make because they need to have access to a capacity where they will learn to produce their products in a more professional manner. Also, they want to rent more adequate spaces for the sale of their baked goods where their clients will feel more comfortable to enjoy these delicious salteñas, and thsi way also generate greater income for the good fo their families.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Muy temprano sintiendo el crudo invierno típico de la ciudad de El Alto, las señoras que forman parte de la asociación Ingenio San Juan” comienzan su día elaborando las tradicionales salteñas (empanadas rellenas de carne de res y/o pollo, cosidas al horno) que luego las venden en mercados y principales calles de la Ceja de El alto. La asociación Ingenio San Juan quieren ampliar su negocio, desean ofrecer a sus clientes otra variedad de salteñas y mejorar la calidad de las que ellas preparan por lo que necesitan acceder a capacitaciones donde puedan aprender a elaborar sus productos de manera más profesional. Además quieren alquilar ambientes adecuados para la venta de sus empanadas donde sus clientes se sientan cómodos para degustar estas riquisimas salteñas, de este modo generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias

loans.use: In need of capital to rent adequate spaces.

loans.name: La Buena Vida Group

texts.en:
Maxima is a 46-year-old woman who lives in an impoverished community in the eastern Dominican province of Hato Mayor with her husband and three children, ages 19, 22 and 23. She has owned a small colmado for some time, but is requesting this loan to improve, expand and grow her little business. A colmado, a very common type of business in the Dominican Republic, is essentially a small grocery store that offers community members basic food provisions (rice, beans, vegetables), as well as soaps, beverages and miscellaneous household items. With the loan, she plans to expand her inventory of rice, oil, plantains and other food.

It is Maxima's ambition to continue growing her business so that she can continue providing for her family. She insists that her children continue studying so that they can be productive members of society, and hopes that she herself will always progress in both her personal and economic life. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Maxima herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy various food products, such as rice, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 39 years old. She has two small children at home and is married to Cesar Rolando Sánchez. They live in their own home which they received from Conavi, a public institution which builds affordable houses for low income people.

Faciela and Rolando are very enterprising people. They began creating handmade bags made from cardboard. Later, after much hard work they were able to purchase a machine for sewing synthetic leather. They used this to make covers for hot and cold water thermos bottles which are widely used in our country. Each thermos cover is decorated with colorful designs.

They need this loan to purchase an additional machine for sewing synthetic leather, and to purchase raw material as they now have many orders from businesses. With this loan they will be able to fill the order more quickly. In the future they hope to construct a display room for their merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Graciela tiene 39 años tiene 2 hijas menores de edad esta casada con señor Cesar Rolando Sánchez, ellos viven en casa propia que adquirieron de la Conavi, una institución pública que se dedica a la elaboración de casas económicas para gente de escasos recursos.

Graciela y Rolando son dos personas muy emprendedoras, ellas empezaron fabricando bolsitas de papel madera hechas totalmente a mano y luego de mucho esfuerzo compraron una maquina de coser cuerina (cuero sintético) y empezaron a forrar termos de agua fría y calientes que se utilizan bastante en nuestro país. Estos forros que llevan cada termo son decorativos y se hacen en distintos colores y diseños.

Ellos necesitan este préstamo para comprar una más maquina de bordar cuerina y materia prima ya que tiene muchos pedidos de empresas y de este modo podrán abastecer sus pedidos con mayor rapidez. En el futuro desea construir un salón y exhibir sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, thermos bottles, synthetic leather, thread, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio is 33 year old, and is married to Mercedes Ruiz Díaz de C.. They have two small children. They live in their own home which they inherited from their parents.

Sergios worked first for his uncle, from whom he learned to work as a jeweler.. He has worked independently for six year and has a modest rented shop.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase raw material, gold and silver which is less expensive when purchased in bulk. He hopes to purchase his own shop in the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Sergio tiene 33 años esta casado con Mercedes Ruiz Díaz de C., tienen dos hijas menores de edad. Ellos viven en casa propia recibida en herencia de sus padres.

Sergio anteriormente trabajaba con su tío de quien aprendió el oficio de joyero, hace seis años es independiente y posee un modesto local alquilado.

Necesita este crédito para compra de materia prima, oro y plata que al comprar en cierta cantidad le sale con ventaja en el precio.

En el futuro desea comprar para su propio local.

loans.use: Purchase of gold and silver in bulk.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She is married with two children. She sells men’s and women’s outerwear in one of the local markets known as Kamayevskyi. Alla is very hard-working. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. Alla has about $2,000 worth of inventory. Her monthly gross income is about $900.

Alla is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale.

We believe Alla’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
The RENACER committee is located in the Fatima neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. The committee has worked with the Paraguayan Women's Foundation Committee Program for more than two years. This is their seventh cycle, and they do excellent work.

This group fosters a spirit of soliderity, as they are located in a poor area where there is great need for medical assistance and educaiton.

Thanks to this group, several comissions have been formed in their neighborhoods which actually manage various projects which beautify the neighborhoods. They hope to complete these projects this year.

They dream of a better quality of life for their children, and of opening and institute where young people might learn professions so that they can obtain dignified employment.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El comité RENACER pertenece al barrio Fátima de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Se encuentran trabajando con el Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya por más de dos años. Están en el séptimo ciclo y realizan una labor de grupo excelente.

Las señoras se dedican a actividades diversas como la costura, venta de carteras y cosméticos, despensas, venta de bebidas, ropas, lencerías, edredones, etc.

En el grupo se fomenta la solidaridad ya que se encuentran en una zona de pobreza donde hay mucha necesidad en cuanto a asistencia médica y educación.

Gracias a este grupo, se formaron varias comisiones en los barrios donde ellas viven que actualmente manejan distintos proyectos para hermosear los barrios, ellas esperan concluir estos proyectos este año.

Sueñan con tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y realizar un instituto donde los jóvenes aprendan profesiones para poder tener u trabajo digno.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothing, cosmetics such as lotions and perfume, and various merchandise for sale including sugar, milk, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana F. is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo. She runs a small business selling toys in the local market. Some of the attractions of her business are assorted merchandise and the favorable location of her vending facility. Oksana started her venture two years ago. Today she has about $3,000 in inventory and she is making about $400-$600 in profit each month. Oksana is hoping to receive a loan of 5000 Grivnas and repay it to Kiva lenders in 6 months.

Oksana loves kids and believes the type of inventory she offers for sale brings more joy into the lives of the little ones.

Oksana is a true entrepreneur. She doesn’t want to stop where she is now. She wants to continue growing professionally and to see her small venture develop into a big network generating enough finances to provide a decent livelihood for herself and her family.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia U. lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She sells women’s clothing in the central market of this town. Sylvia always offers a nice assortment of clothing merchandise which is a good attraction for potential customers who pass by her vending kiosk. One of the special characteristics of her business is a variety of different sized clothing.

Sylvia has been in this trade for six years. Presently, she has about $4,000 in inventory. Her income is about $500-600 a month.

Sylvia is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to see her venture grow and develop in favorable market conditions with low competition in this niche of business. We believe the sustainability of her business and her determination and willingness to set higher goals will lead Sylvia to ultimate success in her trade and help her fulfill all her dreams.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila R. lives in Pavlograd and sells drinks and bakery items in the central city market. She is a married mom. Her husband is a coalminer and her son Artyom is 14 and goes to school.

After graduation from medical college Ludmila worked as a nurse. However, she was downsized and decided to try her luck as an entrepreneur. Today Ludmila’s vending location is well known in the market because the inventory she offers for sale is always fresh and of good quality. She has been in business for five years. Currently, she has about $3,000 in turnover capital. Her income is about $600 a month.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to purchase additional merchandise such as pastry and cakes that always sell well in summer. Ludmila is hoping higher sales will provide her family with additional income and help her fulfill her other dreams, too. Some of her long-term plans are to purchase additional equipment for her kiosk, such as a refrigerator and a microwave.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander F. offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk in the Western Ukraine. He has a beautiful wife and three adorable children. Alexander has been working in this sphere of trade for eight years. He has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine financial services. Today Alexander’s daily income is about $40.

Alexander would like to receive a loan of 3500 Grivnas to cover some maintenance costs and to repair the running gear of his vehicle. He is always trying to find ways to reduce costs and increase his profits.

One of Alexander’s main goals is to provide for his family of five. He’s the only breadwinner in the family as his wife is pregnant with their fourth child. We believe Alexander’s perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and focused approach as a businessman will secure prompt loan repayment of the current loan to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with a one-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Vitalyi used to work as a cook and a bartender, but he decided to start a new business that could provide him with higher income and a flexible working schedule. This is why Vitalyi became a taxi driver. Today he offers transportation services in Ukraine. It is the only source of income for the family. He uses walkie-talkies to get to different locations on time and it helps him serve more clients in less time. Vitalyi has been in this business for four years. Currently, his daily income is about $40-50.

Vitalyi is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase an engine that would work on gas. He believes this change will help him save money on diesel, as the new type of fuel is a lot cheaper. Vitalyi is hoping to repay the loan in 8 months. We believe his perseverance in work and desire to see her business succeed will guarantee prompt loan repayment and consistent growth of his venture.

loans.use: To install gas system equipment.

loans.name: Angela Deyla

texts.es:
Angela S. is originally from the Villanueva area, and actually her struggles have actually multiplied because the reconstruction of her home, which had found itself in a very bad state, is almost complete. She needs to improve her small children’s living conditions.

Having started the repairs, she found herself forced to hold up the work because of the absence of economic means. Because of this, she has now come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to purchase the construction materials to continue with the improvement of her life which she needs so much.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer

La dama Angela S. es originaria del municipio de Villanueva de donde es originaria y actualmente sus esfuerzos se han multiplicado por la razón de que está llevando a cabo la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación por haberse encontrado en mal estado y necesita mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños hijos.

Al haber iniciado con la reconstrucción se vio en la obligación de detener esta obra por la ausencia del recurso económico. Por esto es que hoy en día ha llegado a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Nimia Aurora

texts.es:
Like all Nicaraguan mothers, Mrs. Nimia Jiron has assumed the responsibility of providing her children the coverage and the support that they need for their development, all in the middle of her great struggles in her work in the Villanueva area of the city Chinandega.

She has asked for a loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials to continue the reconstruction of her home. Today she hopes that the loan granted and that this way, she can move forward together with her family in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nimia J., como toda madre nicaragüense ha asumido la responsabilidad de brindarles a sus hijos la cobertura y el apoyo que ellos necesitan para su desarrollo habiendo alcanzado esto por medio de sus altos esfuerzos en su trabajo en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su vivienda. Hoy en día ella espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera lograr salir adelante junto con su familia en su municipio.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Al Malak Group

texts.en:
The A. Malak group includes three women. The group’s name means Angel in Arabic. These women live in a village in the Bekaa Valley of Lebanon. For some time now, they have been working in different businesses. Fawzieh, 23 years old, who is single, and Fatmeh, 24, who is married, trade goods. The third member of the group, Sahar, 19 years old, is married and owns a grocery shop.

The group is requesting a loan for USD 900 to share equally among the members. Each member of the group is requesting a loan to use as working capitA. to improve their business. This is the first time that the A. Malak group is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a green outfit in the picture (3rd from left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors the A. Malak group.

loans.use: For working capital to improve each group member's retail business.

loans.name: Fatmeh's Group

texts.en:
Fatmeh group is composed of four women living in a small village from the Bekaa valley. AmA. , 25 years old, Amina, 49 years old, Fatmeh, 34 years old, and also Fatmeh, 31 years old, are the members of Fatmeh group. They are all married. The 4 women work from their home on selling accessories, sewing and selling clothes respectively. They need an amount of USD 300 each as working capitA. to further expand their business as this allows them to generate more revenues for their families and therefore improve their livelihoods. This is the first time that Fatmeh group requests a loan from A. Majmoua. 

The young woman wearing a white veil on the picture (second row - 1st from left) is A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors Fatmeh group.

About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: USD 1,200 for the whole group (300 per woman) as working capital for their business

loans.name: Fatmeh's Group

texts.en:
Fatmeh group is composed of four women living in a small village in the Bekaa valley. AmA., 25 years old; Amina, 49 years old; Fatmeh, 34 years old; and Fatmeh, 31 years old, are all married. The 4 women work from their homes selling accessories, sewing, and selling clothes, respectively.

Each of the women are requesting a loan of USD 300 as working capitA. to further expand their business. This loan of USD 1,200 will allow them to generate more revenue for their families and therefore improve their lives. This is the first loan that Fatmeh group is requesting from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a white veil on the picture (second row, first from the left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors the Fatmeh group.

loans.use: For working capital to generate more income from their home-based businesses

loans.name: Mirna Group

texts.en:
Elham, 38 years old, Fayrouz, 49 years old, and Wafa, 46 years old, live in a small village in West Bekaa. They called their group Mima. Those women are all married and sell kitchen equipment and plastic "Tupperware like" containers.

Each member of the group is requesting a loan of USD 300 as working capitA. to replenish their inventory and thus generate more revenue for their family. This is the first time that the Mima group is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: For working capital to replenish inventory of kitchen equipment and plastic containers

loans.name: Al Chams Group

texts.en:
A. Chams group, whose name means the Sun in Arabic, is composed of three married women from a small village in the Bekaa. Hanadi, 37 years old, works as promoter for a speciA. brand of herbA. medicines; Touffaha, 52 years old, is a promoter of cosmetic goods, and, Malak, 19 years old, wants to start a new business. These three motivated women need a loan for an amount of USD 300 each as working capitA. to expand their respective business. This is the first time that A. Chames group requests a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a veil on the picture (2nd from left) is A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors A. Chams group.

loans.use: USD 900 (300 per woman) as working capital for their individual business

loans.name: Al Hayat Group

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 20 years old, is a married woman from a small village in the Bekaa Valley who owns a small clothes shop. The other members of her group are Asmahan, 43 years old, married, who has a grocery shop, and Aida, 38 years old, single, who wants to start a new business.

These women are requesting loans of USD 400 each (totA. of USD 1,200). They need this amount for working capitA. to improve their businesses. They named their group A. Hayat, which means life in Arabic, because of their love for life. This is the first time that the A. Hayat group is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a veil on the picture (second fromthe left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitorsthe A. Hayat group.

loans.use: For working capital to improve their individual businesses

loans.name: Mimko Group

texts.en:
Mimko is a group of 3 women: two are divorced, Baraa, 34 years old, and Asmahan, 45 years old; Arzeh, 23 years old, is married. These women live in small villages in West Bekaa, and work as promoters for Tupperware items. Asmahan sells clothes, too.

They are requesting a loan of USD 300 each as working capital to expand and improve their businesses. This is the first time that the Mimko group is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a blue veil in the picture (fourth from the left) is the Al Majmoua credit officer who monitors the Mimko group.

loans.use: For working capital to expand and improve their business promoting Tupperware items

loans.name: Artisanat Nana Group

texts.en:
Artisanat Nana group includes three married women who live in Bekaa. As the name indicates, Aya 19 years old, Hayat, 52 years old, and Hekmat, 36 years old, deA. in artisanA. handicrafts and crocheted items. They are requesting a loan of USD 300 each (totA. of USD 900) as working capitA. to purchase more materials so they can expand their business. This is the first loan that the Artisanat Nana group is requesting from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a blue veil on the picture (3rd from left) is A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors Artisanat Nana group.

loans.use: To purchase material for creating artisanal handicrafts and crocheted items

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina is a single mother with one daughter. She comes from a humble family with 10 siblings. Four of them work making and selling their own brand of clothing. Liduvina has followed in the footsteps of her parents who began the business. Liduvina has had her own small business selling clothing which she makes in the capital and in the interior of the country for the last 5 years. Thanks to her hard work she was able to finish construction on her home, open her own workshop, and pay for her university expenses. She plans to expand her business in the future, purchasing more machines to increase the production and sales of her products so that she can be a source of jobs to more people.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Liduvina es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija. Liduvina proviene de una familia humilde de 10 hermanos, cuatro de sus hermanos se dedican a la fabricación y venta de ropas de su propia marca. La señora siguió los pasos de sus padres quienes empezaron con el negocio.

Hace 5 años que Liduvina tiene su propia microempresa quien vende ropas de su propia producción en la capital y en el interior del país. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo terminar de construir su vivienda, tener su propia fábrica y solventar sus gastos universitarios.

En el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su empresa, comprar más maquinas para una mayor producción y venta de sus productos y también dar fuentes de trabajo a mas personas.

loans.use: Purchase of material, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitadas Group

texts.en: Anastacia (pictured in the middle) is a 54-year-old woman who lives in a small, secluded village in the eastern province of Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic.  Anastacia came to Esperanza two years ago, looK. for a loan to support her small business maK. and selling arepas (a sweet bread) to little grocery stores in her community.  Anastacia is requesting this loan in order to buy a larger amount of flour, oil, sugar, coconut and other ingredients to meet the demand of her customers.  She works incredibly hard so that her business will continue to grow and become more stable in order to provide her family with a sustainable income.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Anastacia herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, oil, butter, coconut and other ingredients

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Grupo Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
The Kuña Kyrey committee is completing its third cycle as a committee of entrepreneurial women. They have an excellent payment history, and are very united and respectful to one another. They assist their community by showing an example of union and cooperation, while giving a good example to their children as women who are hardworking and trustworthy, to give their children a better future.

These women use their loans to invest in their individual businesses, so that they might expand the variety and quality of the products which they offer. They are able to obtain better prices by making purchases wholesale.

Many of them are considering investing their loans in new activities which will produce additional income, such as the sales of artisan wares. Each will receive a loan of 600,000 Guarani.

They have been members of the women's entrepreneurial committee for one year, and they hope to continue growing in order to improve their quality of life. Their commercial activities include the sale of fruits and vegetables, fast food sales, the sales of clothing, lotions and lingerie, sales of cleaning products, brooms andartisan products.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El comité Kuña Kyrey esta pasando al tercer ciclo de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, presentaron un pago excelente, son muy unidas y respetuosas entre sí. Ayudan a su comunidad dando ejemplo de unión y cooperación, también dan ejemplo a su hijos pues son mujeres trabajadoras y comprometidas para darles un futuro mejor.

Ellas utilizan los créditos para invertirlos en sus respectivos negocios, y así con ello lograr surtir de mayor variedad y calidad de los productos que venden otra ventaja es que la compra en cantidades mayores poseen grandes descuentos.

Muchas de ellas ya están pensando en invertir sus préstamos en nuevas actividades que produzcan entradas extras como la venta de artesanía. Todas reciben un promedio de G. 600.000 cada una.

Ellas están hace un año en el comité de mujeres emprendedoras, y esperan ir creciendo para acceder a un mejor estilo de vida. Entre las actividades que desempeñan se encuentra: venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas rápidas, venta de ropas, cremas y lencerías, venta de productos de limpieza, escobas y artesanías.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables, dairy products, soft drinks, snack foods, cleaning products, perfume, lotions and general cosmetics. Also for the investment in the purchase of material for the creation of artisan work.

loans.name: Comité Primavera Group

texts.es:
The Primavera Committee is based in Capiata Kennedy, and city that is a few minutes away from the San Lorenzo Office which is the closest to the area. This group has been working as a Women's Committee for 1 year, and is now in its fourth program cycle. Each program cycle lasts 4 months, which is the maximum length of the women's loans. During each cycle, borrowers receive training from specially trainedadvisers. The Primavera group raises money through community activities in neighborhoods and other areas. The women work in diverse activities, including the sales of lotions and cosmetics. Some have small stores, while others sell clothing, fruit, cleaning products, food, etc.

These women have been able to succeed and grow with each loan that they have received. Among their most notable successes is the fact that some of those who were itinerant saleswomen now possess locals from which they run their businesses.

They are very organized and demanding of each other, having established their own internal regulations. They also show a high degree ofsolidarity, with some of the women tutoring the children of the other members in subjects which are particularly difficult, since many of them were not able to finish their primary or secondary education.

With the loans that they receive, these women will be able to make bulk purchases of additional merchandise for sale.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El comité Primavera es de la zona de Capiatá Kennedy, una ciudad que queda a minutos de la oficina de San Lorenzo que es la más cercana a la zona. Este comité tiene un año de trabajar como Comité de Mujeres y ahora están en el cuarto ciclo del Programa. Cada ciclo del programa dura cuatro meses que es el periodo máximo de pago para estas señoras y durante estos ciclos ellas reciben capacitaciones de parte de asesores especialmente entrenados para dictarlas.

El grupo Primavera, realiza actividades comunitarias en sus barrios al igual que actividades extras para recaudar fondos para sus ahorros.

Se dedican a actividades diversas, entre ellas están algunas que venden cremas y cosméticos, otras posee despensas, otras venden ropas, frutas, productos de limpieza, venta de comidas, etc.

Estas señoras han logrado superarse y crecer con cada crédito recibido. Entre los logros más notables está que algunas que eran vendedoras ambulantes hoy día ya poseen un negocio fijo de venta.

Son muy organizadas y exigentes unas con otras, ellas poseen su propio reglamento interno. Además de todo esto, son muy solidarias entre sí, algunas de las señoras se dedican a enseñar a los hijos de las demás algunas materias de la escuela que son difíciles especialmente ya que no todas lograron culminar sus estudios primarios y secundarios.

Con el crédito que recibirán ellas podrán adquirir mercaderías para la venta en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables, cleaning products, and products for sale in stores such as dairy, meat, pastas, flour, and oil. Also perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Juan Villalta

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juan Villalta, I am 46 years old and I am married. My wife and I have lived in this community for 25 years.
When I go out to do occasional jobs, my wife helps me to tend our store. 
We have a solar energy plant to provide electricity to the store, and ours is the only store in the area that carries ice and refrigerated products. 
At this time, I am requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to keep up with my customers' demands and needs. I have to travel outside our community to purchase merchandise, and it is necessary to buy several-days worth of supplies to stock up the store.

 Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer   

hola mi nombre es Juan Villalta, tengo 46 años de edad, estoy casado, no tengo hijos y tenemos 25 años de vivir en nuestra comunidad. tengo la ayuda de mi esposa para la atencion de nuestros clientes cuando a veces yo salgo a realizar otros trabajos, en nuestro negocio tenemos instalado una planta de energia solar la cual nos provee la energia electrica y esto nos ayuda ya que nuestro negocio es el unico que vende hielo y prodructos refrigerados, pero en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para cumplir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes, ya que tengo que viajar fuera de mi comunidad para ir a comprar las cosas del negocio y no se puede salir a comprar cada 3 dias, sino que hay que comprar para abastecer el negocio para varios dias.

loans.use: purchase of sauces, sodas, churros, toilet paper, beans, rice, bread, salt, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, candy, batteries, sardines, cookies, coffee, razors, pasta, lard, margarine, cold meats, ice.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Hello, I am Pabla R., and I have run a small grocery store for 5 years. I am 51 years old, and a single mother of two children. 
My business is doing well, but I cannot keep up with my customers' demands for more merchandise.

I am requesting your support with a loan to buy more merchandise including dairy products, cold meats, beef and poultry. The profit on these products is larger and that will help my business prosper.

 Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer 


hola mi nombre es Pabla R. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 51 años de edad, soy madre soltera de 2 hijos, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio en el cual me va muy bien, pero las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas y no me doy abasto para comprar todo lo que necesitan, por eso estoy solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia como ser lacteos, embutidos, carnes y a este tipo de productos se les saca mas ganancias que a los demas, por tal razon pido apoyo para poder salir adelante con mi negocio,

loans.use: wholesale purchase of groceries: pasta, lard, oil, salt, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, butter, bread, soap, air fresheners, hair gel, hair rollers, sodas, toilet paper, lights, cereals, feminine napkins

loans.name: Esperanza Divina Group

texts.en: Ramona is a 59-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a small rural town in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. This is Ramona’s fourth loan from Esperanza International, which she will use to invest in additional inventory for her clothing and curtain business. She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, undergarments and curtains.  She hopes that one day she will be able to buy or rent a fixed space from which to sell her clothing as the business is currently located in her home.  In her free time, Ramona enjoys spending time with her friends and family, especially her two grandsons, ages 2 and 4.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Ramona herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, undergarments and curtains

loans.name: Comité Crecer Group

texts.es:
The "Crecer" [Grow] Committee is a new committee within the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs] of the Paraguay Foundation. All its members live in the same neighborhood and work in different areas such as selling clothing, cosmetics, food, cleaning products, various products for the home, or small general stores where they sell all kinds of basic food items.

The women will use the money they receive from this loan in each of their respective businesses, and they will be able to offer a greater variety and higher quality products. The loan will also benefit them in that they will be able to buy merchandise wholesale in the markets, since buying in bulk means they will receive better discounts.

The members of the committee already have a small amount of money saved and they plan to continue having additional activities such as food festivals and raffles in order to supplement their savings.

Some of the activities they are currently involved in include: selling fruit and vegetables, fast food, clothing, cosmetics and lingerie, cleaning products and chipas (a popular food in Paraguay).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “Crecer” es un comité nuevo dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas son vecinas del mismo barrio, realizan distintos tipos de actividades como venta de ropas, cosméticos, comida, productos de limpieza, artículos varios para el hogar y despensas en donde se venden todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad.

Ellas utilizarán el crédito que reciban en sus respectivos negocios, y así con ello lograr surtir de mayor variedad y calidad los productos que venden. Otra de las ventajas a la que podrán acceder es a la compra al por mayor de las mercaderías en los mercados pues cuando se compra en grandes cantidades ellas obtiene mejores descuentos.

Ellas ya tiene un pequeño dinero ahorrado y piensan seguir realizando actividades extras como ferias de comidas y rifas para poder incrementar sus ahorros.

Entre las actividades que desempeñan se encuentra: venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas rápidas, venta de ropas, cremas y lencerías, venta de productos de limpieza, y chipas (comida típica).

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and supplies to sell, such as: cosmetics, cleaning supplies, fruit, vegetables, eggs, meat, flour, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio P. Avala is a very hard-working individual who lives with his wife in an unsafe area called Tacumbú. Day by day they struggle; she has a small kiosk in their house where she sells groceries and drinks, and he travels to the city to sell his carpets. Twice a month he travels to the center of the country to sell his carpets as well. He has dedicated himself to this for a long time, as it allows him the income necessary to maintain his family and pay his bills.

Mr. Avala needs the loan to buy more small, medium, and large carpets.

loans.use: To buy more small, medium, and large carpets.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en: Hugo Alberto M. is 56 years old. All his life he has been a medical salesman, but as he gets older it is difficult to continue. For this reason, a year and a half ago, he decided to become a micro-entrepreneur. Selling footwear has gone well, which has raised his credit limit. His work is flourishing as he travels to businesses and offices in the metropolitan area. Now he needs credit support, which he will use for his business to purchase women's and menss shoes.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's shoes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena has been working with Fundacion 2000 since 2005. She is married and has two grown-up children who no longer need her support. Her first loan of 3000 cordobas was used to purchase cosmetics and clothing.
The loans that she has received in the past have resulted in better living conditions for  Maria Elena and her husband: they were able to fix-up their home and to purchase home appliances.

This time Maria Elena is requesting a loan of $375 dollars (7,000 cordobas) to use as working capital. 
Her living conditions and payback guarantees have improved, as her husband also works repairing watches and both contribute to the household expenses.

 Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer 

La señora trabaja con fundacion 2000, desde al año 2005, habiendo iniciado con un capital de C$ 3000. córdobas, para comprar mercaderia variada como cosmeticos, ropa, es casada tiene dos hijos que no dependen de ella ya son mayores de edad, vive en casa propia.
Con los prestamos otorgados ella ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida ya que ha compuesto su casa, así como tambien a comprado electrodomesticos en la actualidad maneja un credito por C$ 7,000.00 córdobas, para capital de trabajo. 
Sus condicones de vida así como sus garantias se han reforzado, su esposo se dedica a la reparacion de reloj de pulso, donde éste le ayuda con los gastos del hogar que basicamente es para los dos ya que no tiene hijos menores.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: José
