texts.en: Jose Maria is a young man, married with three boys. About 8 years ago he decided to open his own business, with very little help, but with much effort and sacrifices. His business has grown with attention to his clients and food products. His business is flourishing with the possibility of expanding even more. He already has his own house and his son is studying and helping with the micro-business. He request the loan in addition to buy meat, eggs, cheese and drinks.

loans.use: to buy hamburguer meat, cheese, eggs, and drinks like soda.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda F. is single and lives with her parents, who also help with her business and attending to her clients. The business has a good location in a highly commercial zone and her general store is one of the most known businesses in the center of Asunción.

It is located at Palma street at Ayola Street, on a busy thoroughfare visited mostly by tourists. She began with approximately 3,000,000 guaranies ($775 USD) in capital, which has increased over time since she has a broad client base given that where the store is located is very populated and busy.

Nilda is withdrawing the loan to buy various items such as various models of silver jewelry and women’s clothing for the fall and winter months.

Some of Nilda’s aspirations are for her business to grow, in terms of equipment or furniture for their future company imports, to distribute clothing and shoes, to offer more jobs, and to offer an environment more comfortable and pleasant for her customers.

loans.use: to buy  various models of silver jewelry and women’s clothing for the fall and winter months

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is married and has one daughter, who is already of age and is currently helping to attend to clients. Her business has a good location, in the center of market called “number 4,” a highly comercial zone near Rodríguez de Francia Avenue, at the cross of Battilana street. Teresa began with approximately 1,000,000 guaraníes ($250 USD) in capital, which has grown over time. Currently, she has a broad client base in an area that is very populated and busy.

She is withdrawing the loan to buy various items such as pullovers, jackets, quilts, and especially garments for children for the fall and winter season. She starts her day very early at 4am so that she can buy everything that she needs for her business.

One of her aspirations is to expand her business soon in terms of equipment and furniture for her own store, so she can offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

loans.use: To buy various items such as pullovers, jackets, quilts, and especially garments for children for the fall and winter season

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Benadina R. Munoz is 60 years old and has dedicated the past 20 years to the selling and distribution of charcoal in her region. Thanks to her earnings, she has been able to afford to send her three children to school. One of her children just completed University and received a degree in Business Administration. The other children are in high school.

The loan that Mrs. Munoz is requesting will be invested in purchasing the majority of her charcoal for one month. By purchasing her merchandise upfront, her costs are lower and her business is more profitable.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy charcoal

loans.name: Comité Alegría Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in July of 2006. The group contact is Teresa Dejesus V., who learned about the group thanks to members of the group “United Women of San José, Lambaré. This group is made up of 20 women of the settlement “San José of the neighborhood of San Isidro of Lambaré.”

This system of credit helps the women know each other as more than just neighbors – as friends. They sell items such as chicken, hamburgers, and sausage, in order to raise petty cash together as a group. They are in solidarity with one another.

They are requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Comité Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in July of 2006. The group contact is Jorgelina López de Valdez, who learned about the Foundation and the program thanks to members of the group “Enterprising Women of Mbachio-Lambare.” The group has 17 members of the neighborhoods Mbachio, San Roque and San Antonio in the city of Lambaré.

This system of credit helps the women know each other as more than just neighbors – as friends. They sell items such as chicken, hamburgers, and sausage in order to raise petty cash together as a group. They are in solidarity with one another.

These women have different types of businesses like grocery stores, small restaurants, clothing sales, home product sales, liquor stores, kiosks, and others. Now, they are requesting a new loan in order to invest in their business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha C., 36 and a widow, is a villager in Ang Tunloap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer and she has three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is too young to work or study.

The family lives in poor conditions in an old house, thus Mrs. Chantha C. would like to build a new house to replace the old one. She therefore has asked for a loan to buy timber to build her new house.

Previously, Mrs. Chantha C. obtained a loan to start her current grocery business.

loans.use: To buy timber to build her new house

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha D. lives in Taing Snor Village in Kampong Province Province. He is currently in the plantation business. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Sokha D. works at a charcoal kiln. His wife, Mrs. Touch Chhun, is a subsistence farmer and charcoal seller.

Mr. Sokha D.’s plantation now has insufficient draft animals to plow his rice field, so he decided to ask for a loan to add to his profit to buy another cow to use as a draft animal.

Mr. Sokha D. is 24 and the father of a child who is too young to work or stuD.. Mr. Sokha D. got malaria and he was sent to a private hospital. His wife had unforeseen expenses to get him cured and that is why they are short of money. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy another cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom M. is a subsistence farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Mom M. has a pig-breeding business which she managed to start thanks to a loan obtained from AMK. Her husband, Mr. Lim San, is a subsistence farmer and also works at a charcoal kiln for a small salary.

Mrs. Mom M. is 28 and the mother of five children, two of whom are attending state school while the remaining three stay at home because they are very young. Although the parents have various business activities, they still live in poor conditions and in a small house. Thus, Mrs. Mom M. decided to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace her current one. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to build a new house to replace her current one

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeurn C. is a villager in Prey Chum Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently a subsistence farmer and a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Von Sum, is a subsistence farmer and house builder. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Von Sum is a bed maker. In his bed-making business, he has now insufficient raw materials to make beds; thus, his wife, Mrs. Moeurn C., has applied for a loan to buy bed-making materials for her husband's business.

Mrs. Moeurn C. is 51 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy bed-making materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Mrs. Tin S. is a farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uk Ying, is a farmer and he owns a small kiln where he can make a charcoal to sell for a profit. Mrs. Tin S.’s plantation has faced a small problem because she does not have enough cows to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Tin S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her profit in order to buy another cow to work with the old one in the rice field.

Mrs. Tin S. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Tin S. obtained a loan to start a pig breeding business. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy another cow to work with the old one in the rice field

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton R., 36, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Chem Vy, and their four children.

Chem Vy has been a farmer since 2006 and he typically makes $5 (US dollars) each day in the fields. Ton R. believes that her husband can increase his yield and the family’s income through the purchase of a tractor to plow the fields. Cambodians who own tractors are able to plow their own fields, and often rent the tractor to other farmers for additional income.

Ton R. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to purchase a tractor and begin this new business venture. She sees this loan as an investment in her future and the future of the family business. She appreciates the opportunities that this loan will provide: an increase to her family’s income and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a tractor

loans.name: Brach

texts.en:
Brach M., 63, sells traditional Khmer cakes in the local market of the Prey Veng province where she lives. She is married to Meas Sambo (pictured above) and they have a son (pictured, with his father) who lives with them and helps to support the family through their motor taxi business.

Brach M. typically makes $3 (US dollars) per day. She has sold Khmer cakes for the last 28 years. Her husband makes $4 (US dollars) per day in the motor taxi business, where he shares a motorbike with his son.

Brach M. is asking for a loan of $600 (US dollars) to purchase an additional motorbike for her son, so he can run his own motor taxi service, and enable the family to increase their income. There are plenty of customers available for another motor taxi service; however, the family lacks the capital to make the purchase. A second motorbike would decrease the wear and tear put on the existing motorbike and allow the family an opportunity to increase their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En S., 53, is a widow who lives in the Prey Veng province and sells mangos in the local food market. She has been selling fruits for the last eight years in the market. She has one child who is married that also sells fruits in the market.

En S. typically makes $6 (US dollars) per day and would like to expand her business to increase her daily income. She believes that her lack of capital is preventing her from expanding her mango business and reaching more customers.

En S. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to purchase in bulk, a large quantity of mangos to resell in the market. She believes that the investment will allow her to improve her standard of living and allow her to better support herself.

loans.use: Purchase mangos for resale

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn O., 26, works with her husband, Chhorn Sarat, in the Prey Veng province where they live with their two young children. She and her husband purchase stone from workers on the mountain and resell the stone in the local market.

Together, they typically make $5 (US dollars) per day. The people who purchase the stone turn it into a grinding mill.

They believe that their business can be expanded to reach more customers, but they lack the necessary capital to purchase additional stone for this expansion. Porn O. is asking for a loan of $600 (US dollars) to purchase more stone to sell in the market. She believes this investment will be a great opportunity for the family to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase stone for resale

loans.name: Dum

texts.en:
Dum S., 37, lives with her husband, Rous Chamroeun, and their four children in the Prey Veng province. She sells spices and herbs in the local food market. She typically makes $5 (US dollars) per day. Her husband works as a bodyguard and makes $3 (US dollars) per day.

High inflation in Cambodia over this past year has made it difficult for entrepreneurs to expand their small businesses.

Dum S. would like to expand her business to increase her income, but she lacks the necessary capital to expand her inventory.

Dum S. is asking for a loan of $500 (US dollars) to purchase more spices and herbs to expand her current stock and increase her daily income. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that will allow her to expand the business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase inventory of spices and herbs

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum Y., 48, is a widow who sells books, pens, pencils, and other school supplies, along with soup in her little convenience stand. She lives with five of her children in the Prey Veng province making $17 (US dollars) in revenue each day.

High inflation in Cambodia over this past year has made it difficult for entrepreneurs to expand their small businesses.

Oum Y. is asking for a loan of $1200 (US dollars) to purchase additional inventory for her stand, which will allow her to increase profits.

Oum Y. has many children to support and lacks the capital needed to expand her inventory. She would like to increase her daily income and improve her standard of living with this investment.

loans.use: Increase inventory of school supplies

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou Y., is a 51 year old widow who lives with two of her children in the Prey Veng province. She sells groceries in the local market and typically makes $8 (US dollars) per day.

Hou Y. is assisted by her two children: one is a driver and the other works to sell groceries along with her mother.

Hou Y. would like to expand her business, but lacks the ability to transport her goods at a low cost. She would like to purchase a small truck to transport her goods, enabling her to reach more customers in a variety of locations.

Hou Y. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to purchase a small truck. She believes this investment can improve her standard of living through an increase in her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase small truck to transport goods

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Saom S., 56, lives with her husband, Chiv Trok, and their two daughters in the Prey Veng province. She is a wedding chef, who typically makes $3 (US dollars) per day. Her husband works in construction and makes $2 (US dollars) per day.

The family is also supported by their two daughters who are employed in a local garment factory.

Saom S. lives in an area that is very rural and her home is surrounded by farmers. Many of the poor farmers cannot afford to purchase a tractor, so they rent a tractor each season from someone who owns one.

Saom S. would like to purchase a small tractor to rent out to the local farmers to increase her family’s daily income.

Saom S. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to make this purchase. She believes the profits from this purchase will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun S., 46, works with her husband, Say Soeun, catching and selling fish in the local food market. Together, they make a total of $5 (US dollars) per day.

They live with one of their daughters in the Prey Veng province. Their daughter works in the local garment factory where she makes $100 (US dollars) per month to support some of the family’s expenses.

Kun S. would like to purchase a wooden boat for fishing to expand her family business and to increase her daily income.

Kun S. is asking for a loan of $300 (US dollars) to purchase a wooden boat that will allow her to access better fishing locations and increase her daily catch. She believes this investment is an opportunity to expand her business in the future and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S., 35, is married to Chhum Pheakdey, and they live with their two children in the Prey Veng province. She sells lottery tickets in the local market and is paid by commission, typically making $5 (US dollars) per day. Her husband runs a motor taxi service and usually makes $5 (US dollars) per day.

Pov S. has been looking for ways to increase her daily income and believes that her husband’s business has room for expansion. He can make higher profits and increase his daily income through the transformation of his motor taxi into a tuk tuk. A tuk tuk is a motorbike with a trailer attached where people can sit inside. It is popular among foreign tourists.

Pov S. is asking for a loan of $1200 (US dollars) to purchase this trailer for her husband to improve his current business and their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a trailer for motorbike

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor C., 49, is a widow who lives in the Prey Veng province with her daughter and husband. She owns a small grocery store in the local market and makes $3 (US dollars) per day.

Sor C. believes her business can attract more customers and profits if she were able to increase her inventory.

Sor C. is asking for a loan of $700 (US dollars) to purchase additional groceries in bulk, allowing her to increase profits by reselling more goods in the market.

Sor C. believes that this will be a sustainable business venture which will allow her to increase her profits in the long-term and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase groceries in bulk to resell

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S. N., 29, lives with her husband, Ben Thuon, and their one young child in the Prey Veng province. She has worked in the local food market for the last seven years, selling roast beef, chicken, and pork. She makes $4 (US dollars) per day.

Yem S. N.'s husband operates a taxi service with a large trailer attached to the rear of his motorbike. The trailer allows him to transport a large number of people at one time and he typically makes $5 (US dollars) per day. He has been running this service for the last eighteen years and needs to replace the old trailer.

Yem S. N. is asking for a loan of $600 (US dollars) for her husband to purchase a new trailer, which she believes will allow him to increase his daily income and improve the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: Purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va H., 22, is a used cell phone dealer who lives with her husband, Sean Rasie (pictured above), and their young child in the Prey Veng province.

Va H. typically makes $2 (US dollars) per day selling used phones. Her husband, who is a telephone repairman, typically makes $3 (US dollars) per day. He works on many of the phones that his wife sells. They have been running their cell phone shop for about five years.

Va H.'s husband needs to purchase some new tools to continue his phone repair business.

Va H. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to purchase new tools for her husband’s business. She believes this investment will be a good opportunity to increase her family’s income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase tools to repair phones

loans.name: Ni Ketut Santi

texts.id:
Mrs Ni Ketut Santi lives in the village of Berawantangi-Tukadaya. The very tight economy makes supporting her growing family difficult, especially because she must pay for her children's schooling. Because her husband's income as a farmer is not enough to meet her family's needs, Ketut Santi has started to raise pigs at her home. After receiving her first loan, Ketut Santi was able to purchase 1 sow and one piglet for fattening. The sow has since given birth to 10 piglets. By selling the piglets and the fattened pig, Ketut Santi made a profit of 1,500,000 Rupiah in 6 months. With this profit she repaid her first loan and would now like to secure another loan to purchase another sow and pig feed. With this additional sow she hopes to bring in even more profit than she did with her first loan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ni Ketut Santi tinggal disebuah desa di Berawantangi –Tukadaya, dengan kondisi ekonomi yang sangat pas-pasan dan dipersulit lagi dengan kebutuhan keluarga yang tinggi serta ditambah harus menyekolahkan anaknya. Karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, Ketut Santi berusaha menambah penghasilannya dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI serta pembinaan yang cukup, Ketut Santi mampu membeli 1 ekor induk babi dan 1 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Setelah dipelihara, induk babi tersebut melahirkan anak babi sebanyak 10 ekor. Dari penjualan bibit-bibit babi serta babi penggemukan miliknya tersebut Ketut Santi mampu mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Selanjutnya Ketut Santi kembali meminjam ke DINARI untuk menambah modal dari keuntungan yang didapatkan dari pinjaman pertama yang akan digunakannya untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi lagi serta membeli pakannya. Dengan tambahan induk peliharaan diharapkan akan mendatangkan keuntungan yang lebih dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: to purchase a sow and pig feed

loans.name: Homit

texts.en:
Homit H. sells cattle. He started his business in 1993 by raising some calves. Now, Homit has a large cow shed in which he houses many calves and milk cows. He likes animals and his job very much, and his business enables him to support his family.

Homit is 43 years old. He is married with three children. His youngest child is in his last year of school, while his elder son is an adult and helps Homit and his wife with the business. In practice, the business requires a great deal of effort in order to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, Homit gets up every morning at five o’clock to feed the animals and to look after them.

Today, Homit is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 over a 12-month term. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase calves in order to expand the business and to thereby generate more income. In fact, Homit needs the extra income because his children's expenses increase as they grow older. Now, all of his children are studying at school, and he wants them to continue to receive a good education because he hopes that they will achieve their goals in life. With your help, this will be possible, so please be an important part of the growth of Homit’s business.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional calves

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tantri

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Tantri's perseverance is unquestionable. It is evidenced by how hard she works to help her family's economic situation by raising pigs at her home. She feels the income her husband brings in as a farmer is not enough to meet the day to day needs of her family and that their family really needs more income to get by. Ketut Tantri is a good candidate for a loan because she has already successfully completed a first loan which helped her purchase quality pig feed that helped her pigs grow very large and healthy. Ketut Tantri already owns 2 sows. After carefully tending her sows, they gave birth to piglets which she was able to sell for 200,000 Rupiah a piece. This brought in a profit of 500,000 Rupiah. For her next loan she would like to purchase piglets for fattening and the necessary feed to raise them. From the profits from this next loan, she hopes she is able to bring in enough to completely meet her family's economic needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Keuletan Ni Ketut Tantri tidak usah diragukan lagi, terbukti untuk membantu perekonomian keluarga Ketut Tantri menjalankan usaha memelihara ternak babi di rumahnya. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani dirasakan belum mencukupi kebutuhan sehari-hari yang semakin meningkat saja. Keputusan Ketut Tantri untuk meminjam ke DINARI sangatlah tepat karena pinjaman tersebut sangat membantu Ketut Tantri untuk membeli pakan ternak babi sehingga perkembangan babinya sangat bagus. Kebetulan Ketut Tantri sudah memiliki 2 ekor babi penginduk. Setelah dipelihara hingga mampu melahirkan anak-anak babi dan akhirnya dijual per ekor sebesar Rp. 200.000,- Ketut Tantri mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000,-. Untuk pinjaman DINARI selanjutnya Ketut Tantri akan menggunakannya untuk membeli bibit penggemukan serta pakan tentunya. Dengan kelanjutan pinjaman ini diharapkan keuntungan yang didapat akan bertambah sehingga akan berdampak baik bagi ekonomi keluarga Ketut Tantri sendiri.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ni Putu Yasi

texts.id:
In this down economy, Putu Yasi has a very large responsibility to meet the day to day needs of her family and to pay for her 3 children to attend school. What's more, her husband is only a farmer whose field is too small to produce enough for the family. Due to the situation, Putu Yasi resolved to raise pigs and started out by purchasing 1 sow. Afterwards, she was able to keep up her business by securing a loan to purchase pig feed. In 6 months, with just enough food, her sow gave birth to 10 piglets which she was able to sell for 2,000,000 Rupiah (200,000 Rupiah/piglet). Her profit from this loan was very large (600,000 Rupiah) within just 6 months. For her next 6-month loan, she plans to purchase 2 piglets for fattening and pig feed. Putu Yasi is very happy with how her business is growing and is very hopeful that her future profits will be big enough that she can help purchase more farming land and improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Di tengah himpitan ekonomi Putu Yasi memiliki tanggung jawab yang sangat berat untuk menyekolahkan 3 orang anaknya di bangku sekolah disamping juga harus memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-harinya. Apalagi suaminya hanyalah seorang petani yang ladangnya pun tidak begitu luas sehingga penghasilannya pun tidak banyak. Maka Putu Yasi memutuskan untuk beternak babi dengan membeli 1 ekor penginduk babi pada awalnya. Putu Yasi akhirnya mengambil jalan untuk meminjam modal tambahan ke DINARI yang digunakannya untuk membeli pakan babi. Sehingga dengan pakan memadai dan pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan, induk babi tersebut mampu melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi yang kemudian dijual dengan harga Rp. 2.000.000,- ( @ Rp. 200.000,- ). Keuntungan yang didapat lumayan besar yaitu Rp. 600.000,- selama 6 bulan. Pinjaman selanjutnya 6 bulan ke depan dari DINARI rencananya digunakan untuk membeli bibit penggemukan 2 ekor serta membeli pakan babi. Putu Yasi sangat senang dengan perkembangan usahanya dan sangat berharap ke depannya akan memperoleh keuntungan yang lebih besar sehingga perlahan-lahan akan meningkatkan ekonomi keluarganya.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en:
Saifullo R. is 44 years old. He is married, and he has seven children. Saifullo and his wife are raising their children with love and they are doing the best they can in order to ensure that their children have the brightest future possible and receive a good education.

Saifullo is a farmer. His wife and elder son help him with the business. He grows crops such as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Having worked the land for twenty years, Saifullo has gained a great deal of experience in this line of business. Each year he grows a yield of crops that is sufficient for his family's consumption, and the rest of the crops are sold for a profit. The business is the main source of income for his family, yet generating a stable income requires considerable funding.

Thus, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 over a 10-month term so that he can purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for planting purposes. By using the loan proceeds as such, he hopes to generate more income in order to be able to pay for his children's school fees. Saifullo and his wife are counting on your help, so he thanks everyone for their support and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To improve and expand farming operations by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kolih

texts.id:
Wayan Kolih has been raising pigs for quite some time, however she is still using traditional methods for feeding and keeping her pigs. She has already raised two sows. To increase the quality of her pigs she received a loan which she used to purchase better quality pig feed that made her sows healthier and able to produce more piglets. After four months, her two sows produced 10 piglets. She was able to sell them for as much as 1,500,000 Rupiah. With this next loan she would like to purchase two piglets for fattening and pig feed. With the increase in her pig population she hopes to have even higher profits than before. She plans to sell more pigs to help her family, especially to pay for her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha ternak babi sudah lama ditekuni oleh Wayan Kolih, namun pemeliharaannya masih sangat sederhana dan tradisional baik dari makanan yang diberikan maupun kandang yang digunakannya. Wayan Kolih sudah memelihara 2 ekor induk babi sebelumnya. Untuk menambah kualitas babi yang diperoleh, Wayan Kolih meminjam modal ke DINARI untuk digunakan membeli pakan yang lebih bermutu sehingga anak-anak babi yang dihasilkan kedua induk babi tersebut kondisinya baik dan sehat. Setelah 4 bulan 2 induk babi tersebut menghasilkan 10 ekor anak babi dan setelah dijual Wayan Kolih memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Pinjaman DINARI berikutnya akan digunakan untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit penggemukan serta membeli pakan babi. Sehingga dengan pertambahan populasi babi miliknya akan menghasilkan keuntungan yang melebihi sebelumnya. Keuntungan penjualan babi tersebut nantinya sangat berguna bagi keluarga Wayan Kolih terutama untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Warni

texts.id:
Daily life of Ketut Warni is just getting by. Her husband income as a farmer is felt as not enough to pay for daily expenses. Plus they still have to pay for the child schooling. In that circumstance, Ketut Warni is in the pig farming business that she has run for almost 4 years. Ketut Warni owns 2 mother pigs, and with DINARI's help that was used to buy feed, the mother pigs condition is very well, and after 4 months, both produced 15 piglets, that was sold by Ketut Warni for Rp 200,000/piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00). Profit obtained by Ketut Warni after deducting feed expenses is about Rp 1,500,000. Ketut Warni continues her loan from DINARI, since it is felt to be very helpful to her pig farming business. The next loan would be used to buy 2 fattening piglets, and of course its feed. Profit obtained by Ketut Warni is very important for family economy, so that for the next loan the profit would increase compared to before.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kehidupan sehari-hari Ketut Warni sangatlah pas-pasan. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani dirasa tidaklah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Ditambah lagi harus membiayai sekolah anaknya. Dengan keadaan seperti itu Ketut Warni akhirnya menekuni ternak babi dan sudah dijalaninya selama hampir 4 tahun. Ketut Warni memiliki 2 ekor induk babi kemudian dengan bantuan dari DINARI yang digunakan untuk membeli pakannya perkembangan induk-induk babinya sangat bagus kemudian setelah 4 bulan keduanya menghasilkan 15 ekor anak babi dan dijual oleh Ketut Warni Rp. 200.000,- per ekornya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Ketut Warni setelah dipotong biaya pakan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Ketut Warni melanjutkan pinjamannya ke DINARI karena dirasakan sangat membantu dalam usaha ternak babinya. Pinjaman berikutnya akan digunakan untuk membeli 2 bibit penggemukan serta membeli pakan tentunya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Ketut Warni sangat penting pengaruhnya dalam ekonomi keluarganya sehingga untuk pinjaman kedepan ini diharapkan keuntungannya akan berlipat dari sebelumnya

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo R. is 29 years old. He is married with four children. Ziyodullo is a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Ziyodullo is a farmer, and he has been in this business for four years. He grows agricultural crops such as tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, potatoes, and wheat. His brothers help him with the business. Each year Ziyodullo grows a sufficient amount of crops for his family's consumption and to sell the rest of his yield for a profit. By generating a stable income, Ziyodullo is able to support his large family; however, sometimes his income is not enough to provide for the most elemental needs of the family because he supports not only his wife and children but also his brother and sister.

So, he wants to increase productivity on his plot, which requires an infusion of capital in order to produce a larger crop yield. Specifically, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 over a 10-month term, and the loan proceeds will be used to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the loan, Ziyodullo believes he will be able to improve the family's home and standard of living in a short period of time. He thanks you for your support because your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ni Komang Wati

texts.id:
Simple and traditional way of raining pigs is considered as not giving maximal results by Komang Wati. However from raising pigs, Komang Wati hopes to give good results to assist in family's economy. Komang Wati raised 1 mother pig. Then Komang Wati decided to borrow capital from DINARI that was used to buy 1 mother pig and another for fattening. From those 2 mothers, 12 piglets were produced that was sold at Rp175,000'piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00) plus sales of fattened pig for a total nett profit of Rp 1,500,000 for 6 months. Komang Wati continues to the next loan from DINARI since it is considered as very helpful to expand the business. The next loan would be used to buy feed and 2 fattening piglets, so that it would increase obtained profit in the upcoming 6 months. This result would decide the economical road of Komang Wati's family that also has to provide child schooling.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pemeliharaan yang sederhana dan tradisional pada ternak babinya dirasakan tidak menghasilkan hasil yang maksimal oleh Komang Wati. Padahal dari memelihara babi Komang Wati mengharapkan hasil yang baik untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarga. Komang Wati memelihara 1 ekor babi penginduk. Kemudian Komang Wati mengambil keputusan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI yang digunakannya untuk menambah populasi babinya dengan membeli 1 ekor penginduk lagi serta 1 ekor bibit penggemukan. Dari kedua penginduk tersebut menghasilkan 12 ekor anak babi yang dijual @ Rp. 175.000,- ditambah penjualan babi penggemukannya didapatkan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Komang Wati meneruskan pinjaman selanjutnya ke DINARI karena dianggap sangat menolongnya mengembangkan usaha. Pinjaman berikutnya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan serta 2 ekor bibit penggemukan sehingga akan menambah keuntungan yang diperoleh pada 6 bulan berikutnya. Hasil ini menentukan jalannya perekonomian keluarga Komang Wati yang juga harus menyekolahkan anaknya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Made Ekarini

texts.id:
Ni Made Ekarini is considered a young woman, but her persistence in work is considred as high. Since her husband's income as building laborer is just enough to pay for family and child expenses, Made Ekarini tried to raise pigs. With an initial loan from DINARI, Made Ekarini could buy 3 piglets that was raised for 3 months, then sold for Rp1,900,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), wit a nett profit of Rp 400,000. From that satisfactory result, Made Ekarini plans for the next loan from DINARI, that would be used to buy more piglets and feed. So that profit from this expanded pig business could be sufficient to pay for family needs, and also to add capital to a food stall that she would expand in her home as a side business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Ekarini tergolong ibu rumah tangga yang masih muda, tetapi keuletannya dalam bekerja patut diakui sangatlah besar. Karena penghasilan suaminya yang pas-pasan sebagai buruh bangunan, untuk menghidupi keluarga dan anaknya Made Ekarini berusaha memelihara babi. Dengan meminjam ke DINARI Made Ekarini bisa membeli 3 bibit babi yang dipelihara selama 3 bulan kemudian dijualnya seharga Rp. 1.900.000,- dengan keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Melihat hasil yang memuaskan ini, Made Ekarini melanjutkan dengan pinjaman berikutnya ke DINARI yang akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi lebih banyak lagi serta membeli pakannya. Sehingga keuntungan dari usaha babi yang dikembangkannya bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya disamping itu juga bisa menambah modal warung yang dikembangkannya juga di rumahnya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakannya)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Ratih

texts.id:
Although Wayan Ratih is elderly, but she still has the stamina to be in pig farming business. This is because her husband's income is not enough to pay for daily expenses, although all of Wayan Ratih's children are already married. To expand her pig farming business, Wayan Ratih borrowed capital from Dinari to buy pig feedsock to increase her pig population, and the rest to buy pig feed. After raising 4 pigs for 4 months, Wayan Ratih sold it for Rp 2,300,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), and profit obtaines about Rp 500,000 for 3 pigs. From this profit, Wayan Ratih decide to continue for the next loan from DINARI so that her capital increased to buy pig feedstock. Wayan Ratih plans to buy 4 piglets for fattening to be raised for the next 4 months. She hopes that would bring more profit from the next sales, so that it would increase family's economy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Meskipun Wayan Ratih sudah berusia lanjut tetapi masih sangat bersemangat dalam menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dikarenakan penghasilan suaminya tidaklah banyak untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari meskipun anak-anak Wayan Ratih semuanya sudah menikah. Untuk mengembangkan usahanya beternak babi, Wayan Ratih meminjam modal ke DINARI supaya bisa membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi babi yang telah dimilikinya serta sisanya akan dibelikan pakan babi. Setelah memelihara 3 ekor babi selama 4 bulan, Wayan Ratih menjualnya seharga Rp. 2.300.000,- dan keuntungan yang diperolehnya sebesar Rp. 500.000,- untuk 3 ekor babi. Dari keuntungan ini Wayan Ratih memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman berikutnya ke DINARI sehingga modalnya akan bertambah lagi untuk membeli bibit babi. Wayan Ratih merencanakan akan membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan lagi untuk dipelihara selama 4 bulan ke depan. Dan diharapkan akan mendatangkan lebih banyak keuntungan dari hasil penjualan berikutnya sehingga akan mengangkat perekonomian keluarganya

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ayubkhon

texts.en:
Ayubkhon S. is 42 years old. He is married with four children. Ayubkhon runs a farm, and he has worked in agriculture for fifteen years. Over that time, he has gained a great deal of experience and a love for the land. His elder son and wife help him with the business. More specifically, Ayubkhon has a large garden, where he grows vegetables and fruits, depending on the season. The business is stable and generates the main source of income for his family. However, this business requires a lot of effort and inputs.

As his dearest children grow up, the expenses required to support them rises accordingly, so he wants to ensure that his business remains stable and continues to generate enough income to support his family in the future. Now, it is prime growing season, and Ayubkhon wants to grow wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Thus, Ayubkhon needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $875 over a term of 12 months. Ayubkhon thanks all for supporting him, and he promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: To capitalize on the growing season by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.en:
Ruziboy S. is 62 years old. He is married with six children, only two of whom are still under his care. The rest of his children are married and have their own families and children who adore their grandparents. Ruziboy loves his children and grandchildren very much, and he does his very best in order to make them happy and to provide them with a good education.

More specifically, Ruziboy runs a farm, and he has twenty years of experience in the business. He has been able to support his family by learning how to manage his crops in the short growing season. To illustrate, he grows crops such as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Each year his yield is sufficient to meet his family's consumption needs and to sell crops for a profit. The business is the main source of his family's income, yet generating a stable income requires considerable funding.

Thus, now Ruziboy would like to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for planting, so he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 over a 6-month term. With the loan proceeds, Ruziboy would buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production so that he can increase the quality of his yield and his earnings in turn. After making a good profit from his business, he is planning to send his younger son to the University because he recently finished school. With your help, this will be possible, so he thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To increase and improve his crop yield by purchasing additional seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
Tuhfa T. is 43 years old. She is married, and she is the loving mother of three children. She and her husband run the family business, sewing and producing tarpaulin boots. Both work at home, accepting orders and performing the necessary tasks to satisfy their customers' requests. Having worked in this industry for twenty years, they have gained a great deal of experience and have developed a large client base. The family business is quite successful and generates stable income, thereby improving the family's living conditions.

One of Tuhfa’s dreams is to provide her children with a great education to enable them to better their quality of life, so she works extremely hard in order to hopefully send them to the University in the future. In particular, her elder son is finishing school next year, and she wants to send him to the University in the capital of Dushanbe. Therefore, Tuhfa is requesting $500 over a term of 12 months. With the loan proceeds, she will purchase equipment and additional input materials to sew tarpaulin boots. This is the first loan requested by Tuhfa, but she promises to repay it in a timely manner. Please get behind this dedicated mother to help her make her dreams become a reality.

loans.use: To expand and improve the family business by purchasing equipment and additional raw materials in order to sew tarpaulin boots

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam M. is a 33-year-old business owner who has a general store where he sells sugar, flour, pasta, hair color and etc. He started his business in 1999. He lives with his family in the small village of Imishli. Sometimes he has more inventory than his store can handle. To solve this problem he is requesting a loan to expand his store space and make repairs.

loans.use: To expand store space and make building repairs

loans.name: Abuzer

texts.en:
Abuzer S. is a 42-year-old man who owns a car repair studio. He is the engineer and has repaired cars since 1985. He lives in Imishli and his service studio is located nearaa local bazaar and its always full with clients.

He spends all day in his service garage repairing cars and has decided to apply for a loan to repair his garage and improve his working conditions.

loans.use: To repair a garage and improve working conditions

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam H. lives in the Istaravshan town of the Sugd region. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He has a secondary education and an animal husbandry business. Specifically, he has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. In practice, he buys calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and later re-sells them at the same market for a profit. As such, he provides the market's customers (as well as his family) with meat.

He is now seeking to buy more calves and thus needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan in the amount of $400 over a 10-month term. With the loan proceeds, he hopes to expand his business and to thereby generate additional income in order provide his children with a good education and to improve their standard of living. Indeed, this loan would help him to accomplish his goals in a short time, so your generosity is much appreciated in that it can change his life.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional calves

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir B. is a 47-year-old salesperson who owns a grocery store in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has three children. He is requesting a loan to diversify and expand the number of products he sells in the store.

loans.use: To diversify and expand the number of grocery products for resale

loans.name: Feyzulla

texts.en:
Feyzulla E. is a 59-year-old farmer who has owned his livestock business since 2001. He lives and works with his family in the Internally Displaced Settlement of Imishli. He also works as a teacher in a local school but his salary is to small to cover basic family needs. His main financial source is selling milk to the local milk factory.

Feyzulla would like to expand his business and start selling more milk and increase his profit. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan to purchase two more dairy cows. Feyzulla has already successfully paid back one previous loan.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: Raisa E. is a 52-year-old woman who has owned her grocery store in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Imishli since 1998. This store is the only source of income for her family. She is director and sales manager at the same time. Her income is just enough to cover family needs but not enough to expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase the number of grocery products in her store.

loans.use: To increase inventories of grocery products

loans.name: Makhmud

texts.en: Makhmud M. is a 68-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Imishli. He has more than 15 years of experience in this field. Makhmud is married and has 12 children! They all help him with the sheep herd. He also keeps two dairy cows and sells milk and yogurt to the local milk factory. This is main financial source of income for his family but to cover all of the family expenses is very hard. He has applied for a loan to build a shed to keep livestock and sheep in humane conditions.

loans.use: To build a shed to keep livestock and sheep in humane conditions

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris I. is a 58-year-old man who sells automobile parts in the small village of Imishli. He started his business in 1987. He is married and has five children.

This is the only source of income for his family it is very hard to cover family expenses and expand the current business. Idris is requesting a loan to improve conditions of his store.

loans.use: To improve conditions of an automobile parts store

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. joined the TYM Fund since 1994. Before becoming a member of the Fund, her family worked on the rice field and raised the pigs. Then, she borrowed 20 USD to buy a pig. When she was done repaying for the first time, she had 2 farrows of pigs, profited 80 USD. Later, she continued to borrow money from the Fund to raise animals like pigs, chickens and ducks. The raising activity brought her lots of profit. As a result, her family economy became stable. She was able to furnish her house. She has 3 children, who are all grown up, working and having stable incomes. They send money for them every month. This time, she wants to borrow 1025 USD to expand her raising area. Her family average income is 400 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Trước khi tham gia Quỹ, gia đình chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn, mong muốn mua được 1 con lợn nái để gây giống . Năm 1994 chị Đinh Thị B. tham gia Quỹ, mức vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 300.000 đồng mua 1 con lợn nái sau khi vòng vốn hoàn thành cũng là lúc gia đình chị thu 2 lứa lợn bột lãi 1.000.000 đ, các năm tiếp theo chị tiếp tục vay vốn từ Quỹ chủ yếu phục vụ chăn nuôi như lợn, gà, vịt và đều cho lãi cao vì thế thu nhập của gia đình ngày càng ổn định hơn. Gia đình đã xây thêm được công trình phụ, mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị trong gia đình, chị có 3 người con hiện các con chị đều đã đi làm và có thu nhâp đều đặn. Hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ thêm cho bố mẹ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 17.000.000đ, tiếp tục mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn, gà, vịt. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 6.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: expand raising project

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
I. Jamil is a 53-year-old salesperson who sells door and window frames made of wood and cement. All of these materials are very popular for building new houses. Jamil lives in the small village of Saatli with his wife and three children.

He has permanent clients and his goods sell very quickly because of high demand. There are special conditions requiring that cement and wood be kept in dry and dark conditions. He is requesting a loan to make repairs and meet these conditions for his products, .

loans.use: To make repairs and improve the conditions of the building materials business

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 51 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, she had lots of difficulties in life because she had too many children but did not earn enough money. In 1995, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed 20 USD at first. She used this money to raise the pigs and chickens. From 1995 to 2000, she continued to use the borrowed money on raising pigs, chickens and fish, earning 800 USD/ year. In 2001, seeing that local people and those living nearby enjoyed decorative plants, she switched to this activity. She bought the pots, the seeds and planted them. She distributed her plants to the hotels, and retailed. She also did not stop raising animals. Because the business went well, her family economy improved. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are grown-up and living separately, and the other two are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to invest more in the decorative plants business. Her average income is 400 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ hoàn cảnh gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn, kinh tế eo hẹp do đông con lại trong độ tuổi đi học, thiếu vốn làm ăn. Năm 1995 chị T. tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn vòng một 300.000đ. Với mức vốn này chị đã sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn gà.Từ năm 1995 đến năm 2000 chị vay vốn của quỹ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà và thả cá T. nhập bình quân mỗi năm được 12.000.000đ. Năm 2001, nhận thấy người dân tại địa phương và các vùng lân cận có nhu cầu chơi cây cảnh cao gia đình chị đã chuyển sang kinh doanh cây cảnh, mua chậu, cây cảnh về chăm sóc và cung cấp cho các khách sạn và bán lẻ tại nhà, đồng thời gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục chăn nuôi lợn ,gà, thả cá. Từ việc vay vốn đầu tư vào các dự án có hiệu quả đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá lên rất nhiều, chị có 5 con hiên nay 3 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng chị và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh cây cảnh. T. nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in decorative plants business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Ngoc M., joined the TYM Fund since 2000. At that time, her family’s main activity is to run a small studio on ID and wedding pictures. At first, she borrowed 40 USD to buy a more modern camera. Later, she used the borrowed to send her husband to a photography class. She now expands her studio and they also do typing documents for customers. She has to hire one helper to assist her with the studio’s work with a wage of 80 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to upgrade her studio. Her family average income is 625 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Ngọc M. 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2000, lúc đó gia đình chị làm nghề chụp ảnh thẻ và đám cưới. Khi tham gia Quỹ vòng vốn đầu chị vay 500.000đ để mua một chiếc máy ảnh với nhiều tính năng hơn. Các vòng vốn sau chị đầu tư cho anh đi học nâng cao tay nghề chụp ảnh và quay phim và làm ảnh kỹ thuật số. Cho đến nay gia đình chị đã có 1 cửa hàng khá khang trang với các dich vụ như quay phim, chụp ảnh kỹ thuật số, photo coppy và đánh máy vi tính, với số lượng công việc nhiều gia đình anh chị phải thuê 1 người phụ giúp với mức lương 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng. Thu nhập bình quân. 10.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: upgrade photography studio

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi B., after married to her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Thuy, has been living separately. At first, they did not have starting money for either any business or to raise animals. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she borrowed 125 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Since her business went well, she was able to borrow more money to start breeding even ducks and chickens. Her family economy improved and she was able to have a 2-storey house. Currently, she uses the profit from raising the animals to repay weekly. Her family is an examplary one in the Minh Phu town. She has 3 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD. Her family average income is 400 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Khi xây dựng gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Bình cùng anh Nguyễn Văn Thủy được gia đình cho ra ở riêng, ban đầu kinh tế còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, không có vốn làm ăn cũng như chăn nuôi. Năm 2003 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ, vòng vốn ban đầu chị xin vay 2.000.000 đồng đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, bước đầu cho thu nhập. Nhờ chăn nuôi phát triển, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn cao nhất để mở rộng chăn nuôi như lợn, gà, vịt đẻ trứng nên kinh tế đã phát triển mạnh, gia đình chị hiện đã xây được nhà 2 tầng khang trang và con cái đi học đầy đủ. Hiện tại chị vẫn đang mở rộng chăn nuôi, việc hoàn trả tiền tuần được lấy từ chăn nuôi. Gia đình chị là một điển hình về chăn nuôi của xã Minh Phú, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 6.000.000đ / tháng

loans.use: Buy food for raising animals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 32 years old, had a shop for repairing motorbikes. Yet, at that time, she did not have enough funding. As a result, her business did not go very well. In 2002, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she borrowed 40 USD to invest in her repairing shop. After 8 years of membership, she now owns a large motorbike-repairing shop with lots of customers. Her husband is very experienced and dedicated to working at the shop. She also has to pay 100 USD/month for 2 workers to help with the shop. Her 2 children are going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1025 USD to buy motorbike accessories. Her average income is 425 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D. 32 tuổi, khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị có cửa hàng sửa chữa xe máy, do thiếu vốn nên việc kinh doanh của gia đình chưa đạt nhiều hiệu quả. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng xe máy. Sau 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn đến nay gia đình chị đã có cửa hiệu xe máy với quy mô lớn và tạo dựng được uy tín trong vùng, chồng chị là người có nhiều kinh nghiệm và có tinh thần phục vụ khách hàng tốt nên cửa hàng nhà chị rất đông khách vì vậy gia đình chị đã phải thuê 2 công nhân tay nghề giỏi với mức lương 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 17.000.000đ mua phụ tùng xe máy. Thu nhâp bình quân.7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy motorbike accessories

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 40 years old, joined TYM since 1995.  Her family original occupation is husking rice.  Therefore, in her first loan, she borrowed 500 thousands VND to buy pigs for breeding as she can used the bran from rice-husking as foodstuff for the pigs.  In 1999, her family became a small retailer, selling bran, corn and rice as foodstuff for breeding cattle.  Since her first loan, the total amount of money she borrowed from TYM had totaled up to about 90 million VND.  With this suitable occupation, her family had been able to buy car and trucks and open up a transportation services in the area.  As her 4 children are still going to school, the one who helped her the most had been her hard-working husband.  This cycle, she would like to borrow 19 million VND to buy more foodstuffs.  Income from her two business is around 8 million VND monthly

 Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đông 40 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị làm nghề xay sát gạo. Năm 1995 chị vào Quỹ và vay vốn vòng 1 số tiền 500.000 đồng mua lợn về chăn nuôi để tận dụng cám, gạo trong xay sát. Từ năm 1999 gia đinh chuyển sang làm đại lý cám, ngô, gạo là thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi, từ khi tham gia Quỹ tổng số vốn gia đình chị vay từ quỹ là 90.000.000đ. Với việc làm kinh tế phù hợp đến nay gia đình chị đã mua được ô tô, xe lam để kinh doanh vận tải, chị có 4 con hiện nay các con chị vẫn đang đi học, chồng chị là người chịu khó, biết chia sẻ công việc và luôn sát cánh cùng chị trong việc kinh doanh. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000 đầu tư vào kinh doanh cám, ngô thức ăn chăn nuôi.
  Thu nhập từ kinh doanh cám, ngô và dịch vụ vận tải khoảng 8.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: Business  animal food

loans.name: Isrfail

texts.en: Isrfail D. is a 50-year-old man who sells paint and other products for home improvements. He started his business in 1990 in his home region of Saatli. He is married and has three daughters and one son. He has applied for a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand a paint and home improvement store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 37 years old, joined TYM since 2002 with her first loan cycle being used to open a refreshment store. When the industrial area around Hanoi international Airport developed, the demand for refreshment from surrounding area and business increased dramatically. In 2006, she switch to a small retail store to meet the rising demand of construction workers living nearby as well as the neighborhood. Her family income is roughly 200 thousands VND daily. With the income from her business, her husband and she has been able to build a new house, in which two of her three children are also living. This cycle, she would like to borrow 19 million VND to invest more into her small retail store. Her family income is around 6 million VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002 vòng vốn đầu chị vay về mở cửa hàng giải khát. Từ khi khu công nghiệp nội bài phát triển mạnh, công nhân làm tại khu công nghiệp tập trung nhiều tại địa bàn thôn chị từ đó nhu cầu tiêu dùng ngày càng tăng cao. Năm 2006 chị chuyển sang kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa đáp ứng nhu cầu sinh hoạt tiêu dùng của người dân địa phương cũng như số đông công nhân đang thuê trọ trên địa bàn thôn chị, thu nhập từ kinh doanh bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày, chị có 3 con, 1 đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 2 đang sống cùng vợ chồng anh chị. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in variety store

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir Q. is a 34-year-old salesperson who sells washing machines, refrigerators and kitchen appliances. He has been in this field since 1992. This store is owned by his brother and Zakir works as the sales manager.

Zakir has decided to open his own store in another village named Imishli. The first step he needs to take is to make repairs in the new building and then he will be able to open the store and sell the same products. For this purpose he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To make repairs in a building to house a kitchen appliance store

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar A. is a 27-year-old man who owns a car washing station in a the small village of Sabirabad. He started his business in 1998. His service station is located on the road connecting the Sabirabad region and the capital of Azerbaijan Baku. Many cars pass by his busniess each day and Vugar has gained a reputation for being a very polite man.

As his business grows, he needs more funds to improve the conditions of his washing station. Vugar would like to build a garage where he could wash cars during the hot summer months and in the cold winters. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To build a garage for washing cars

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 51 years old has been a very active member of TYM since 1998. In 2000, she borrow money to invest in raising chickens and achieve some success. After that, she keep on taking out loans to invest in the business and her family is having around 400 chicken right now. Always look out for a better ways to improve her business, she has been able to achieve success after success. Both of her children are in school right now. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 19 millions VND to invest into her business. Her family income is 6 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình Thương 1998 từ khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị luôn vay vốn phát triển kinh tế và là thành viên tích cực của cụm. Năm 2000 chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi gà đẻ, thấy việc chăn nuôi gà có lãi nên các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà và sửa sang chuồng trại nuôi thêm gà thịt, hiện tại gia đình chị đang có 400 con gà thịt, với mô hình chăn nuôi lớn kết hợp với sự cố gắng học tập kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi, nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị luôn cho thu nhập cao kinh tế phát triển, chị có 2 con hiện tại các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising chicken

loans.name: Arastun

texts.en:
Arastun A. is a 47-year-old man who owns his café in the small village of Saatli. The peak period at his cafe is during lunch and in the evenings when tired people come here to drink tea and relax after a long work day. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field as his father was running the business and Arastun then took over the business.

It is the only source of income for his family, Arastun has decided to expand his business. His café needs repairs and additional chairs and tables. To do this work and purchase these inventories, he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables and make repairs in a cafe

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en: Khayal A. is a 29-year-old man who owns his own hardware store. He started his business in 2000 and since that time it is the only financial source for his family. With a loan, he would like to increase his inventory of items and make repairs in his shop to attract more clients.

loans.use: To increase inventory of items and make repairs of his shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., 48 years old, joined TYM since 1998. All of her loans have been used to buy clothes and dressmaking materials. Her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Dung, 52 years old, make the clothes and she goes out to sell them every morning. Hard working together with over 30 years of experience helped make their business very successfull. One of her children have already graduated college and is working while the second one is still in college. This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 19 million VND to buy more dressmaking materials. Her family income is 6 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M. 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1998, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán quần áo, may mặc. Chị chuyên đi chợ bán quần áo, còn anh Nguyễn Văn Dũng 52 tuổi chồng chị làm nghề cắt may, với gần 30 năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề cắt may nên cửa hàng may nhà anh luôn đông khách, kinh tế gia đình phát triển nên anh chị có điều kiện nuôi con ăn học, hiện nay 1 con chị đã tốt nghiệp cao đẳng điện lực và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, 1 con đang học năm thứ 2 cao đẳng kinh tế. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vốn mua thêm quần áo, vải. Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy Dressmaking material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tarlan

texts.en:
Tarlan I. is a 39-year-old man who has been selling vegetables and fruits in the small village of Saatli since 2000. He is married and has two sons. He also works as a teacher and after school is over, he comes to his vegetable and fruit stand. Most of his time is spent at his stand because it is the main source of income for his family.

He is very tired of working on the street and has decided to build a store and improve his working conditions. During the summer it becomes so hot that it is impossible to work outside. For this reason, Tarlan has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To build a store and improve the business and working conditions

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en:
Khanim I. is a 40-year-old woman who sells fruits and vegetables on the streets in the village of Saatli. She started her business in 2002 and it is her main source of income. She also works as a teacher in the local school, but her salary is too small to cover basic family needs.

She would like to expand her business and increase the number of food products she can sell. For this purpose she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase the number of food products for resale

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar M. is a 33-year-old man who sells milk in the small village of Saatli. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has two sons.

He sells milk to the milk factory where he also works as a security guard. Working as a security guard pays him the same amount of income as selling milk. His twelve hour work day is becoming a bit tiring. Bakhtiyar would like to focus on expanding his livestock business and purchase two cows with his loan. The estimated cost for one cow is $600.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for milk production and sales to the local factory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Joining TYM since 1994, Mrs Nguyen Thi N. is one of the earliest member with 15 years tenure. With a good location (her house is right next to the main street), her small business has been going well. In her first loan, with 300 thousands VND, she open up a small store to sell dry food and ingridients. Later, in 1997, she switched to buying manure and resell it to factories nearby. From this business, she had been able to build up a two stories buildings and afford to pay for her two children education. This cycle, her family would like to borrow 19 million VND to continue investing in buying manure. Her family's monthly income is 6 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1994, đến nay chị Nguyễn Thị N. 40 tuổi đã tròn 15 năm tham gia vào Quỹ, với thuận lợi gia đình chị ngay mặt đường nên rất thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh. Từ vòng vốn vay ban đầu là 300.000đ chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng khô, các vòng vốn tiếp chị cũng đều đầu tư vào buôn bán, kinh tế gia đinh chị ngày một phát triển. Năm 1997 gia đình chị đã chuyển hướng kinh doanh sang buôn bán phân bón phục vụ nhu cầu nông nghiệp. Từ việc kinh doanh phát triển năm 2001 gia đình chị đã xây được 1 ngôi nhà 2 tầng khang trang, chị có 2 con, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh phân bón. Thu nhâp bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in Manure business

loans.name: Dildar

texts.en:
Dildar A. is a 48-year-old woman who sells milk and yogurt in the small village of Saatli. She has had this business since 1987. Dildar is married and has three children.

She and her husband are unemployed and selling milk and yogurt is the only source of income for their family. She is applying for a loan to purchase one dairy cow for $600 and purchase fodder with the balance of the loan amount.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Ms. Nguyen Thi T. didn't have much fund. Thus, her family's life is very difficult. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund. Her first loan of 35USD was used to buy coal for her brick factory. Making brick was very difficult, yet it didn't bring back much profit. Thus, in 2001, Ms. T. switched to breed chickens and hens. At the moment, her farm has about 500 hens. Each day there are about 300 eggs, which is sold for 28USD. After deducting all other expenses, Ms. T.'s daily income is about 10 USD. Ms. T. has 3 children who are still going to school. This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her farm. Her monthly income is 375 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ, do không có vốn làm ăn nên kinh tế gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Thơm còn rất eo hẹp. Năm 1997 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ để được vay vốn, vòng 1 chị vay 500.000 đồng mua than đốt lò gạch. Việc sản xuất gạch vất vả mà hiệu quả không cao nên năm 2001 chị chuyển sang chăn nuôi gà thịt, gà đẻ trứng. Hiện nay trang trại chăn nuôi gà của gia đình chị có khoảng 500 con gà đẻ trứng bình quân mỗi ngày thu hoạch 300 quả trứng với giá trứng hiện tại thì thu nhập hàng ngày là 450.000đ, trừ chi phí mỗi ngày gia đình cũng lãi được 150.000 đồng. Chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising chicken

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 34 years old, has joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2000. Her first loan of 500 000 VND (approximately 31 USD) was used to breed pigs and chickens. She continued to use her next loans to breed animals in large volumes. Her income from this farm also increases over time. When the areas around Noibai Airport develop, the population of her village increases, since there are more workers. Ms. T. discussed with her family and invested in a store to sell clean vegetables and fruit. Her store is doing very well because it meets the demands of her villagers. Ms. T. has two chldren, both are at school age. She wants to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her business. Her monthly income is 5,000,000 VND (around 312.5 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thúy 34 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2000, vồng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay mức vốn cao tiếp tục đầu tư chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng tăng lên. Từ khi khu công nghiệp nội bài phát triển mạnh, công nhân tập trung nhiều về địa phương nên chị cùng gia đình bàn bạc đầu tư bán mặt hàng rau sạch và hàng nông sản, phù hợp với nhu cầu thực tế tại địa phương nên việc buôn bán của gia đình chị rất phát triển thu nhâp cao, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H. is 36 years old. She has three children, all of them are at school age. Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), she didn't have much funds to do business. Thus, she was just a small retailer in her village's market. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow money and expand her business. Everyday, her husband buyes vegetable and other kinds of food, so that Mrs. H. can sell them to the villagers. Her customers include not just villagers but also other workers from the industrial area of Noibai, who have come and rent houses around this area. In 2004, Mrs. H. saw a new demand. She opened a breakfast restaurant, while still selling fruit. Her business has grown since. She is now able to buy other furniture in the house and provide her children with a good education. This time Mrs. H. would like to borrow 19,000,000 VND (approximately 1150 USD) to buy more fruit and food, in order to provide better service to her customers. On average, her family income is 6,000,000 VND (i.e., 375 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hưng năm nay 36 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vì chưa có nhiều vốn nên chị chỉ buôn bán lặt vặt nhỏ lẻ tại chợ thôn. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào kinh doanh tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi mua rau và các loại thực phẩm khác từ đại lý về để chị bán lẻ cho người dân tại địa phương. Ngoài những người dân địa phương chị còn có thêm nguồn khách hàng rất lớn là những người công nhân của khu công nghiệp Nội Bài đến thuê nhà trọ tại khu vực gia đình chị sinh sống. Năm 2004, do nắm bắt được nhu cầu của người dân địa phương gia đình chị chuyển sang bán hàng ăn sáng và buôn bán hoa quả, thu nhập ngày càng khá hơn nên chị đã có điều kiện mua sắm thêm trang thiết bị trong gia đình và đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn mua thực phẩm và hoa quả để phục vụ tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng của gia đình chị là 6.000.000 đồng

loans.use: Buy food and fruits

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L. is 40 years old. She is now living with her husband and their two children, both are still at school age. Mrs. L.'s family are living at Soc Son province, Hanoi, where the Noibai industrial areas have been developing with a very fast rate. Thus, the demand for consumption is very high and various. Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Mrs. L.'s family had owned a small retail store. However, their income was still low because they didn't have much fund to begin with. In 2002, Mrs. L. applied to join TYM, borrowed money and expanded her business (clothing store). With her experience and cleverness, Mrs. L.'s family becomes better off. In 2006, L. and her husband switched to sell old and new motorbikes. Each motorbike sold gives them a profit of 500,000 to 1,000,000VND (approximately 31-62USD). Currently, their store often has about 15 motorbikes. She wants to borrow 19,000,000 VND (approximately 1150 USD) to invest in her business. Mrs. L.'s family income is about 8,000,000 VND (i.e., 500 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị L. 40 tuổi. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Gia đình chị hiện sống tại huyện Sóc Sơn - Hà Nội nơi có khu công nghiệp Nội Bài đang rất phát triển vì vậy nhu cầu về tiêu dùng cũng rất cao và đa dạng . Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ vợ chồng chị L. đã mở cửa hàng buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, song thu nhập chưa cao do vốn còn nhỏ. Năm 2002 chị xin tham gia Quỹ vay vốn mở rộng kinh doanh buôn bán quần áo. Với kinh nghiệm buôn bán đã được tích luỹ và sự năng động trong làm ăn, kinh tế của gia đình chị tăng trưởng rõ rệt. Năm 2006 anh chị chuyển sang kinh doanh xe máy mới, cũ. Cứ bán được mỗi xe anh chị lãi được khoảng 500.000-1.000.000 đ . Hiện nay cửa hàng của anh chị luôn luôn có 15 xe mới và cũ. Vòng vốn này gia đình anh chị tiếp tục xin vay 19.000.000 đầu tư vào việc kinh doanh. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng khoảng 8.000.000 đồng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Mrs. Truong Thi T., 49 years old, was farming or selling dry food such as bamboos and noodles at the market. In 2000, she joined TYM. With her first loan of 500,000 VND (32 USD), she bought more dry food to sell, and chickens to breed. In the following years, her family was raising poultry such as chickens, ducks, geese, and pigs, which has brought Mrs. T. more profit. In 2005, Mrs. T. started to buy pork and transport pigs to China by her own car, which is the begining of her food delivery business. Currently, Mrs. T.'s family focuses on food delivery to China. Mrs. T. has 3 children, one of which is still going to school. Her husband is the driver for her business. Besides, if some other companies have a need for driver, he also takes the opportunities. This time she wants to borrow 19,000,000 VND (approximately 1150 USD) to buy more pigs. Mrs. T.'s family income is about 8,000,000 VND (i.e., 500 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trương Thị Toàn 49 tuổi, trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị làm ruộng và buôn bán hàng khô như măng, miến. Năm 2000 chị tham gia quỹ, vay lần đầu 500.000đ mua thêm hàng khô và mua gà con để chăn nuôi, những năm tiếp theo gia đình chăn nuôi các loại gia cầm như gà, vịt, ngan và nuôi lợn cho thu nhập cao.
