Năm 2005 chị chuyển sang mua lợn hơi và mua ô tô mang lợn sang Trung Quốc, bắt đầu việc kinh doanh vận chuyển hàng thực phẩm tươi sống. Hiện tại gia đình chị tập trung cho việc kinh doanh vận chuyển thực phẩm tươi sống, cứ 3 ngày chị lại mang một chuyến hàng lợn hơi sang Trung Quốc, chị có 3 con, 1 đang đi học, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe chuyên chở hàng của gia đình ngoài ra ai có nhu cầu vận chuyển hàng anh cũng săn sàng làm vân chuyển thuê. Vòng vốn này gia đình anh chi xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 8.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy and sell pigs

loans.name: Gf Degoo Group

texts.fr:
Thiane, Anna and Mayron are three women who live in the outskirts of Mbour. To get out of poverty, they formed a group in order to develop their income-generating businesses. An initial loan of 250,000 CFA francs allowed them to start their businesses of selling various products (vegetables, fresh fish, dried and smoked fish and fruit juices).

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Thiane, Anna et Mayran sont trois femmes vivant dans la périphérie de Mbour. Pour sortir de la situation précaire dans laquelle elles vivent, elles se sont réunues en groupement afin de developper des activités génératrices. Un pret de 250.000 f CFA leur a permis de démarrer des activités de vente de divers produits (légumes, poissons frais, poissons sechés ou fumés, jus de fruits).

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Unemployed for a long time, the women in the Bok Jom group used their first UIMCEC loan of 250,000 CFA francs to start up a small business of selling various products, ranging from cosmetics to fish to fruits and vegetables. The success of their initial endeavor has led them to request another loan of 500,000 CFA francs to build up their business. They are all mothers who have experience in their respective fields. This second loan will allow them to build up working capital.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Longtemps au chomage, les femmes du groupe Bok Jom ont avec un premier pret de 250 000 f CFA obtenu de l'UIMCEC démarré une activité de petit commerce de divers prodiuts allant des prodiuts cosmétiques aux poissons en passant par les fruits et légumes. Le succes qu'a connu cette premiere opération leur a permis de solliciter un pret de 500.000 f CFA afin de renforcer leurs activités. Elles sont toutes meres de famille et ont une bonne experience dans le domaine d'activités respectives. Ce second credit leur permettra de renforcer leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa Mlidwa is a 37 year old resident of the Chanika neighborhood of Dar es Salaam. He makes a living selling spare parts for bicycles, a business he has been in for the past five years. Bicycles are a common means of transport in this part of Dar es Salaam, and he has applied for a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Khalis

texts.en:
Khalis A. is a 41-year-old business owner and has owned a food store in the Sattli region since 1990. He is married and has four children.

This store is the only income for his family. It is just enough to cover the family's needs. Khalis would like to expand his business but he needs additional funding. For this reason, he has applied for a loan to purchase a refrigerator, beverages and other food products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, beverages and other food products for resale

loans.name: Atabala

texts.en:
Atabala A. is a 53-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves in the small village of Saatli since 1992. He is married and has five children.

Calf breeding is the only financial source for his family. As summer is peak season for weddings, and meat is very popular for wedding parties, Atabala would like to take this opportunity to purchase four more calves for an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves for meat production

loans.name: Iskender

texts.en:
Iskender A. is a 49-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small southern village of Saatli. He started his business in 2007. Iskender is married and has four children.

Iskender also works as a tractor driver, but this job is available only during the harvest season. His main income is raising and selling sheep. He would like to purchase with his loan, 20 additional sheep for an estimated cost of $60 each .

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep for resale

loans.name: Abaset

texts.en:
Abaset A. is a 49-year-old man who breeds calves for meat production. He lives in the small southern village of Saatli with his wife and three sons. Abaset has six years of experience in this field. He also works as a teacher in a local school, but his salary is too small to support his family.

Abaset is focused on developing his calf breeding business as it is his main source of income. He has applied for this loan and plans to use the money to purchase four calves for an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Shakhoglan

texts.en:
Shakhoglan Q. is a 57-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local milk factory in the small village of Saatli. He has been in this business for more that 20 years. Shakhoglan is married and has five children. He is on a pension but it is too small of an amount to pay his expenses.

To improve his life he needs to improve his business and develop it. For this purpose he has applied for a loan to purchase two middle cows for $500 each and raise them to produce milk over the next two months.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the inventory of items for sale

loans.name: Madémou

texts.fr:
Madémou C. is married and has been a member of the Bignona Bassène village bank for the last three and half years. She wants to strengthen her business selling dyed fabric, juice and ice cream made from “pain de singe” (baobab fruit), sugar, and bissap (a local drink made from hibiscus flowers). She uses her income to take part in family expenses, to pay for health care, and toward her children’s school costs. Madémou is seeking a loan that will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer
Madémou C., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bignona Bassène depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés et de jus et crèmes glaces fait à base de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre et du bissap. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale, aux soins médicaux et à la scolarité des enfants. Madémou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Selling various products

loans.name: Abibata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abibata S. was born on November 27, 1976 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Watika Alegah who is a cook in a local restaurant. She sells cereals (millet, corn, sorghum, and soy) in the Agoè market. She began this business in 2002.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 4 sacks of millet, 3 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of sorghum, and 2 sacks of soy. These purchases will bolster her stock of cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Abibata est née le 27 novembre 1976 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur ALEGAH Watika qui est un cuisinier dans un restaurant de la place. Elle est revendeuse de céréales (Mil, Maïs, Sorgho, soja) dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quatre sacs de mil, 3 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de sorgho et deux sacs de soja. Ces achats viendront augmenter son stock de céréales.

loans.use:
Purchase of cereals

Achat de céréales

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Mr. Koami V., 31, is married and the father of 2 children. In 2006, he opened a store selling auto spare parts. He is always helpful and adopts good strategies for attracting and keeping his customers, who are mostly auto mechanics.

This first credit that he is requesting will allow him to buy 25 tires and 50 inner tubes. With this new stock, his customers will be better served and he will also have a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 31 ans, monsieur V. Koami est marié et père de deux enfants. Depuis 2006, il a ouvert un magasin de vente des pièces de rechange de véhicules. Il est toujours serviable et adopte de bonnes stratégies pour attirer et garder ses clients qui sont pour la plupart les mécaniciens auto.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 25 pneus et 50 chambres à air. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock, ses clients seront mieux servis et il gagnera aussi beaucoup de bénéfice.

loans.use:
Purchase of tires and inner tubes

Achat de pneus et de chambres à air

loans.name: Ndèye Khady

texts.fr:
Ndèye Khady C. is single and has been a member of the Bignona Water Tower village bank for the last four and a half years. She takes care of two children whose schooling, clothing, and health costs she pays for. She buys clothes, vegetables, and dried fish in Dakar to retail in Bignona. The vegetables are sold in the market. She wants to strengthen her business to increase her income. Ndèye Khady is seeking a loan that will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Ndèye Khady C., célibataire est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle a la charge de 02 enfants pour qui elle paie les frais de scolarité, de santé et d’habillement. Elle achète à Dakar des habits, des légumes et des poissons secs pour revendre à Bignona. Les légumes sont vendus au marché. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus Ndèye Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Retail clothing, vegetables, and dried fish

loans.name: Comité Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Sixteen members are integrating into this group, which is currently in it’s sixth loan cycle. The women joining the group are dedicated to various activities, from those that allow them to focus on selling fast food, drinks, and food kiosks, to selling fruit in general.

This group has a desire to progess that is evidenced by an insistence that every member is dedicated to her work daily. Regarding the group, it’s a small group with a lot of experience, which stresses fluid communication and is a good organization for it’s members.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, pasta, clothing,  jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Amra

texts.en:
Amra is 28 years old, married, and living in Jelah. She and her husband have 2 children, who attend primary school. Her husband is a construction worker, and she does some farming to help support them. She sells vegetables to people in her village, and when she has a surplus, she sells her vegetables at the market.

Amra has requested her first loan for $975 to start a clothing business on the side. With the loan, she will be able to purchase a large amount of used clothes from a wholesale retailer, and plans to sell these from door to door in and around her town. She is pictured here with the first batch of clothes she was able to buy. Amra believes that this business will help her earn additional monthly income that she can use to help support her family.

loans.use: To start a business selling clothes

loans.name: Comite Tembiapora Group

texts.en:
This group is currently in its sixth loan cycle. It has 17 members, 2 of whom are new. The members are engaged in various activities including the selling of food, drinks, a small store, a hairdresser, as well as the selling of clothes, among other things.

The group has good relationships and respect among its members. It is also worth noting the on-time payments and assistance to group members at their meetings. In summary, it is a very progressive committee.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. runs a grocery store in the Chanika area of Dar Es Salaam. She has been self-employed for the past six years, and learned her business and entrepreneural skills from an organization known as the Youth Self-Employment Foundation. She has applied for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Comite La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This group is currently in its 5th loan cycle, with 15 members, 3 of whom just started this cycle. The members are engaged in various activities including the selling of food, drinks, a food kiosk, as well as selling fruit in general. 
This is a regular group with some occasional problems; however, they are obtaining positive results thanks to their leaders,who are looking for alternatives so that  every endeavor can be a success. And they are achieving this little by little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Awa Sikina

texts.fr:
Awa Sikina Sané is married and caring for one child, and has been a member of the Bignona Water Tower village bank for five and a half years. She buys a variety of products such as fruits, dried fish, and peanuts to make peanut butter, to retail. She wants to strengthen her business to increase her income. Awa is seeking a loan that she will reimburse with a single payment in six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Awa Sikina Sané, Mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle achète divers produits comme des fruits (mangues et mad), du poisson sec et des arachides pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus Awa sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Selling peanut butter, dried fish, and fruit

loans.name: Amela

texts.en:
Amela is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Jelah, right outside the town of Tesanj. She is married and her husband works in construction. Amela grows vegetables, which she sells at the market and to people in Jelah.

Amela is requesting her first loan for $975. She plans to use this money to buy used clothes, which she can purchase from a local wholesale retailer in her town. She will then sell the clothes going door to door around her town.

This kind of part-time work has become popular in her town. Amela hopes this job will earn extra income for her and her husband, and that it will keep her busy and stimulated during the work week.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell, as a new business

loans.name: Comite La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The women belonging to this group are dedicated to diverse activities. They use the loan as operating capital to promote what they are already making, to purchase more merchandise, or, in the case of the women who sell handmade food, to buy raw ingredients. The women who work in recycling use the loan to buy recyclable materials from small businesses and sell them to large factories for recycling.

They women yearn that their children will not have the same limitations that thay had, so they put in double effort to earn more income and offer the possibility that their children might study and obtain good employment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma H. is 34 years old and a very hard-working businesswoman. For the past five years, she has made a living selling fruits and vegetables at a market in the Chanika neighborhood of Dar Es Salaam. She grows some of the vegetables herself, but in the dry season imports them from other areas. She needs a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Comite Buscando Progreso Group

texts.en:
The women who are members of this group are engaged in diverse labor productions. They use the loan as capital, such as fostering what they have already produced or buying more merchandise or raw ingredients in the case of the women who are dedicated to selling food ítems.

The women who work in recycling use their credit to buy discarded ítems such as aluminum, cardboard, plastic, iron, etc. Most of the women yearn for a better future for their children, so they double their effort to generate income to be able to provide them with possibilites of studying and obtaining a good job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is 44 years old and has been selling clothes for 20 years in a stall in Market Number 4. One of her acheivements has been the ability to construct a small house, with much effort and scarifice. The house is not yet very profitable because of the large amount of competition in the area.

The credit that she is soliciting from Fundacion Paraguaya is so she can bring various items directly from Bolivia for the winter season in order to cope with the demand for various well-priced clothing items.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama Mané is a 39 year-old married mother taking care of six children and has been a member of the Karsia village bank for six years. She wants to strengthen her business, which consists of buying palm oil and peanuts and then retailing them in weekly markets. Her income allows her to improve her family’s standard of living. Mariama is seeking a loan that she will reimburse with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Mariama Mané,39 ans, mariée 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Karsia depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter de l’huile de palme et des arachides et revendre au détail dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Mariama sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Retail of palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 59 years old, her husband Jose is 57 years old, and they have two grown sons who are professionals. They have been working in their trade for more than 30 years, and have a lovely dispensary (small store) in their house, from which they maintain a large influx of clients, thanks to their kindness and good care.

Celestina was born to be a businesswoman because ever since she was a young girl, she has shown the enterprising spirit, and through the years she has understood how to maintain the business so that today it is one of the busiest in the area. Moreover, it gave her the possibility that her sons would be able to study and become professionals. This has been a source of great pride and personal achievement.

With this loan, she will buy meat, noodles, and sugar.

loans.use: With this loan, she will buy meat, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. is the mother of two children and a resident of the Chanika neighborhood of Dar Es Salaam city. She has run a restaurant and bar for the last four years. The profits from her business have helped her put her children in school and look after her family. She needs a loan to help her expand her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Elodia

texts.en:
Elodia is 57 years old and her husband, Casiano, is 64; they have three grown sons who are already professionals and independent. Elodia has been a dressmaker for more than 30 years; her husband works in a supermarket as a butcher.

Elodia learned the dressmaking profession as a very young girl at the end of school. She didn’t enjoy studying, so her grandmother, with whom she was raised, gave her this alternative, which she took advantage of learning. This activity gave her the momentum to excel in life, thanks to the help from her husband in constructing their house and supporting their children’s studies. Today she is a well-known dressmaker in the neighborhood where she lives and she feels happy with what she does because she can contribute something to support the family.

With this loan she will buy fabric, thread, and appliqués.

loans.use: Operating Capital to buy fabric, thread, and appliqués

loans.name: Claudelino

texts.en:
Claudelino is 55 years old, separated, with only one grown daughter, and he lives in the neighborhood of Maria Auxiliadora in Carapeguà. He is a professional surveyor, and his first labor experience was working as an assistant surveyor in real estate for 10 years, which is what sparked his interest to choose this profession.

Today he has his own office in which he works, making plans, surveys, projects, and budgets to construct houses. He has been doing this for more than 25 years. He maintains a good clientele because there are few types of services like his in the area. He has his own house with all the necessary conveniences and a vehicle, and all of this was gained thanks to his enterprising spirit.

The loan will be used to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: The loan will be used to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Mwalimu Suza

texts.en: Suza Mwalimu is 24 years old, the mother of two children and a resident of the Chanika neighborhood of Dar es Salaam. She makes a living running a shop where she sells used clothes, a business she has been in for the past four years. Her income has helped her look after her family and relatives. She needs a loan to buy more inventory to sell and to expand her business

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Dialika

texts.fr:
Dialika C. is a 28 year-old married mother of two children and has been a member of the Karsia village bank for the last three years. Her business activity is buying artisanal soap by the case in Dakar and palm oil in Diaobé to retail in Karsia. Her income allows her to take responsibility for her family. The loan she is seeking will be reimbursed with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Dialika C., 28 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Karsia depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter le savon artisanal par carton à Dakar et de l’huile de palme à Diaobé pour revendre au détail à Karsia. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Retail of soap and palm oil

loans.name: Deborah Ndagire `s Group

texts.en:
N. Deborah leads a group of four women. She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received 10 previous loans. For the past three years, Deborah has owned and operated a profitable used-clothing business. Three times a month, she goes out early in the morning to the local market, a large one in Kampala town, to buy used women’s clothing. She then resells blouses, skirts and other articles at a stand outside the market near her home in Ndeeba, a suburb within the city limits of Kampala. She works six days a week, from 10 a.m. until evening, and reports that she has about 10-15 customers each day. Evenings are her busiest time. She decided to sell clothing because it's an easy way to make a living. Her goal is to continue in this business, but her primary challenge is buying enough clothing to resell. With a new loan, she will be able to buy more clothes and see her business grow.

Deborah is a 42-year-old married mother of five children, ranging in age from 12 to 22. All of her children are in school; the eldest is a student at Makerere Univeristy.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell in a local market

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 23 years old, single, with no children. He is a native of the neighborhood Ndavarù in the city of Carapeguá, 100 km from the capital. He lives with his parents.

Jose is a young entrepreneur who walks around selling his crafts. He has done this for 10 years, since his first work experience was learning this profession from his parents and siblings. Moreover, he is pursuing his fourth year of a Science Administration career in a private university; thanks to his work revenue he can afford his studies. With this loan, he will buy bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, and sheets.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, sheets)

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es:
Salustiana is 47, single and has two grown children. She has been working for over 15 years as a traveling saleswoman, selling typical Paraguayan products. She inherited the business from her parents when she was very young. In addition, she makes the bedspreads herself at home and later she and her children take them to other cities to sell.

Thanks to her hard work and dedication, Salustiana was able to get ahead, build her own house, and provide for her children and her mother, who is no longer of working age.

With her loan, Salustiana plans to purchase bedspreads, hammocks and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Salustiana tiene 47 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos mayores. Ella es vendedora ambulante de articulos típicos, hace más de quince años, esta profesión la heredó de sus padres desde muy joven, ademas ella misma fabrica las colchas en su casa para luego llevarlas con sus hijos a vender en otras ciudades.

Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación logró salir adelante pudiendo llegar a construir para su propia casa , mantener a su s hijos, y también a su madre que ya no tienen edad para trabajar.

Con el crèdito comprarà colchas, hamacas, sabanas.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks, bedspreads, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac M. is a young man of 24 years, and he is single and an only child; he lives with his single mother in the region of Carapegua (Aguai'y ). He is pursuing his third year of a Business Administration career in one of the regional universities, and this constitutes one of his priorities in life: to become a professional.

From a very early age, he began to work with his mother in the fabrication of bedspreads (a local artesenal made with thread and poyvy, a local type of embroidery). They also make hammocks that initially he sold in the artesanal houses in the city. Five years ago he decided to bring them to sell in other cities, as that generates more revenue and results in more profit. Thanks to this activity, he has improved their standard of living and bought a motorcycle to facilitate the distibution of their goods.

He is asking for this loan to buy materials (thread of different colors).

loans.use: He is asking for this loan to buy materials (thread of different colors).

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela T. is 28 and has been married to her husband, Luis Alberto, for eight months. They don’t have children yet, but Mariela says she wants to have a girl and a boy.

Mariela is a native of Espartillar, in the city of Carapegua. Her father was a cattle farmer who was very well-known in the area. In 2003, he started a small store for her downtown, but six months later he died in an accident. Mariela had to close the store since she is an only child and was left to care for his property (animals and land). She sold some of it to be able to reopen her business, which has been running now for two months, located in the same building as before, but in a different area. Her store is much larger now and she also sells appliances and motorbikes. Thanks to all of her efforts and hard work, Mariela is able to support her mother, covering living expenses that wouldn’t be paid without Mariela’s income.

Mariela is now seeking a loan in order to purchase additional merchandise, such as applicances and motorbikes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Mariela T. tiene 28 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Luis Alberto hace 8 meses todavía no tienen hijo pero según comenta su objetivo es tener una nena y un varón.

La Sra. Mariela T. es oriunda de la compañía de Espartillar de la ciudad de Carapeguà, hija de un ganadero muy conocido en la zona, en el 2003 su papá le había montado una pequeña despensa en un salòn en el centro de la ciudad, 6 meses después su papá falleció en en un accidente por lo que tuvo que cerrar de nuevo su despensa, ya que era hija unica y se quedó al cuidado de su los bienes que dejó de su papá ( animales y propiedades ), comercializó una parte para poder rehabrir su negocio, que actualmente tiene montado hace dos años en el mismo local pero con otro ramo y es mucho mas grande ( ventas de electrodomesticos y motos ), Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está manteniendo a su mamá y la casa que depende directamente del ingreso de ella.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (Electrodomesticos y motos).

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as motorbikes, blenders, mixers and coffee makers.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en: Nuriat A. is a resident of Chanika, a town in the Dar Es Salaam region of Tanzania. She has been in business for the past seven years, with responsibility for a range of companies. Most recently, she has run a grocery store. The profits from this business have helped her put her kids in school and look after her family. She needs a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio SantaC. is 24 and lives in Tayy Loma in Carapegua [Paraguay]. This area is known for its handmade crafts such as bedspreads, sashes and hammocks. Many of the area’s artisans used to export their products to Argentina and were hard-hit after the 2002 Peso devaluation. As a result, many families were forced to start from scratch with their businesses and find clients on the national market.

Virgilio sells the products that his parents make or that he buys from other families in Carapegua. His parents use a loom to weave cotton and then use the fabric to create bags, bedspreads and “fajas,” or traditional Paraguayan sashes. Virgilio makes most of his sales in Cuidad del Este, selling to store owners who sell products to tourists. When he travels to Cuidad del Este, he also takes along extra items that he sells on credit or for installment payments. In addition, he has also found a market for his products in the indigenous community; he sends the items and then his father goes to collect payment. In November, Virgilio goes to Caaguazu to sell bedspreads to the cotton formers, collecting the money in April when they’ve sold their crops.

Virgilio is very familiar with the Paraguayan artisan trade and he would like to be able to increase his business. He currently has a large number of clients and is eager to buy a vehicle for when he has to travel long distances to make sales, reduce his travel costs and increase his profit margin.

He is requesting a loan to be used for the purchase of different-colored cotton threads so that his parents can weave additional bedspreads this winter and purchase merchandise from the local artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Virgilio SantaC. tiene 24 años y vive en la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapegua, Esta zona es conocida por sus productos hechos a mano como las sobrecamas, fajas y hamacas. Muchos de las artesanos de la zona exportaban a la Argentina y fueron gravemente afectados por la caída del Peso en el 2002. Por esto, muchas familias tuvieron que reiniciar sus negocios y encontrar clientes en el mercado nacional.

Virgilio vende productos hechos por sus padres y que compra de otras familias en Carapegua. Sus padres usan un telar para tejer el algodón y después usan la tela para armar bolsos o sobre telas y "fajas," cintos tradicionales paraguayos. Su mayor venta lo realiza en Ciudad del Este a comerciantes que realizan venta directa a turistas . En este viaje también lleva mas productos los cuales vende a crédito o por cuotas. También encontró mercado en la comunidad indígena a la cual les enviá sus productos y luego enviá a su padre a juntar el dinero. En noviembre va a Caaguazu a vender colchas a los agricultores de algodón y les cobra en Abril, una ves que hayan vendido el algodón.

El conoce el mercado de la artesanía paraguaya y quiere poder ampliar su negocio. Por ahora mantiene muchos clientes y anhela poder comprar un vehiculo para realizar sus viajes a zonas mas distantes y abaratar los costos de translado y asi aumentar su margen de ganancia .

El crédito solita para comprar hilos de algodón de distintos colores para que sus padres puedan tejer nuevas colchas en este invierno y además comprar otras mercaderías de las artesanas de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase of cotton thread, bedspreads and hammocks.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is a 54-year-old native of the Espartillar de Carapeguà region and mother of 3 children who operates her business independently. She is the propietor of a home business which produces crafts, bedspreads, hammocks, and tablecloths, which are marketed in the local market. In spite of the hardships she has gone through, suffering a serious accident, she has traveled to the capital for her sales and succeeded thanks to her earnings and perserverance.

She is a fighter and her greatest desire is to one day be able to export her merchandise to other countries, because in Paraguay the market is saturated. The loan is to buy thread of different colors.

loans.use: The loan is to buy thread of different colors.

loans.name: Dorothy Nayiga `s Group

texts.en:
N. Dorothy is the leader of a group of four MCDT borrowers. She has been a member of MCDT since 2006, and has received five previous loans. N. is a 40-year-old single mother with two children, aged 6 and 16, both of whom are in school. For the past 20 years, she has made a living selling produce.

Three times a week, she heads out early in the morning to buy sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava and other produce to sell at a small kiosk that she runs at the market a mile from her home. She works at this stall six days a week from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. Most of her customers live in the neighborhood, which is home to a mix of housing and small businesses like hers. Along with produce, she sells beans. With a new loan, she would like to add matooke (green bananas), a staple of daily life in Uganda, to her list of items to sell, and continue to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy produce for resale

loans.name: Comité Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.en:
In the city of San Roque Gonazalez in the neighborhood Sagrado Corazon de Jesús, located 12 km from the Carapeguá office, some women of few resouces learned of the program Women Entrepreneurs Group and decided to meet to receive information about the program. They were looking for a little more support to promote credit through their family incomes and improve their quality of life. These individuals grew thanks to this program. They need this operating credit to invest in their respective micro-businesses and to achieve sustainable growth that makes them grow as a group as well as individuals. Thanks to this new venture, they were able to have better economic returns.

Unable to attend the meeting for the photograph: Cinthia M., for reason of studies, Nilda S., for reason of work, Laura A., for reason of work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for grocery stores, crafts, a freezer, candies, soda, and some ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia G. is 48 years old and married to Miguel Angel Tullo; together they have a son named Fernando. Aurelia began her business selling homemade baked goods (cakes, alfajores, piononos) and ice cream, which she sold house to house, and later took to the canteen (take-away prepared food stand) at the Rca. De Nicaragua school. Thanks to her effort and creativity, she has saved money and been able to start a small store that is currently a lovely dispensary named San Fernando Dispensa.

Thanks to her sacrifices and good administration she is progressing forward. With her income, she pays for the studies of her only son at the University, because her greatest desire is that her son becomes a professional.

The credit will be used to buy sugar, noodles, and herbs.

loans.use: The credit will be used to buy sugar, noodles, and herbs.

loans.name: Amia Sulemani

texts.en: Amia Sulemani S. is a 45-year-old resident of the town of Chanika. She is a seamstress who works at home, and has supported herself by doing this for the last 10 years. She specializes in making ladies clothing and needs a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hadija Nankya ’S Group

texts.en:
N. Hadija is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children who range in age from 16 to 23. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, including oranges, bananas and tomatoes, in a market about a mile from her home. She is there seven days a week from first light at 7 a.m. until the end of the day, and reports that her business is profitable.

Hadija is the leader of a group of four. She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received 13 previous loans. With a new loan, she will be able to buy more produce for her stand at the market and pay school fees so that her children can go to school. Her goal for the future is to buy a plot of land and build a house so she will no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: Buy produce

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfin Ricardo T. was born in the city of Santisima Trinidad in 1965. He has been married to his wife Maria Martinez for 3 years and they have four children, all young boys. Delfin works selling fruits and vegetables around the cities of Aregua, Luque and Asuncion, a business he's had for more than 10 years. He began his membership with the foundation as part of a group of enterprising men in 2007, and now has earned his own good credit and qualifies for the loan.

El Sr. Delfin Ricardo T. nació en la ciudad de Santísima Trinidad en al año 1965, esta casado con Maria Martinez desde hace trece años, tienen cuatro hijos todos varones y menores de edad.

El señor T. se dedica al reciclaje, al servicio de flete y comercialización de frutas y verduras con su carrito desde hace mas de diez años, recorriendo las ciudades de Aregua, Luque y Asunción. Se inició en la Fundación dentro de un comté de hombres emprendedores en el año 2007, hoy día ya accedió al crédito personal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VARIOUS FRUITS AND VEGETABLES IN LARGE QUANTITIES AND CONTINUE TO GROW HIS BUSINESS.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban Ramon P. was born in the city of Ita in 1955. He has been married to his wife, Maria Gloria Martinez for more than 20 years. They have a daughter named Maria Ceclia who studies at school and also helps them with the general store they run from their home.

Esteban sells fruits and vegetables from his truck to various businesses in Luque, in addition to what he sells from his shop. He has been with the foundation since 2003, growing his business with the help of the loans.

El señor Esteban Ramon P. nació en la ciudad de Itá, Departamento de Central, en el año 1955, esta casado con Maria Gloria Martínez hace mas de 20 años y tiene una hija de nombre Maria Cecilia que actualmente esta cursando la secundaria y quien la ayuda a manejar el negocio que tienen en su domicilio.

El señor P. provee de frutas y verduras con su camioneta a varios negocios de Luque como también lo comercializa en su despensa. Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003 logrando un mayor movimiento comercial con los créditos recibidos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FRUITS, VEGETABLES, SUGAR, MILK, EGGS, BAKERY GOODS, NOODLES, AND OTHER ITEMS TO STOCK HIS GENERAL STORE.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia A. was born in the city of Santisima Trinidad in 1974. She has four young children - Edgar, Jonantan, Juan and Luz. Julia works selling meals and sweets in the market of Luque as well as in San Miguel where she lives.

Julia received her first loans from the foundation as a member of a group of enterprising women. Today she qualifies on her own good credit, and can help support her family with her efforts. She is requesting a new loan to purchase utensils for the kitchen as well as ingredients she needs such as flour, sugar, eggs, milk, sweets, meat, sal, etc.

La Sra. Julia A. nació en la ciudad de Santisima Trinidad en al año 1974, tiene cuatro hijos, Edgar, Jhonantan, Juan y Luz todos menores.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y masas dulces en el mercado de Luque como también en el asentamiento de San Miguel Yka á, lugar donde reside.

Inició sus primeros créditos con la Fundación dentro de un comité de mujeres emprendedoras, hoy día opera con crédito personal y puede mantener a su familia con dicho emprendimiento.

Hoy solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y además ingredientes como harina, azúcar, huevos, leche, dulces, carne, sal, etc.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE  THE ITEMS  SHE NEEDS TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS, SUCH AS KITCHEN UTENSILS, FLOUR, SUGAR, EGGS, MILK, MEAT, SALT, ETC.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Senora Lidia Q. was born in the city of Ybycui in 1949. She has two grown up children, Jose and Maria Liz. Lidia has been married to her husband Anastacio Portillo for 30 years. He works as a shopkeeper.

Lidia works as a seamstress, and has been making clothing for children and adults for more than 20 years. She has been a part of the foundation since 2003, and thanks to the financial support she has been able to grow her business and invest in more materials to meet the requests of her customers.

La Sra. Lidia Q. nació en la ciudad de Ybycui en el año 1949, tiene dos hijos mayores, Jose y María Liz de 31 y 33 años respectivamente, esta casada con Anastacio Portillo, desde hace 30 años, quien es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la confección de ropas para pequeños y adultos desde hace más de 20 años. Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003, gracias a la financiación pudo adquirir solidez en su emprendimiento y adquirió mayor cantidad de insumos para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FABRICS AND ACCESSORIES FOR THE CLOTHING SHE MAKES, AS WELL AS REPAIR ONE OF HER SEWING MACHINES.

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai’s shoe repair business is located on the Koryatovicha square in downtown Uzhgorod. The location is perfect for this type of business, as the central square is a busy place and many potential customers pass by Nikolai’s kiosk every day. Another attraction of his business is the quality service and the welcoming attitude. Nikolai has been investing in his business for the past 6 years and currently has about US$1,600 of turnover capital. His income is about US$300 a month. 

Nikolai is requesting a loan of US$1,125 to be able to purchase additional raw materials for his business wholesale. Nikolai is a skilled shoe repair master and, in the future, would like to apply his skills more fully by not only repairing, but also making footwear. He is hoping that wise financial management and his determination will help him reach this goal.

loans.use: Purchase of additional raw materials for a shoe repair business

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya S. is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. She sells plastic flowers and sports bags in one of the local markets. She has been in this trade for seven years, and her experience and entrepreneural spirit have helped her business grow and be successful. 

Mariya has benefited from Nadiya Ukraine loans. She has increased her turnover capital and been able to remodel her apartment from the resulting business profits. Mariya has seen times of both success and failure. After her husband divorced her, she struggled with depression. However, her sister helped her start a business, and it gave Mariya a new hope. Mariya has learned not to give up and to believe in herself. She believes that the current loan will help her increase her turnover capital even more and allow her to eventually open another vending facility in the market.

loans.use: Increase in capital for running a retail business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is divorced and has a 6-year-old son. She sells groceries in a food market in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Olga launched her business following the advice of her relative who is also an entrepreneur. Olga originally set a reasonable pricing policy, and it became one of the reasons why many clients still come to her to buy groceries. Olga has been in this business only for 3 months, but already has about US$900 in inventory.  

She is now hoping to receive a loan to be able to purchase a glass refrigerator for her little store. Olga is very sharp and learns fast. She always listens to the advice from other entrepreneurs who are more experienced and have been in the business longer. Olga's focused attitude and positive experience running her business so far will help her repay the loan and be successful in the business also in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristhian M. is 29 years old and married to Lourdes Natalia. They do not have any children yet. Cristhian worked for many years as an employee, but with the help of his parents he opened his first shop in the market. Later, with the money he saved and the help of his wife, he opened two more shops selling CDs and electronics. Today, his business is one of the shops with the most customers, as it is well located in the city market.

In the future, he would like to open a shop selling household appliances. He would also like to study at university, since he was not able to do so while building his business. He will use the loan to purchase cd s, cassettes, dvd s, radios, calculators, sunglasses, and other items he sells.

El Sr. Cristhian M. posee 29 años esta casado con la señora Lourdes Natalia Godoy de 24 años y no tienen hijos todavía.

El señor trabajó como empleado varios años, con la ayuda de sus padres abrió para su primer local en el mercado. Luego con los ahorros que tenia y la ayuda de su señora abrió otros 2 locales de ventas de Cd´s y artículos de electrónica. Actualmente es uno de los locales con mayor clientela ya que esta ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad.

En el futuro le gustaría abrir para su casa de venta de electrodomésticos y estudiar una carrera universitaria ya que no pudo por que tenia que trabajar y sustentar a su familia.

El préstamo es para la compra de cd´s, casetes, dvd´s, radios, calculadoras, anteojos para sol, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HIS STORE SUCH AS CD S, CASSETTES, DVD S, RADIOS, CALCULATORS, AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL.

loans.name: Deborah Nakiguli’S Group

texts.en:
Deborah N. is a 45-year-old single mother of three. She runs a grocery business from a stall she rents at a large open air market in Kampala, where she sells tomatoes, beans, sweet potatoes, bananas (known locally as matooke), Irish potatoes and a ground nut paste that she makes herself. She buys her produce from a market in the center of town, and gets matooke from an outlying village. She manages her stall by herself six days a week, with Friday and Saturday being her busiest days. She has operated this grocery business for the past 10 years. Before that, she waited tables at Makarere University, but the salary was not enough for her and her family. On her own, she knows she can have all of the profits, and she finds the market a much better place to work.

Still, she faces considerable challenges. Power outages often make it impossible for her to use the machine that grinds the groundnuts into paste. At home, she doesn’t have power at all but uses paraffin lanterns, and she gets water from a nearby pump.

Deborah has been a member of MCDT for the past seven years and, working with her group, has received numerous loans. She says that getting these loans has changed her life, giving her the capital needed to maintain her business and send her son to school. With a new loan, she will expand her business, buying more stock to sell. She also wants to finish building a home, so that she no longer has to rent. Her eventual goal is to build houses that she can rent out to others.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a grocery store and finish work on a house

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German is 31 years old and married to Carolina Candia. They have 2 children who attend school. German used to sell newspapers, but his brother is a mechanic and taught German his new profession. Today he has his own small shop and regular customers. In the future, he would like to expand his shop, buy more tools and grow his customer base. He will use the loan to purchase lubricants, engine oil and other supplies.

El señor German tiene 31 años, está casado con la señora Carolina Candia de 31 años que es docente, poseen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

El señor Germán anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de diarios, su hermano que es mecánico profesional lo llevó a trabajar con el enseñándole la profesión, actualmente posee un taller mecánico con local propio y con clientela formada. Para el futuro desea ampliar su taller comprando más herramientas ya que cuenta con muchos clientes.

El préstamo que solicitó será invertido en la compra de lubricantes, aceites para camiones etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ENGINE OIL AND LUBRICANTS FOR HIS AUTO REPAIR BUSINESS

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married and has three children, all of them grown-up. She is from Stryi where she runs her own business selling groceries in a store next to her house. One of the advantages of her small venture is the lack of competition in the neighborhood. Ivanna has a degree in commerce and has been working in the sphere of food manufacture and sale for about 11 years. Currently, her business has about US$7,000 worth of goods in inventory. 

Ivanna is energetic and motivated. She always moves forward actively to reach new goals and make her business more lucrative. Ivanna is very creative and knows how to financially manage her enterprise. Currently, she is requesting a loan of $3,000 to purchase food items from wholesalers to then sell them in her store. Ivanna will repay the loan within 2 months.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Las Amorosas Group

texts.es:
The mornings in the city of El Alto are very cold as a result of the harsh winter, but this does not stop the association “Las Amorosas,” whose members work very early making exquisite tucumanas (fried meat and vegetable pies) accompanied by a variety of salsas that are offered to-go on moving carts that are designed for this purpose. Currently they want to grow their business and they need to contract helpers to make and sell the meat pies, in addition to acquiring soft drinks to offer to their clients. In this way they will generate more income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Las mañanas en la ciudad de El Alto son muy frías a consecuencia del crudo invierno por el que se esta pasando, pero esto no impide a la asociación “Las amorosas” que trabajan desde muy temprano elaborando exquisitas tucumanas (empanadas fritas de carne y verduras) acompañadas de una variedad de salsas , que luego las ofrecen de manera ambulante en singulares carritos adecuados para este tipo de oficio, Ahora quieren ampliar su negocio por lo que necesitan contratar ayudantes para la elaboración y venta de sus empanadas, además de poder adquirir gaseosas para ofrecerlas a su clientes de este modo generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus numerosas familias

loans.use: They need credit to recruit helpers and to acquire soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Mrs. Claudia C. is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Alejandro Silva who is 51 years old, they have 7 children studying in high school. Mrs. Claudia has worked as a maid for many years, her husband is a storekeeper and with their savings they have been able to purchase a house and put a pantry in it. They live 10 kilometers from the center of the city in a house; she has already formed customers that are mostly her neighbors. She would like in the future to open a small supermarket because there isn't one in her neighborhood and it is a necessity for the locals. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, milk, bread, sugar, sodas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudia C. posee 39 años esta casada con el señor Alejandro Silva de 51 años, poseen 7 hijos cursando actualmente la secundaria.

La señora trabajaba como empleada durante varios años, su marido es comerciante y con los ahorros de ambos lograron comprar para su casa y poner para su despensa. Vive a unos 10 km. del centro de la ciudad en una villa, posee una clientela ya formada que en la mayoría son sus vecinos.

Le gustaría en el futuro abrir un pequeño supermercado ya que en la zona en donde vive no cuentan y es una necesidad para los habitantes del lugar.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, pan, azúcar, gaseosas etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, oil, eggs, cheese, bread, and sodas, etc.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
Mr. Hermenegildo V. is 50 years old and is married to Mrs. Claudia Ramirez who is 40 years old, they have 3 children studying in college right now. Mr V. worked for 11 years for a private company and he retired. His savings and his pension covered the opening of a hairdresser shop that his wife manages. Also he has a grocery store in the market where he is in charge and manages; his best clients are the market visitors. In the future he would like to open a store in his own location and that his sons graduate from the university because he didn't have the opportunity to finish his studies. The loan was invested in the purchase of merchandise like threads, needles, rubber, toys, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Hermenegildo V. de 50 años esta casado con la señora Claudia Ramírez de 40 años, poseen 3 hijos cursando el colegio actualmente.

El señor trabajó 11 años para una empresa privada y se jubiló con los años. Con los ahorros que poseía más la jubilación que cobró abrió una peluquería que administra su señora. También posee una mercería en el mercado en donde él es encargado y administrador, sus mayores clientes son los visitantes del mercado.

En el futuro le gustaría abrir una tienda con local propio y que sus hijos concluyan la universidad ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar su carrera universitaria.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de artículos para mercería como son hilos, agujas, gomas, botones, juguetes, etc.

loans.use: Compra de artículos de merceria como  hilos, gomas, agujas, jueguetes, artículos para el hogar, etc.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Mrs. Epifania is 56 years old, she lives in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Luque, she doesn't have children, and she dedicates herself to making clothes that she has been selling to businesses in the center of the city for a few years. In 2007, she began her own business of dressmaking, with notable success she already knows the activity and has many important contacts that help her with the sale of her clothes. She operates excellently with the Paraguayan Foundation; the loan that she solicits is for the purchase of fabrics, threads, and buttons in quantity enough to cover her requests for merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Epifania tiene 56 años de edad, vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Luque, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para comercios del centro de la ciudad desde hace varios años.

. En el año 2007, inició su propia empresa de confección, con un notable éxito ya que conocía la actividad y poseía contactos importantes que ayudaron a la venta de sus prendas.

La misma opera con la Fundación Paraguaya en forma excelente, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de telas, hilos, botones en cantidad de manera a cubrir un pedido importante de mercaderías que tiene.

loans.use: Compra de tela, hilos, botones

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia lives in a well-known neighborhood in the city of Luque and dedicates herself to making collared shirts for men, jeans for children age 5 and up, she creates her works in a small family workshop that she has in her home, where her mother helps her make the clothes. She has customers in the center of the city, the loan she solicits is for the purchase of a sewing machine which will serve her sharpen her work, help her production and better the income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Julia vive en un Barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Luque se dedica a la confección de remeras con cuello para hombres, jeans para criaturas hace 5 años, sus trabajos los realiza en un pequeño taller familiar de confección que posee en su domicilio, donde cuenta con la ayuda de su madre en la realización de las prendas.

Posee clientela en el centro de la ciudad, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una máquina de coser la cual le servirá para agilizar su trabajo, aumentar su producción y por ende mejorar sus ingresos familiares.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rose Bih

texts.en:
Rose Bih has been a member of GHAPE for more than three years. She was motivated to join the organization by other members after she was maltreated by her polygamous husband. She was faced with the burden of taking care of her children alone, but after receiving a loan she was able to pay school fees for her children through the profits of her piggery and farming business.

Given a loan of $1000, she will start a new business of selling draft beer. There is a growing demand for this business in her area. She plans to employ two boys to sell beer, which will help her community since there is an unemployment problem. Rose plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months after the date of dispursement.

loans.use: to open a bar

loans.name: Amazonas Ii Group

texts.es:
Every two weeks the association “Amazonas II” meets in the center of Germán Buch, which belongs to Pro-Mujer. With great responsibility they have completed their third year of work together with this organization. The majority of the members are married with large families; such is the case with Mrs. Norita, who has seven children and unfortunately her partner abandoned her and she has become sick. With the help of her children she sells soft drinks, biscuits and a variety of candies in her stall, located in the Ceja area of El Alto, which provides her with a little money that helps provide her family’s daily needs. The central activity of the association is the sale of staple goods in neighborhood stores and different stalls around the city. They need greater capital to acquire a greater quantity and variety of products, making wholesale purchases to generate greater income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Cada quince días la asociación "Amazonas II " se reúne en el centro focal de Germán Buch, que pertenece a Pro-Mujer. Con mucha responsabilidad ya cumplen su tercer año de trabajar junto a esta entidad. La mayoría casadas con familias numerosas tal es el caso de doña Norita que tiene siete hijos a su cargo, lamentablemente su pareja la abandono y aun encontrándose enferma, con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de refrescos, galletas y una variedad de golosinas en un puesto ubicado en la Ceja de El alto, así obtiene un poco de dinero que ayuda a sustentar a su familia diariamente. La actividad central en la asociación es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en tiendas de barrio y puestos en distintos puntos de la ciudad. Ellas necesitan mayor capital para adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de productos, además realizar sus compras al por mayor, para poder generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: Need loans to purchase a greater quantity and variety of food for their stores

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Graciela G. is separated; she is 47 years old and has 5 children, 2 boys and 3 girls. Maria Graciela has dedicated herself to traveling sales for the last 12 years, it was the way to earn a bit of money to sustain her 5 children. Maria together with her three daughters sells clothes in an ambulatory manner. Now Mrs. Maria with her savings and the help of the Foundation she has already started a small grocery store that her sons tend when she leaves to sell her clothes. Very soon she thinks she will open another clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Graciela G. es separada, tiene 47 años y tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 nenas.

Mariah Graciela desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta ambulante fue la forma de ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a sus 5 hijos. María junto con sus tres hijas salían a vender ropa en forma ambulante.

Ahora la señora María con sus ahorros y con la ayuda de la Fundación ya habilitó también un pequeño almacén que lo atienden sus hijos cuando ella sale a vender sus prendas. Muy pronto piensa levantar otro salón para la venta de ropas en su domicilio.

loans.use: The purchase of herbs, noodles, sugar, rice, sodas, beers, vinegar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Mr. Amancio V. is 38 years old and is single, he like all his family is from a city in the interior of the country. Until approximately 10 years ago, he dedicated himself to a small farm, in a moment where the money he was earning was not keeping up, he decided to seek out other options and he came to the central area of the city where he dedicated himself to the selling things in a traveling way, like all his brothers. Nowadays thanks to the loans that the Foundation has granted him he already has his own vehicle that is his principal tool for work and two times a week he travels to Chaco Paraguayo to sell his merchandise. The credit that he is requesting he will invest in the purchase of various foods like potatoes, tapioca, tomatoes, pumpkin, noodles, milk, juices, etc. In the future he wants to buy a vehicle with more capacity for cargo.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Amancio V. tiene 38 años y es soltero, él como toda su familia es de una ciudad del interior del país. Hasta aproximadamente 10 años se dedicaban a la chacra, en un momento dado como el dinero que ganaban no les alcanzaba decidió buscar nuevos horizontes y vino hacia el departamento central donde se dedicó a la venta ambulante, como todos sus hermanos.

Hoy día gracias a los créditos que la Fundación le ha otorgado ya tiene su propio vehículo que es su principal herramienta de trabajo y dos veces por semana viaja al Chaco Paraguayo para vender su mercadería.

El crédito que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles varios como papas, mandioca, tomate, zapallo, fideos, cañas, leche, jugos etc. En el futuro el desea comprarse un vehículo con más capacidad de carga.

loans.use: To purchase food like potatoes, tapioca, tomatoes, pumpkin, noodles, milk, juices, etc.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
María Graciela G. is separated, 47 years old and has five children, two boys and three girls. For the past 12 years she has been dedicated to selling clothing in different locations, which helped her earn a little money to provide for her children. María, along with her three daughters, would leave each morning to sell clothing in outdoor markets.

Now, María, with her savings and the help of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, has been able to also set up a tiny convenience store that her sons can tend while she is out selling her clothing items. She is requesting the loan to stock her store with more merchandise like sugar, flour, meat, milk, noodles, and other staple items. She also plans very soon to set up another store out of her home to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora María Graciela G. es separada, tiene 47 años y tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 nenas.

Maria Graciela desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas, esta fue la forma de ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a sus 5 hijos. María junto con sus tres hijas salían a vender ropa en forma ambulante.

Ahora la señora María con sus ahorros y con la ayuda de la Fundación ya habilitó también un pequeño almacén que lo atienden sus hijos cuando ella sale a vender sus prendas. El crédito que solicita es para abastecer a su almacén con mayor stock de mercaderías como azúcar, harina, carne, leche, fideos, entre otros.

Muy pronto piensa levantar otro salón para la venta de ropas en su domicilio.

loans.use: Purchase yerba, noodles, sugar, rice, soft drinks, beer, oil, milk, sweet breads, etc. / Compra de yerba, fideos, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, cerveza, aceite, leche. panificados, etc.

loans.name: Tata Peter

texts.en:
Born in 1940, Tata Peter is married and has four children. With the death of his children, he has been facing numerous emotional and financial difficulties.

Vegetable farming is a very profitable business in Tata Peter’s community, especially when done on a large scale. However, he has found it difficult to raise business capital. He tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems repaying the loan due to high interest rates. Motivated by his ambitions as a gardener, Tata Peter joined GHAPE to access loans and benefit from their numerous trainings on loan and money management.

Given a loan, he plans to buy more seeds, plant palm trees (for harvesting palm nuts), and buy piglets. He will use the profits to provide for himself and his family. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months from the date of dispersment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, seeds, and palm tree seedlings

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Mrs. Susana has been married for the past thirty years to Reinaldo Britez. They have a twelve year old daughter, Dahiana.

Susana has been working for the past few years in the food business. There is a bus station in front of her home, so her main clients are the drivers and office workers. She was able to save some money and together with a loan that she obtained through Fundacion Paraguaya she was able to open her own store.

In the near future Susana would like to expand her business so that she can provide an increased level of comfort for her customers. In order to do that, she is asking for a loan so that she can buy more merchandise and that way offer more varied products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Susana está casada hace 30 años con el señor Reinaldo Britez con quien tiene una hija de 12 años de edad llamada Dahiana.

Susana trabaja ya hace varios años en el rubro de la comida. Una parada de transportes urbanos queda frente a su casa, por lo que sus principales clientes siempre fueron los choferes y oficinistas de la empresa. Gracias a que le fue muy bien, ella pudo ahorrar un poco y junto con un crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo abrir una pequeña despensa.

En un futuro próximo doña Susana quiere ampliar su local, para brindar mayor comodidad a la gente que come en su local. Por el momento, ella solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para su despensa y así variar más su stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: To buy  merchandise for her business such as sugar, rice, oil, sodas, milk, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of piglets, feed, and pay for transportation

loans.name: Delphen

texts.en:
Born in 1971, Delphen M. has been finding difficulties trying to raise business capital to make necessary investments in her pig farm. She is married to Esau Ngoh and has 6 children. She joined GHAPE in 2001 and, she has successfully borrowed and repaid seven loans from GHAPE. She was unable to invest her first loan because of ill health, but now, she has greatly improved on her management skills and is capable of investing bigger loans.

Pig farming is a very profitable business in her community when done on a large scale. Motivated by her ambitions and given this loan, she plans to expand her business through purchasing additional piglets, feed, and feeding troughs. She will use the profits to provide the basic needs of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed, and feeders

loans.name: Suma Pancara Group

texts.es:
Various lunches and snacks are offered every day in the market area of ‘Río seco’ and markets of the July 16th zone, principally on fair days. Most of the members of the group “Suma Pancara” are dedicated to this work. Making this food obliges the members to remain in their stalls for the entire day alongside their small children because they do not have enough money to leave them in nurseries or elsewhere. It is also the case that their children, although still small, help their mothers in their stalls, which is unfortunate because the children are exposed to numerous dangers. The association “Suma Pancara” needs loans to inject capital into their businesses, acquire more ingredients and improve their stalls, thus generating higher revenues for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días en el mercado de la zona Río seco y mercados de la zona 16 de julio, principalmente los días de feria, se ofrecen variados almuerzos y otras meriendas. Actividad que se dedica la mayor parte de la asociación “Suma Pancara” La elaboración de estos alimentos obliga a estas personas a permanecer en sus puestos de venta durante todo el día teniendo así que trabajar junto a sus pequeños hijos, ya que no cuentan con el dinero suficiente para poder dejarlos en guarderías u otros, también existe el caso que sus niños aun siendo pequeños ayudan a sus mamas en sus puestos caso muy lamentable ya que los niños se ven expuestos a innumerables peligros. La asociación “Suma Pancara” necesita mayores créditos para poder inyectar capital a sus negocios adquiriendo mayores insumos y realizar mejoras en sus puestos de venta, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: The group needs loans to purchase ingredients and improve their stalls

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto has worked very hard for many years. He knew how to make his family successful and how to bring up his children well so that today they are well-respected individuals. Now, after retirement, life still continues and he has the same energy with which he opened his store in his own home 15 years ago.

The friendly treatment and attention to service that he offers has allowed him to continue his work and overcome the obstacles of competition, and now his wish is to build his business even more. He is asking for a loan of 3552 soles. Be a part of Roberto’s loan so that he can continue the process of building a fine future for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto tiene muchos años de su vida dedicada intensamente al trabajo, supo sacar adelante a su familia y a sus hijos que hoy son hombres y mujeres de bien. Ahora, después de jubilarse, para él la vida continua y sigue con esas mismas energías con las cuales hace 15 años abrió su botica en las instalaciones de su propia casa.

El trato amable y la calidad de atención que ofrece le ha permitido permanecer y vencer los obstáculos de la competencia en el mercado y ahora su deseo es seguir implementando aun más su negocio.El está solicitando un préstamo de 3552 soles. Se parte del préstamo de Roberto para seguir adelante para forjarse un buen futuro.

loans.use: To expand his pharmacy business so that he can provide a better service to his clients.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Morgado Pedro

texts.pt:
Morgado is 28 years old and he is from the Boane province. He is married and has a 1-year-old son. He lives with his mother and 3 younger brothers. Morgado finished high school but never lived in any other place -- he lives in his own home located in Zone 07. Morgado has been working for 5 years. He graduated from IMAP of Manhiça in 2002 and his working shifts are from 7:00am until 12:00pm, Mondays through Fridays. His monthly salary is 4800,00mt from which he saves 1000,00mt in the bank. This will be the fourth loan in Morgado's life and third through Hluvuku. His first loan came from the credit corporation Tchuma in the amount of 15000,00mt -- it was used to pay for his marriage ceremony. The second loan in the amount of 8900,00mt and the third for 15000,00mt were used to buy construction materials. This fourth loan will also be used to purchase construction materials. Morgado wishes to pay back ahead of time because he believes that the amount requested will not be enough to finish up the construction. He will need to request additional loans in order to accomplish completion.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Morgado tem 28 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho com um ano de idade, vive com a sua mae mais 3 irmao mais novo que ele. É natural de Boane provincia do Maputo. Morgado estudou até o nível médio, nunca mudou de cidade sempre viveu na terra de origem, vive numa casa propria no bairro 07. Morgado é docente a cinco anos, formados no IMAP da manhiça em 2002 e trabalha das 7:00h até 12:00h da segunda a sexta feira. Tem um salario mensal de 4800,00mt e poupa menslamente 1000,00mt no banco. Este é o quarto empréstimo para o Morgado na vida e terceiro na Hluvuku tendo tido o primeiro na cooperativa de credito Tchuma de 15000,00mt valor que usou para despesas de casamento e o segundo de 8900,00mt, o terceiro de 15000,00mt ambos usou para compra de material de construção. Assim este quarto tambem pretende comprar material de construção. Morgado pretende pagar antes do tempo porque acha que o valor que solicita agora ainda não poderá concluir tudo que pretende na sua obra assim voltara logo que fechar solicitar outros empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Born in 1943, N. Lucia, a widow, was married to the late John Fru with three children remaining, after losing four others. She says being a widow is difficult since she has more burdens on her. Since the death of her supportive husband, she has had to start doing some of the things her husband did, which she used to take for granted. The death of her four children has also left her wishing to fight to give a better life to those remaining. In the face of these challenges, N. Lucia joined GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to expand her business buying and splitting firewood and farming cassava. She promises to use the profit to educate her children and see them have income-generating activity in the future. Her community stands to benefit from her activities, as she will provide them with crops and firewood. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, seeds for farming

loans.name: El Rincón De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
The Corner of Friends group formed when the group La Familia in the San Salvador neighborhood surpassed its maximum number of members and another group was formed. Currently this group consists of 15 members and it is in its first loan cycle. The women are involved in different activities and each one is requesting a long to invest in her business, as detailed below:

Blanca F. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Sara Díaz will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts and athletic wear.

Laura L. will invest in the purchase of apples, mandarins, oranges, melons, bananas and pears.

Viviana M. will invest in the purchase of cell phone accessories (covers, leather cases, etc.).

Verónica V. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Yeni V. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, athletic wear, noodles, rice, sugar, meats, coal, and sweet breads.

Hilaria A. will invest in the purchase of noodles, rice, sugar, meats, coal, and sweet breads.

Rosa Almirón will invest in the purchase of silver jewelry.

María L. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Rocío V. will invest in the purchase of gold and silver jewelry.

Ana E. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Digna Díaz will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Felicia A. will invest in the purchase of hair drying creams, shampoo and conditioners.

Enriqueta Chávez will invest in the purchase of children's toys.

Guillerma O. will invest in the purchase caramels, lollipops, cookies and pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité El Rincón de las Amigas se dio mediante la formación del comité La Familia del barrio San Salvador, el cual se encontraba en su segunda reunión de formación y la cantidad de integrantes superó el máximo permitido por lo que se formo dos comités. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa.

Estas señoras realizan distintos tipos de actividades y cada una solicita el crédito para poder invertirlos en sus negocios y comprar:

- Blanca F. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Sara Díaz invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, buzos (ropa de gimnasia)

- Laura L. invertirá en la compra de manzanas, mandarinas, naranjas, melón, bananas, pera.

- Viviana M. invertirá en la compra de artículos de celulares: carcasas, estuches de cuero, de plásticos, protectores de siliconas, entre otros.

- Verónica V. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Yeni V. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, buzos, fideos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, carbón, panificados.

- Hilaria A. invertirá en la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, carbón, panificados.

- Rosa Almirón invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata.

- María L. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.
