- Rocío V. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata, oro.

- Ana E. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

-Digna Díaz invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Felicia A. invertirá en la compra de secador de pelo cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores de pelo.

- Enriqueta Chávez invertirá en la compra de juguetes para niños.

- Guillerma O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores, etc.

loans.use: Purchase varied merchandise / compra de mercaderías varias.

loans.name: Fongyen Jonathan

texts.en:
Fongyen Jonathan was born in 1962 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined GHAPE, he was able to make much progress with his previous loans, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: rearing of pigs, which is very profitable because of the high demand for pork in his community. Pig farming has other benefits, as the manure can be used as fertilizer for his food crops.

Given this loan, he will purchase piglets and pig feed to expand his pig farm. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family. The loan is to be repaid within 18 months, with the first installment repayment due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
Filipe N. is 46 years old. He is married and has 4 sons -- the 20-year-old and the 18-year-old are on the 10th grade; the second youngest is 10 years old and he is on the 5th grade; the youngest one is 8 years old and he is on the 2nd grade. Filipe lives with his wife and sons and does not support anybody else. Filipe is from the Matutine district, located in the province of Maputo. He fled the district due to a civil war to the neighboring South Africa where he lived for 5 years. He, later, obtained a work contract back in the city of Maputo. Subsequently, he was transferred to Boane, district of the same province, and had his family relocated there as well. So, he left his residence in the city of Maputo and, at this time, he lives with his family in his own house in Boane. Filipe works as a human resources supervisor working between 7:00am and 4:00pm, from Monday through Friday. His salary is 3915,00mt and he is able to save 1600,00mt. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku which will be used to purchase construction material. His future plans is to improve his residence and rent it out after wards.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Filipe N. tem 46 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 20 anos o primeiro que estuda na 10ªClasse e segundo com 18 anos também na 10ªClasse, o terceiro com 10 ano e estuda 5ªClasse, o quarto com 8 anos e estuda na 2ªClasse, vive com a sua esposa e seus filhos e não sustenta ninguém mais. Filipe é natural do Distrito de Matutuine Provincia do Maputo, abandonou o distrito devido a Guerra civil e tinha se refugiado na Africa do sul pais visinho onde viveu 5 anos, e quando regressa foi parar na cidade de maputo, onde consegue um contrato de trabalho e por sua vez foi transferido para Boane distrito da mesma provincia e assim mais tarde foi buscar a familia para morar com ela. Assim deixou a residencia na cidade de maputo e neste momento tem outra sua própria residencia em Boane onde mora com a familia. Filipe trabalha como chefe dos recursos humanos e tem um horario das 7:00h até 16:00h da segunda a sexta feira. Tem um salário de 3915,00mt e consegue poupar mensalmente 1600,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku qual pretende comprar material de construção. Tem com planos futuros reabilitar a residencia da cidade e posteriormente a rendar.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Lum Rophina

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Rophina is married and has nine children. She is proud that she and her husband were married in a traditional ceremony, to which she attributes their good luck that they were blessed with so many children. Unfortunately, her husband is now seriously ill and Rophina must care for him and her children alone.

With her previous loans from GHAPE, Rophina succeeded in growing and providing her community with cassava and ndjamadjama (huckleberry leaves, a popular green vegetable). Given this loan, she plans to buy fresh manure, seedlings, and fertilizers to expand and improve her farming. She also intends to buy piglets to fatten and sell for food. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, manure, and payment of labour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is married and has eight children. Health problems have rendered her not strong enough to cultivate crops, which is the main economic activity in her community. As a result, she has resorted to rearing animals which is less strenuous. However, prior to joining GHAPE, inadequate capital meant she could not earn enough to meet the needs of her children and family. Motivated by other GHAPE members in her community, she joined the program and has been successfully receiving and repaying loans ever since. The profit she gets from her business is used to pay the school fees for her children. 

Given this loan, she plans to repair her pigsty, buy more piglets and fowls, and buy feed for her pigs and fowls. Her community will benefit from this in that there will be more good quality meat and manure (from the pigs) at their disposal for a better standard of living. Her family will benefit from additional income to improve their lifestyle.

Elizabeth B. plans to repay this loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment will be made on the fourth month from disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and chickens

loans.name: Fatíma Francisco

texts.pt:
Fatíma Francisco L. is 37 years old. She is a single mother and has a 12-year-old son that is on the 7th grade. Besides her son, she also supports her mother and grandmother. They do not live with her so she has to send them money and, sometimes, food. Fatima went to school up to 11th grade and she had to drop out becasue of her first pregnancy. She was born in Boane and, lived in the district of Namaacha and, when she was fleeing the war, she also lived in the city of Maputo, completing the 6th and 7th grade there. She lives with her aunt while her home is under construction. Fatima has been working as a care-giver for the past two years and she has a renewable and pre-determined labor contract. Her daily shift is from 8:00am to 3:30pm. Fatima learned this skill at ADDP (African Disability Decade Programme). Her monthly salary is 4000,00mt and she is able to save 1000,00mt from that. This is Fatima's second loan request from Hluvuku -- she has never requested it from another instituition. With this loan Fatima will buy construction materials to speed up the conclusion of her home. The house would take much longer to be completed if her salary alone had to sponsor it. Her future plan is to improve her housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Fatíma Francisco L. tem 37 anos de idade e é solteira mae de um filho de 12 anos que estuda na 7ªClasse, para além do filho sustenta a mae dela e sua Avó e esta dua não mora com elas na mesma casa só manda dinheiro e as vezes produtos alimentares. Fatima estudou até 11ª classe e deixou por causa da gravidez do seu primeiro filho, ela nasceu em Boane e viveu algum tempo no distrito de Namaacha e tambem na cidade de maputo quando fugia da Guerra onde fez a 6 ª e 7 ª Classe, vive numa casa da tia e tem a sua casa más ainda em construção. Fatima trabalha com animadora a dois anos e tem um vinculo laboral determinado e renovavel e tem um horario de trabalho das 8:00h as 15:30h. Fatima aprendeu o trabalho na ADDP. Tem salario mensal de 4000,00mt e poupa deste 1000,00mt por mes. Este é o segundo emprestimo da Fatima na Hluvuku e nunca teve noutras instituições. Com este empréstimo Fatima vai comprar material de construção e para ela vai acelerar a conclusão da obra melhor que se estivesse a Construir pouco aos poucos na base do salário. Tem como planos futuros melhorar cada vez mais as condições habitacionais.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Comite Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
The María Auxiliadora group formed thanks to the members of the United Women group in the Villa Salvador neighborhood of Aregua, Paraguay, who invited some of their neighbors to form a new group and receive the benefits of loans and training to help their small businesses. Currently the group consists of 15 members and it is in its second loan cycle. The women are requesting the loan to purchase merchandise or invest in their businesses, as detailed below:

1. Narcisa Villaba will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

2. Lucia V. will invest in paper and ink for her photocopier.

3. Silvia A. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

4. Anuncia O. will invest in the purchase of caramels, lollipops, gelatins and pastries.

5. Rosalba A. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

6. Antoliana R. will invest in the purchase of jewelry.

7. Mirian F. will invest in the purchase of jewelry.

8. Elena G. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

9. Herminia O. will invest in the purchase of caramels, lollipops, gelatins and pastries.

10. María Elizabeth M. will invest in the purchase of recyclable plastics.

11. Nicolaza M. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

12. Mirian M. will invest in silver jewelry.

13. Myrian A. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, breads, tomatoes, napkins, meats, vegetables, oils and beers.

14. Petrona J. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

15. Mirian Quiñoñez will invest in the purchase of threads and cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité María Auxiliadora se formó gracias a las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Aregua quienes invitaron algunas de sus vecinas del barrio a formar un comité, para obtener los beneficios de créditos y capacitaciones para sacar adelante sus microempresas. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa. Ellas solicitan un crédito para comprar mercaderías e invertirlos en sus negocios. El detalle es el siguiente: 1. - Narcisa Villaba invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

2. - Lucia V. invertirá en la compra de hojas y tinta para fotocopiadora.

3. - Silvia A. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

4. - Anuncia O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores.

5. - Rosalba A. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

6. - Antoliana R. invertirá en la compra de joyas.

7. - Mirian F. invertirá en la compra de joyas.

8. - Elena G. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

9. - Herminia O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores.

10. - María Elizabeth M. invertirá en la compra de plásticos para reciclar

11. - Nicolaza M. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc. 12. - Mirian M. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata

13. - Myrian A. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, tomates, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas

14. - Petrona J. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

15. – Mirian Quiñoñez invertirá en la compra de hilos y tela.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise or supplies for their businesses / compra de mercaderías para sus negocios

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married to Chi Tamchoro and blessed with five children. She is a very hard-working woman. She says that GHAPE has really helped her in giving her loans to rear pigs and farm crops, which has improved her living standards. In addition to the loans, the business and management techniques she learned from the organization have made her able to manage her previous loans successfully.

Regina has a very hard-working son in the city of Limbe who has been doing tire patching (vulcanization) and selling engine parts and motor oil for many years. Ever since he began working, he has been helping his mother and junior siblings. Regina now wants to use this loan to give her son capital to expand his business, especially since she is growing older and relies more and more on his support to maintain the family.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of engine parts, oil, tubes, pump, and tires

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa B. works selling all kinds of decorative plants and flowers at the local market every weekend. She likes to be involved in this activity, which she has been doing for 19 years when it started out of curiosity. Today, she is still selling plants because she really enjoys this job, which also permits her to look after her four young children. They are studying in order to keep moving forward on the road of success, which further motivates Ms. B.. She would like to increase her amount of merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles. Support Ms. B.’ efforts and her desire to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Rosa trabaja todos los fines D. semana vendiendo en un puesto D. la feria D. su localidad todo tipo D. plantas ornamentales y flores. Ella gusta D. realizar estas actividades y lo viene haciendo desD. hace 19 años cuando todo comenzó por simple curiosidad, ahora lo sigue haciendo porque realmente disfruta D. este trabajo, que le permite además, atender a sus 4 jóvenes hijos, ellos ahora están estudiando para seguir en el camino D. la superación y esto anima más a Doña Rosa. Su deseo es incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que posee para lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo D. 500 soles. Apoya este esfuerzo y las ganas D. seguir trabajando D. Doña Rosa.

loans.use: Increase her variety of plants and flowers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has four children remaining. She was so disturbed by the deaths of her grown children, who were very supportive to her in providing for the needs of the family. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for loans to help her to care for herself.  With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, groundnuts, and yams. 

Given this loan, she plans to buy manure, fertilizer, and chemicals to expand her farming. She intends to open a savings account for herself with the profit. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, manure, and tools

loans.name: Adriana Bernardo

texts.pt:
Adriana Bernardo L. is 41 years old. She is from Caia, a province of Sofala in the central part of Mozambique. She is married and has three sons that are 21, 20 and 18 years old. Besides supporting her three sons she also supports a nephew that lives with them. Adriana attended school up until the 6th grade. She did not continue her education due to financial reasons. In 2000, she left Sofala for Maputo through the church she attended and was involved in. She set up residence in Boane where she still lives. She has her own home located in zone 07. In 2006, she opened up a business that sold tobacco and, in 2007, she introduced a chicken raising and slaughtering business with help from an assistant. She learned how to raise chickens with friends and she has been doing it for a year now. The venture has been doing well despite difficulties in transportation and the rising cost of purchasing hens and tobacco. Weekly, she can sell up to 700,00mt - she has sold a can of tobacco (250g) for 10,00mt and a chicken for 90,00mt. She has not started to save yet because she prefers to invest all in the business. This is her third loan from Hluvuku. The first two were used to purchase tobacco and with the profits she strenghtened the chicken raising business. She now requests 14500,00mt to expand her chicken raising business. Adriana wishes to pay back the loan early so that she can request another loan to build additional aviaries and improve her housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Adriana Bernardo L. tem 41 anos de idade, natural de Caia provincia de Sofala ao centro de Moçambique. Casada e mae de tres filhos sendo o maior com 21 anos de idade e o segundo com 20 anos e o terceiro com o 18 anos, para alem de sustentar os filhos também sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele. Adriana estudou até 6ªclasse e nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Em 2000 ela saiu da provincia de sofala para maputo atraves da igreja onde prestava trabalhos de cultos. Onde veio a fixar se no distrito de Boane local que se encontra até data hoje. Tem casa propria no bairro 07. Em 2006 abre um negocio que consiste na venda de tabaco e em 2007 introduziu a criação de frangos de corte qual desenvolve com apoio de uma empregada. A criação de frangos aprendeu com amigas e passam um ano que exerce esta actividade. O negocio vai bem apesar das dificuldades de transporte e preços cada dia altos de aquisição do pintos e tabaca semanalmente consegue vender até 700,00mt tendo vendido uma lata de tabaco (250g) por 10,00mt e um frangos por 90,00mt. Ainda nao faz poupança porque prefere ainda ampliar o negocio. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku. Os primeiros dois emprestimos usou o dinheiro para compa de tabaco para revender e com os lucros ia reforçando actividade de criação de frangos. Assim pede este 14.500,00mt para ampliar o seu negocio de frangos. Adriana pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro para construção de novos aviarios e melhorar a sua casa.

loans.use: To increase chicken raising capabilities.

loans.name: Noruega Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto in the zone Huayna Potosí you will find the center Germán Bush. Inside of this center you will find the association named Noruega, 11 members who are part of a unified and organized group. Most of them are principally engaged in selling clothing for all ages (jackets, sweaters, and others) in different streets in the city of El Alto. Now that winter is here, these are the types of products sold most, which is why they are seeking larger loans to be able to purchase more merchandise in bulk, which will generate more income to improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona Huayna Potosí se encuentra el centro focal “Germán Busch” dentro este centro encontramos a la asociación denominada “Noruega”, 11 socias forman un grupo muy unido y organizado. La mayoría de ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta ropa para todas las edades (chamarras, chompas, y otros) en distintos calles de la ciudad del Alto. Ahora que el invierno llego, este tipo de productos son mas vendidos, lo que les lleva a solicitar mayores créditos para poder comprar mayor mercadería al por mayor, así generar mejores ingresos para mejorar su estilo de vida

loans.use: They need capital to purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and has six children. He had little education, as his parents could not afford to pay his school fees. He grew up in a very poor family and struggled throughout his youth. Recently, he has been facing some family problems because of a land disput which caused the death of his son.

Since joining GHAPE, Samuel has proven beyond doubt his ability to successfully invest and repay loans, and provide quality products, including piglets, manure, and food crops to his community. He has also gained respect from many people within GHAPE and his community because of his leadership qualities.

Now, Samuel would like to provide steady transportation services to his community. Given this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle, pay the registration, and obtain all the required official documents. Since the roads are not in good condition, many transport vehicles are unable to get to his community and motorcycles are the only alternative to transport people to and from the town markets. The profit from his motorcycle will enable Samuel further his children’s education and even build a better house for the family.

Samuel plans to pay back his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle and required documents

loans.name: Comite Mueres Comprensivas Group

texts.es:
This current union was started when eight members who had been in a previous group in the area that had disbanded contacted some friends and formed the Understanding Women Group. These women are requesting a loan so they will be able to acquire new merchandise for their respective businesses, detailed below:

Blasia M. is a dressmaker but at the moment runs a food stand at a neighborhood school and will invest the money to purchase ingredients.

Irma López is dedicated to selling food and will use the money to purchase ingredients to make her meals.

María C. also runs a food stand at a neighborhood school and will invest her money to purchase ingredients.

Elida C. is dedicated to selling lingerie and will invest the money to purchase more merchandise.

Felipa Isabel runs a haberdashery and will invest the money to purchase merchandise.

Mariana G. sells refreshments and will use the money to purchase wholesale merchandise.

Gloria A. is a teacher and runs a bookstore out of her home and will invest the money to purchase merchandise for her store.

Pablina Brítez is dedicated to selling coal and will use the money to purchase some at wholesale.

Zuni López makes wooden chairs and will use the money to purchase the wood.

Geronima López sells refreshments and will use the money to purchase merchandise.

Andrea Vega is dedicated to selling party supplies and will invest the money to purchase merchandise.

Jorgelina Giménez is dedicated to selling food and will use the money to purchase ingredients to make her meals.

Alejandra S. is dedicated to selling food and will use the money to purchase ingredients to make her meals.

Clotilde López makes wooden chairs and will use the money to purchase the wood.

Mirian C. runs a convenience store and will invest the money to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fueron 8 señoras que ya habrían pertenecido a un comité de la misma zona y que se disolvió luego de un tiempo. Para poder formar un nuevo grupo, estas señoras contactaron con otras amigas y formaron el comité llamado Mujeres Comprensivas.

Estas señoras solicitan el crédito para adquirir nuevas mercaderías para sus respectivos negocios, por lo que a continuación detallamos las inversiones de cada señora:

 La señora Blasia M. es modista pero en este momento tiene una cantina en la escuela de su barrio y invertirá el dinero para la compra de insumo para su cantina.

 La señora Irma López se dedica a la venta de comestible, invertirá su dinero en la compra insumo para la elaboración de sus comidas.

 La señora María C. tiene una cantina en la escuela de su barrio e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para su cantina.

 La señora Elida C. se dedica a la venta de Lencería, invertirá su dinero en la compra de más mercaderías.

 La señora Felipa Isabel se dedica en la venta de artículos de mercería, invertirá su dinero en la compra de mercaderías.

 La señora Mariana G. se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescantes, invertirá su dinero en la compra de esa mercadería al por mayor.

 La señora Gloria A. es Docente y a la par tiene una librería en su casa y invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para su librería.

 La señora Pablina Brítez se dedica a la venta de carbón, invertirá su dinero en la compra de carbón al por mayor.

 La señora Zuni López se dedica a la venta de sillas de madera e invertirán su dinero en la compra de madera para la elaboración de las sillas.

 La señora Geronima López se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescantes, invertirá su dinero en la compra de esa mercadería.

 La señora Andrea Vega se dedica a la venta de artículos de cotillón, invertirá su dinero en la compra de esa mercadería.

 La señora Jorgelina Giménez se dedica a venta de comestible, invertirá su dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de comidas

 La señora Alejandra S. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá su dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de comidas.

 La señora Clotilde López se dedica la a venta de sillas de madera y invertirá su dinero en la compra maderas para la elaboración de las sillas.

 La señora Mirian C. tiene una despensa y invertirá su dinero en la compra de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise or supplies for their businesses / compra de mercaderias para sus negocios

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Despite her state of health and the difficult times she has been through, Francisca’s perseverance and tenacity have paid off. She is doing well and today faces the future with a lot of optimism. For several years now she has been in the business of selling clothing on credit in the administrative offices of various organisations. Her customers then make regular payments.

Currently Francisca is trying to overcome the problem of her poor state of health so she can move forward. For this reason she is asking for a loan of 300 soles to buy some more clothing; this will allow her to increase her income. Please help Francisca to secure a better life for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La perseverancia y constancia D. Francisca a pesar su estado D. salud y D. los momentos difíciles que le ha tocado vivir, sigue en pie, y hoy mira con mucho optimismo el futuro, más aun porque ella emprenD. durante varios años el negocio D. la venta D. prendas D. vestir al crédito, que ofrece personalmente en las oficinas administrativas D. diferentes entidades para luego cobrarlas en cuotas.

En la actualidad Francisca vence las barreras D. su delicado estado D. salud para seguir adelante es por ello que solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles que le permitirá poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Apoya a Francisca a seguir adelante.

loans.use: To increase her income by buying a larger quantity of clothing to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Cecilia is a widow with six children. The greatest challenges she has faced in life are losing her husband and two of her daughters and watching her son fall sick with a mental illness. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for a loan to help the remaining children and care for her ill son. Since joining GHAPE, she has taken and repaid six loans. With her previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, groundnuts, and yams.

Given this loan, Cecilia plans to buy manure, seedlings, and more land for crop cultivation. She will also pay for labor to assist with clearing new land. She hopes this investment will expand her farm and increase her profits, in turn allowing her to better provide for her family, including her sick son. She also intends on opening a savings account for herself to save some profit for future use. She loan will be repaid in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months after the disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, manure, and more land; to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Sousa

texts.pt:
Sousa L. is 46 years old. He is married and he had 6 children. The oldest one is 26 and the others are 21, 13, 11, 8 and 1 year old respectively. The are all in school except for the youngest one. Besides his sons and daughters, he also supports his mother and nephews that live with her by sending money and food. Sousa went to school until the 8th grade and because of his family situation he had to start working at an early age to cover the expenses, worse yet, there were no evening classes available at that time. Sousa worked for a pottery company in Mozambique that awarded him in 1981 with a 3-year scholarship in Cuba. He still receives pension payments from that company. He lives in his own home. In 1989, Sousa built an iron shop that later had to be passed on to his ex-wife when they were divorced. Sousa is now self-employed. Since 1999 he has been running a restaurant he built with his own resources. The restaurant opens at 8:00am and closes at 9:00pm; it has 3 employees. He learned the skills needed on his own when he realized that his salary was not enough to pay for his family´s needs. The best selling dish is pork meat which goes for 80,00mt and costs him 45,00mt. His monthly income is 12000,00mt and from that amount he saves 3500,00mt. This is his second loan request in his life and first through Kiva. The first loan was in the amount of 10000,00mt given by BPD (People´s Development Bank) and it was used to build the iron shop his ex-wife now owns. The second loan will be used to purchase a variety of products for the restaurant, thus, increasing sales. In the future, with help from other loans, Sousa intends to open up a butcher´s shop to sell meat and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sousa L. tem 46 ano de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos sendo de 26 anos de idade o primeiro, 21 o segundo, 13 o terceiro, 11 o quarto, 8 o quinto e um ano o sexto. Todos ainda estudam excepto o menor de todos. Para além dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mae e seus sobrinhos que vive com a sua mae enviando dinheiros ou generos alimenticios. Sousa estudou até Oitava Classe e por situação familiar teve que começar a trabalhar muito novo para sustentar a familia e como na era nao tinhas escolas que davam aulas de noite. Sousa trabalhou na ceramica de Moçambique empresa que lhe deu bolsa para estudar em Cuba em 1981 por tres anos, empresa que até hoje se benificia de uma pensao. Vive numa casa própria. Em 1989 Sousa construiu uma ferragem qual teve que deixar com sua primeira esposa, quando se divorciaram. Sousa trabalha a conta própria, onde desde 1999 explora um estabelecimento (Restaurante) construído por fundos próprios o Restaurante abre as 8:00h e fecha as 21:00h e tem 3 empregados. Aprendeu o trabalho por inciativa própria quando viu que o salario não respondia as necessidades da casa. O prato com mais saída é o acompanhado com carne de Porco que vende por 80,00mt meticais qual lhe custa 45,00mt. Tem uma receita mensal de 12000,00mt e poupa 3500,00mt. Este é o segundo emprestimo na vida e primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt contraído no BPD( banco popular de desenvolvimento) valor que usou para construção da ferragem que deixo com a sua primeira esposa. O segundo usara para adquirir produtos diversos para o restaurante aumentando assim as vendas. Sousa pretende futuramente com ajuda dos empréstimo abrir um talho para vende de carne e expandir o seu negocio.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his Restaurant

loans.name: Fri Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mama Fri Elizabeth M. was born in 1948. She is a widow and mother of eight children. She has been a member of GHAPE for four years now. She was motivated by some members to join the organization after her husband’s death. When her husband died, his maltreated her and took away some of her husband’s belongings which were meant to provide for her and her children. Being a mother of eight, it is difficult to single handedly take care of the children.

Since becoming a member of GHAPE, she has successfully managed and repaid loans amounting to $270. She has also been able to take care of her childrens' education and provide for their basic needs.

Given this loan, Mama Elizabeth plans to rear fowl and pigs. She will also begin to buy and sell palm oil as well as tend to her cassava farm. The profit from this loan will be used to help educate her children, pay for their school fees, provide for basic needs, and to deal with emergencies such as hospital bills. She believes her business is going to succeed because she has been engaged in farming and livestock rearing for a long time. Additionally, the demand for palm oil is high since it is produced locally and is cheaper than other cooking oils in Cameroon.

She will repay the loan in 18 months. The first repayment will be four months after the date of disbursement.

loans.use: to farm cassava; raise pigs and fowl; buy and sell palm oil

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The group consists of 17 women who work and function in an environment of companionship, harmony, respect and solidarity. They value the help and service of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya in supporting their causes. They are women who work to help their households make headway and improve the quality of life for their children and all their family members.

The group members dedicate themselves to selling food, coal, cleaning supplies, crafts, etc. The loans they are requesting will be used to purchase the items they sell (sugar, yerba, thread, cleaning supplies, coal, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité compuesto por 17 mujeres que trabajan y se desenvuelve en un ambiente de compañerismo, donde reina la armonía, el respeto y la solidaridad.

El comité valora la función y el servicio que brinda la Fundación Paraguaya al apoyarlas, son mujeres que trabajan para sacar adelante sus hogares y ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y el de todos los miembros de su familia.

Las señoras se dedican a la venta de comestible, venta carbón, productos de limpieza, artesanías, venta de leche, etc. Los préstamos que solicitan serán utilizados para compra de azúcar, yerba, hilos, productos de limpiezas, carbón, etc.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, yerba, thread, cleaning supplies, coal, etc. / para compra de azúcar, yerba, hilos, productos de limpiezas, carbón, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina has always been very dedicated to improving the economic situation of her family. In the community where she lives she works in the fabrication of bricks, an activity she grew up knowing about. She has already been working in her factory for 9 years and plans to continue working for many more years which is why she is applying for a loan of 2000 soles to increase her working capital. Through this she will improve the well being of her family and cover the educational expenses of her 3 children. Help Catalina to continue working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Catalina siempre ha estado muy decidida a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. En la comunidad donde ella vive se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos, y ella creció conociendo esta labor. Es así, que ya lleva 9 años de intenso trabajo en su fábrica y con la mentalidad de seguir trabajando por muchos años más, por ello solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para incrementar el capital de trabajo de su fábrica y de este modo ir mejorando el bienestar de su familia y cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus 3 hijos. Apoya a Doña Catalina a seguir esforzándose.

loans.use: Increase the capital of her brick factory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Francisca Julia

texts.es:
Francisca is a very hard working woman who has always watched over the well being of her family. For the past 6 years Francisca has taken advantage of an important resource that her land has, the clay with allows her to make bricks. For this she is requesting a loan of 600 soles to invest it in the purchase of raw materials for her brick factory. Your support for Francisca’s loan will help her to significantly improve her factory.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha velado por el bienestar D. su familia. DesD. hace 6 años Francisca aprovecha un recurso importante que tiene en su terreno, la tierra arcillosa, que le permite fabricar ladrillos. Para ello, en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para invertirlos en la compra D. insumos para su fabrica D. ladrillos. Tu aporte para el préstamo D. Francisca la ayudará a impulsar significativamente su fabrica.

loans.use: To buy inputs to continue her brick production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedonio

texts.es:
Mercedonio lives in San Ignacio, Paraguay, and is married with two young daughters. He dedicates himself to selling articles of clothing and general footwear. He acquires his merchandise in his hometown and in the surrounding areas of Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito, etc., with the help of a vehicle. His wife, Eva Rodríguez, helps him with this in San Ignacio, and they hope the activity will help their daughters' education and their family's well-being.

Mercedonio is requesting a loan for the purchase of jackets, athletic footwear and wool jerseys specifically because they are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Mercedonio D. P., reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, casado, tiene 2 hijas menores; se dedica a la venta artículos de ropería y zapatería en general. El reparto de sus mercaderías lo realiza por nuestra ciudad y las zonas de Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito etc. para lo cual cuenta con un vehiculo.

Su esposa, Eva Rodríguez, lo ayuda en el reparto por la ciudad de San Ignacio, mediante esta actividad que posee el Sr. Mercedonio sus hijas pueden acceder a la educación de nivel medio y el bienestar de su familia.

Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de camperas, calzados deportivos, tricotas de lanas específicamente debido a que posee mucha demanda en esta época D. año.

loans.use: Purchase jackets, wool jerseys and athletic footwear / Compra de camperas, tricotas de lana, calzados deportivos.

loans.name: Mercedonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Mercedonio D. P., reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, casado, tiene 2 hijas menores; se dedica a la venta artículos de ropería y zapatería en general. El reparto de sus mercaderías lo realiza por nuestra ciudad y las zonas de Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito etc. para lo cual cuenta con un vehiculo.

Su esposa, Eva Rodríguez, lo ayuda en el reparto por la ciudad de San Ignacio, mediante esta actividad que posee el Sr. Mercedonio sus hijas pueden acceder a la educación de nivel medio y el bienestar de su familia.

Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de camperas, calzados deportivos, tricotas de lanas específicamente debido a que posee mucha demanda en esta época D. año.

loans.use: Compra de camperas, tricotas de lana, calzados deportivos.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a young mother who works together with her husband for a common objective, the well being of their young daughter who is the fruit of their great love. This is why each day they share the tasks in the small quarry where they produce bricks. This quarry is rented and their goal is to have their own quarry so that they can continue working hard. Elena is asking for a loan of 1200 soles that will help them to establish their business and improve the infrastructure of their house. Help Elena to advance in her honorable work.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Elena es una joven madre de familia que junto a su esposo trabajan por un objetivo en común, el bienestar de su pequeña hija, fruto del gran amor que se tienen, por lo que diariamente comparten las tareas en una pequeña cantera donde fabrican ladrillos. Esta cantera es arrendada, y su meta es poder tener su propia cantera para lo cual siguen trabajando arduamente. Elena solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles que les servirá para implementar su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Apoya a Elena a seguir adelante con su trabajo honrado.

loans.use: To increase her business' capital and improve her home's infrastructure

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Janette Lidia

texts.es:
Janette has always had the work ethic that has allowed her to be independent and overcome moments of economic crisis. Her initiative and risks have allowed her to be recognized as one of the best weavers and as a craft expert in her neighborhood and this has permitted her to obtain work in weaving on a large scale from different businesses. She also makes crafts of all types of cloth with a sewing machine that she has in her house, and this is how she has worked since her youth to be able to support herself and now support her two young daughters who give her the force every day to move forward and she will continue working with this same enthusiasm This is why she is now applying for a loan of 1500 soles as working capital. Suport Janette to work for the success of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Janette siempre ha tenido ese hábito de trabajo que le permite ser independiente y superar los momentos de crisis económica, su iniciativa y riesgos le han permitido ser reconocida como una de las mejores tejedoras y experta en manualidades de su barrio y esto le ha permitido obtener trabajo de tejidos a gran escala para diferentes empresas, también elabora manualidades de todo tipo en telas con una máquina de coser que tiene en su casa, es así que ella trabaja desde su juventud para poder solventarse y ahora solventar a sus 2 pequeñas hijas que le dan fuerzas cada día para seguir adelante y con esos mismos ánimos ella seguirá trabajando. Por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles como capital de trabajo. Apoya a Janette a trabajar por el éxito de su familia.

loans.use: To increase her raw materials to be able to continue making handicrafts.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio is 64 years old, is married to Iluminada, and has children who no longer depend on them economically.

Eligio is a very hard-working man who has set up a small grocery store and also earns money from basic wooden rooms he has built on the patio of his house, which he rents for low prices.

He is asking for a loan to improve these structures; to refurbish the rooms and to make them more comfortable. The walls are made of wood and with a new investment they will be made of brick. Then the people who rent them will have more security and therefore the cost could be increased and in that way more income earned.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eligio, tiene 64 años, es casado con la señora Iluminada, tienen hijos mayores que ya no dependen económicamente de ellos.

Eligio es un señor muy trabajador tiene montado una pequeña despensa, además obtiene ingresos por renta, ya que tiene construido piezas rudimentarias de madera en el patio de su casa, el cual alquila a bajos costos.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para mejorar dichas construcciones, pues va a refaccionar sus piezas y así ofrecer mayor comodidad. Actualmente las paredes son de maderas y con la nueva inversión, ya va a ser de materiales (ladrillos). Entonces los inquilinos tendrán mayor seguridad en las adquisiciones de sus comodidades y por ende el costo va a aumentar y así lograr mejores ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials: bricks, cement and others.

loans.name: Ingrid Giovanna

texts.es:
Ingrid has taken advantage of the different opportunities that life has presented to her to the maximum for the well being of her 2 children who are her reason for living and also because of her desire to feel like an active woman. This is why she decided to rent a storefront and open a call center, which brings her the satisfaction of independent work. Her desire is to continue implementing it and in the near future open a candy business, and meanwhile she continue working hard and consolidating her family’s economic situation. In this opportunity she request of loan of 800 soles to buy calling cards and virtual recharges that she will then re-sell in her call center. Act in solidarity with the credit that Ingrid is requesting for the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Las diversas oportunidades que se presentan en la vida de Ingrid han sido aprovechadas al máximo por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos que son su razón de vivir y también por el deseo de sentirse ella misma una mujer activa. Es así que decide arrendar un local y abrir un locutorio, el cual le trae las satisfacciones de un trabajo independiente. Su deseo es seguir implementándolo y en un futuro próximo incrementar un negocio de confitería, mientras tanto ella seguirá forjando y consolidando la economía de su familia. En esta oportunidad ella solicita un préstamo de 800 soles para comprar tarjetas telefónicas y recargas virtuales que luego seguirá comercializándolas en su cabina. Se parte solidaria en el crédito que solicita Ingrid para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To increase the size of her call center and buy inputs for telephone service.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Limpia

texts.es:
Limpia is married to Bernardo, and they have three young children who are devoted exclusively to their studies. Limpia travels to sell clothes. She started the business with the support of her husband. Bernardo is a professional mechanic and has been in this industry for a long time.

People in the area are very fond of both of them as they are both very hard-working and helpful. The loan Limpia is looking for is to cover the costs of some client's orders, asshe sells in cash and on credit. This is the reason why she needs a constant injection of capital in order to increase her sales.

As her children are young she continually needs income to support them and in this way help them to become professionals. According to what she tells us, her children are very studious but education is very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Limpia es casada con el señor Benardo, tienen tres hijos menores quienes se dedican exclusivamente en el estudio. La señora Limpia se dedica en el ramo de venta ambulante de prendas de vestir. Ella inicio el negocio con el apoyo de su marido, pues, el señor Benardo es mecánico profesional y se dedica en el ramo desde hace tiempo.

Ambas personas son muy apreciadas en la zona ya que son muy trabajadores, además, muy serviciales. El crédito solicitado por la señora es para cubrir algunos pedidos de sus cliente, ya que la política de venta es al contado y a crédito, razón por el cual necesita de una inyección constante de capital y así poder aumentar sus ingresos

Como sus hijos son menores ella necesita de esos ingresos para poder apoyarles constantemente y así lograr que sean profesionales pues, según nos comenta, sus hijos son muy estudiosos, pero la educación es muy cara.

loans.use: To purchase jeans of different sizes and colours for both men and women.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman is a dynamic young man with a desire to succeed. At 26 years old he has started up an computer institute. He has several computers, but needs a small injection of capital in order to increase the quantity of computers and in this way also increase the number of students. This Institute is recognised by the Minister of Education and Culture of our country, which gives the qualification that people who study there receive more worth.

He is a professional in the area of Information Technology, and aims to qualify his fellow townspeople in this area because in the world of today it is a necessary tool in any profession. His success would not only be monetary profit but also help to eliminate underemployment.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

Guzmán es un joven dinámico y con ganas de superación, hoy a sus 26 años ya tiene montado un instituto de informática, tiene varias computadoras, pero necesita de una pequeña inyección de capital para ir aumentando la cantidad de computadoras y así sucesivamente aumentar la cantidad de alumnos. Este Instituto esta reconocido por el Ministerio de Educación y Cultura de nuestro país, lo que hace valido el título que reciban las personas que estudian es su Instituto.

El es un profesional en el área de Ingeniería Informática, tiene como meta capacitar en dicha área a sus compueblanos porque en el día de hoy es una herramienta muy necesaria para cualquier profesión. Y su logro sería no solamente el lucro sino eliminar el sub - empleo.

loans.use: Purchase of three computers

loans.name: Margarita Flor

texts.es:
Margarita is a young mother of a three year old girl. She has a knack for sales, and she decided to start selling cheese and meat in the capital over the weekends. Margarita has been doing that for a year now, and that has allowed her to cover all the expenses for her teacher license. She is asking for a loan of 1000 soles so that she can buy more merchandise. Support Margarita so that she can continue improving herself.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita es una joven madre de una pequeña de 3 años de edad, muy hábil para las ventas, ella decidió incursionar en el mundo de la venta de queso y carne que lleva los fines de semana a la ciudad capital, con esta labor, Margarita ya lleva 1 año, y le ha permitido financiar económicamente los tramites de su titulación como profesora. En esta oportunidad ella solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles que invertirá en la compra de su mercadería. Apoya a Margarita a continuar adelante en el camino de la superación.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Moses Tata

texts.en:
Moses was born in 1978 and is not married. He has encountered in many challenges in life such as ill health, the death of his father, and being a school dropout. Life has been very difficult for him. Death, poverty, and sickness are some of the things he hates thinking about.

In 2005, Moses became a member of GHAPE and borrowed his first loan of $40. He managed the loan well and repaid it successfully. The profit he obtained helped him to expand his farm and pay for medical fees.

Moses is convinced his business will succeed because he has experience and only a few people in his area have an oil press. Moses’ activities will help the community to process their oil. Manure from his pigs will also be used to improve agriculture in his community. Moses will use the profits to improve the standard of living in his family.

Given this loan, he plans to restructure his oil press and pig pen, as well as buy four bags of feed. Part of the money will also be used for pig medication. He will start repayment four months after the date of disbursement.

loans.use: to buy of piglets and restructure his oil press

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa is a very hard-working person survives with lots of effort. She is a seamstress who has a workshop in her home.

She is a single mother, and has raised her 3 children with lots of dedication and effort. These days they are professionals and with the work they have found they help their mother, who always took care of them.

Eloisa's clientele formed thanks to the quality of her work and the responsibility with which she approaches her commitments to her clients.

She is very well known for her honesty and her responsibility in the work she does. She is also very dedicated to her commercial obligations, as on other occasions when we have had the pleasure of working with her by granting her loans she repaid them punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Eloisa es una persona muy trabajadora que salio a delante con mucho esfuerzo, es costurera tiene un taller de en su domicilio.

Es madre soltera, crió a sus 3 hijos con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, estos hoy en día son profesionales y con el trabajo que realizan ayudan a la mamá que siempre se esmero por ellos.

Ella es costurera, tiene una clientela formada gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos y con la responsabilidad con que encara siempre sus compromisos para con la clientela.

Ella es muy conocida por su honestidad y su responsabilidad en el trabajo que realiza. También es muy cumplida con sus obligaciones comerciales ya que en otras ocasiones ya tuvimos el gusto de trabajar con ella otorgándole créditos que pago con puntualidad.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
Maria is married with three children, she lives in a well known neighbourhood of this city. She has a well-stocked grocery store that she runs with a lot of effort and with the help of her husband the business stays afloat.

Her children help her with house work so that she can look after her business better. Her husband drives a small bus and in this way helps his spouse. Maria deals with the household expenses and those of her children, and uses what her husband earns to pay the other bills and buy things for their home.

She is a very hard-working person and has shown herself to be very responsible with financial commitments. She is looking for a new loan to buy merchandise and in this way to increase her business with their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria esta Casada con 3 hijos, ella vive en un barrio muy conocido de esta ciudad. Tiene una despensa muy bien surtida que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido salieron adelante.

Los hijos le ayudan en las tareas de la casa para que ella pueda cuidar mejor el negocio. Su marido hoy día trabaja como taxista en el micro centró y así ayuda a la esposa. María se encarga de los gastos de la casa y los hijos, con lo que gana su marido pagan otras cuentas y compran algunas cosas para la casa.

Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y demuestra ser responsable con sus compromisos financieros. Hoy ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para adquirir mercaderías y de este modo aumentar sus ingresos con sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of rice flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah was born in 1955. He is married and a father of five children. Since childhood, he has faced many obstacles in life because his parents were poor and could not send him to school after grade seven. Instead he began doing odd jobs in the neighborhood to take care of himself and his younger siblings.

He has decided that his children should not suffer from poverty like he has. With this goal, he joined GHAPE 2002. He has borrowed and repaid loans amounting to $500. He invested these loans in fattening pigs and rearing fowl for sale. The profits from these loans provided for the educational needs of his children. He also purchased a piece of land and built the foundation for a three-room house. He is very proud of what he has been able to accomplish with GHAPE’s help and is presently the treasurer of his GHAPE centre.

Given this loan, Zacariah plans to buy nails, slabs, pigs, and piglets. He will also expand the enclosure for his pigs. He wants to concentrate mostly on pig farming because will generate the most income. The demand for pigs and piglets is high in his community. He believes his business will be successful because the piglet he purchased with his first loan is still producing more piglets. He has had a lot of experience in this field, has the land to rear the animals, and has a farm which produces enough food for the animals to feed on. The GHAPE trainings are going to help his business succeed because he is going to the skills he learned into practice.

He plans to repay this loan in 24 months with the first repayment beginning four months after disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, nails, piglets as well as pay for labour

loans.name: Mary Ngwe

texts.en:
Mary Ngwe N. was born in 1947. She is a widow and mother of eight children. Her nightmare came true when her husband died, leaving her alone with the children. She is very hardworking. She has been farming crops like cassava since she was eight because her father died and she was unable to continue her education. She has struggled since the death of her husband, since her brother-in-law claimed almost all the property her husband left for her and the children.

Mary became a member of GHAPE three years ago. Since then, she has undergone training and taken loans for up to $400. She invested these loans in rearing fowl and pigs and the cultivation of crops including cassava, plantains, and beans. The profit from these loans were used to educate her children and satisfy basic needs for her family such as clothing and food.

If given this loan, Mary plans to invest it in farming cassava, rearing pigs and fowl, as well as operating a small restaurant. She is convinced that her business is going to succeed because she has livestock and business training. There is high demand for meat in her community and she is well known for producing the best fowl and pigs in her community. She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: to farm cassava and rear pigs and fowl

loans.name: Feliciana Judith

texts.es:
Feliciana is a young mother and a professional at the same time. Her vocation as an early childhood teacher goes beyond this role as she understands that she forms these young students for their entire lives. She is very dedicated to her family and loves her work for which she is well prepared as she applies her knowledge by creating educational materials from plastic molded crafts. The quality with which she produces them allows her to improve her work each day which is why her orders have increased. In this occasion Feliciana needs a loan of 1000 soles that will allow her to obtain the raw material for the elaboration of her educational materials. Help Feliciana to move forward with her success.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Feliciana es una joven madre de familia y buena profesional a la vez, su vocación como profesora del nivel inicial trasciende más allá, pues entiende que ella forma a sus pequeños alumnos para toda la vida. Ella es muy dedicada a su familia y ama su trabajo para el cual está preparada, pues aplica sus conocimientos elaborando de manera independiente todo tipo de materiales didácticos a base de corrospum, la calidad con que ella produce le permite mejorar cada día sus trabajos por lo cual sus pedidos van en aumento. En esta ocasión Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que le servirá para obtener la materia prima para la elaboración de sus materiales didácticos. Apoya a Feliciana a continuar adelante con su éxito.

loans.use: To increase raw materials in order to be able to make crafts.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Eloiza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Eloiza es a woman with a lot of energy for work; the passing of years doesn't stop her. She spent 15 years working as a teacher for her children, who have turned out to be good and independent people. Following her subsequent search for opportunities to stay active, she returned to her hobby of selling cosmetics. This work is now her livelihood, which enables her to keep herself, and Eloiza is applying for a loan of $700 to invest in the purchase of more cosmetics. Please support Eloiza in her efforts.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Eloiza es una mujer de mucha energía para trabajar, para ella no es un obstáculo el paso de los años, tras haber sido profesora de niños por más de 15 años en un programa de estimulación temprana y al cuidado de sus hijos que hoy son personas de bien e independientes, ella buscó las salidas para mantenerse activa, es así que retomó una de sus aficiones, el de vender productos de belleza, ahora esta labor es la forma de vida que le permite auto sostenerse. Eloiza solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles que invertirá para comprar más productos de belleza. Apoya a Eloiza a seguir adelante con su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is a young mother who, together with her husband, has looked for opportunities to enable her to keep her family, which currently consists of Eugenia, her husband and a daughter. This was the the driving force behind the couple's decision to sell forage wholesale. Eugenia and her husband rent farming land so that they can harvest the forage and then distribute it to the market closest to their home. They also sell the forage to their neighbors. Their goal is to increase their business and so they are applying for a loan of $350. Please help Eugenia to bring her business forward.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia es una joven madre de familia que junto a su esposo han buscado opciones de desarrollo que les permita poder sostener a su familia, por ahora ellos tienen una niña. Es así que optaron por dedicarse a la venta de pastos al por mayor, Eugenia y su esposo alquilan terrenos de cultivo para poder cosechar el pasto y luego distribuirlo en el mercado más cercano a su casa, también lo venden a sus vecinos, su meta es crecer cada vez, solicitando un préstamo de 1000 soles. Apoya a Eugenia a seguir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Capital increase for her business.

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.en:
The women of the Flor D. Mayo Group have worked together for nearly five years and are now requesting their eighth loan from Friendship Bridge. Of the seven women in the group, two sew pants and shirts, two embroider traditional blouses, two buy clothing in bulk for resale, and one grows and sells vegetables and chickens. All of the women sell their products in the local market in Santa Lucia, and some travel to nearby Nahualá to have access to a larger market.

These women range in age from 26 to 54 years old and all but one of them are married and have children. About half of them have had at least a little education, although none has completed more than the sixth graD.. Those who have not had any formal education cannot read or write, and sign all paperwork with a fingerprint. Regardless of how much education each woman has had, every one of them has maD. her children’s education a top priority. All of those with school-age children are currently able to pay for the registration fees and school supplies needed to send them to school.

When asked why they are seeking loans, they enthusiastically say that, more than anything, it’s for their children. Before they had access to credit, many were unable to pay the small costs associated with sending their children to school. Now, with the help of loans, they are able to work more and fight for a better future for their children. More directly, those working in clothing-related industries will use their loans to purchase cloth, thread, patterns and clothes in bulk, while the woman selling vegetables and chickens will use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and more chickens.

Several of the women also report that, in addition to being able to expand their businesses and send their children to school, having access to credit has enabled them to make improvements on their houses, such as getting better roofs or buying more cinder blocks to have more solid walls. When asked what they like most about working together in the Flor D. Mayo group, they all agreed that it is a great group because everyone always pays on time and there is a lot of trust among the members. They also report that they have found the informal education programs that Friendship Bridge offers at the regular group meetings to be very helpful. Not only have they learned basic business administration and money management skills, but several say that their favorite lesson of all was learning about natural medicines such as plants, some of which they already had on hand although they never knew the benefit they could proviD..

When asked about their dreams, these women report that more than anything they hope their children won’t suffer as they have suffered. They are “fighting” so that their children can advance, receive good educations, and someday be professionals with more security and a higher quality of living.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, patterns and clothing in bulk and buy seeds, fertilizer and chickens

loans.name: Dalias Santa Lucia Group

texts.en:
The women of the Dalias Santa Lucia Group are from the municipality of Santa Lucia in the department of Sololá. Santa Lucia is a small, primarily rural community, where the majority of residents work in agriculture or weaving traditional Guatemalan clothing. The women in this group range in age from 19 to 53 years old and are quite modest and shy. All of them have children and all of their children of school age are currently in school, which is quite an accomplishment and something they are all very proud of. About half of them have had at least a little education, although none has completed more than the sixth grade. Those who have not had any formal education cannot read or write, and sign all paperwork with a fingerprint.

The women in this group have a variety of businesses: three work in sewing clothing, one works in embroidery, one buys and sells clothing, one sells thread for embroidery, and one has a little store where she sells daily consumption items such as beans, noodles, rice and sugar. This group has worked with Friendship Bridge for nearly four years and been very successful in paying back five loans. They report that the loans have really helped them expand their businesses and they will be using this next loan to purchase more cloth and thread and more inventory so they have more to sell, and therefore potential for more income.

When asked what they like most about working together in the Dalias group, they say that they are all neighbors and it’s great to be able to work together to fight for a better life. With their businesses and the help of loans, it’s no longer just their husbands working, they are now able to work equally hard and contribute to their families’ incomes. These women dream of expanding their businesses and being able to provide good educations for their children so they can be successful in life. Each loan they receive from Friendship Bridge and Kiva helps them get just a little bit closer to achieving these dreams.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread and clothing in bulk and buy inventory for a little store

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila is a humble family woman, whose most important motivation is her children. She learned the business of selling forage from her father when she was a child. Her father was a struggling farmer, who used to carry out this work in order to keep his family, and it is now up to Cirilia to keep her family of four children so that they can continue on the path of development. Cirila purchases the forage wholesale and then sells it to her neighbors. In this way she generates revenue, which enables her to provide the necessities for her children. So that Cirila can continue on this path, she is applying for a loan of $350. Please support Cirila so that she can provide a better future for her children.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Cirila es una humilde madre de familia cuyo valor más importante son sus hijos, ella emprendió el negocio de venta de pastos, una ocupación que tenía desde niña cuando su padre, un agricultor esforzado, realizaba estas tareas para sostener a su familia y hoy le toca a Cirila ser ese sostén para que sus 4 hijos puedan estar en el camino constante de la superación. Cirila compra el pasto al por mayor y luego lo vended a sus vecinos, de esa manera se genera ingresos que le permiten y así sostener las necesidades de sus hijos. Para que Cirila continúe adelante está solicitando un préstamo de 1000 soles. Apoya a Cirila a que siga forjando un futuro mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase forage.

loans.name: Comite Esperanza Y Alegría Group

texts.es:
This committee, called “Esperanza y Alegría” (Hope and Joy), was formed when Adelaida R., who had previously been a member of another committee, contacted her neighbors and friends in the Barrio Fátima de Presidente Franco.

The committee is made up of 20 women who are almost all from the same area. Their businesses are: clothing sales, food sales, and cosmetics sales. They also work in house cleaning and have a fixed weekly or monthly income in addition to their extra businesses, which allows them to have a larger income to help out with the family expenses.

The women request loans of 500.00 to 1,100,000.00 Guaranies (Paraguayan monetary unit), each.

The loans are a very important method of investment for their businesses, since in this way they are able to expand and increase their sales. The loan that they are requesting will be used to buy: clothing, items for the home such as jars, trays, and rugs, ingredients necessary for making their foods, costume jewelry, fabrics, threads, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité llamado “Esperanza y Alegría” fue la señora Adelaida R. ex integrantes de otro comité, quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en el Barrio Fátima de Presidente Franco.

El comité esta constituido por 20 señoras casi todas de la misma zona las señoras tienen actividades como venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos y también realizan trabajo como limpiadora de casas y cuentan con un ingreso fijo semanal o mensual además de sus actividades extras, esto le permite tener un mayor ingreso para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.

Las señoras retiran un crédito cada una de entre 500.000 y 1.100.000 guaraníes cada una.

Los créditos son una forma muy importante de inversión en sus negocios, ya que así logran expandir más el negocio incrementando sus ventas. El crédito que solicitan será para comprar ropas, artículo para el hogar como jarras, bandejas, alfombras, además ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus comidas, bijouterie, telas, hilos, etc.

loans.use: To buy clothing, items for the home such as jars, trays, and rugs,  ingredients necessary for making their foods, costume jewelry, fabrics, threads, etc.

loans.name: Comite Mujeresparaguayas Group

texts.es:
This committee is located in the area of the 9th kilometer of Acaray de Ciudad del Este. It was formed when a neighbor from the area told the women that Fundación Paraguaya has a group credit program and also does trainings for small business owners interested in getting ahead in life.

The committee is made up of 15 women who, in addition to being home makers and heads of family, are working in order to bring home to their families the basic necessities of food, clothing, and education. Their various business are: clothing sales, food sales, small grocery stores, fruit and vegetable sales, cosmetic sales, silverware, plastic wares, and jewelry sales.

Additionally, they participate in community activities and work to have a small amount of savings. Now they are requesting a new loan that would allow them to buy new merchandise and materials. These ladies have good prior references.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité pertenece a la zona del km. 9 Acaray de Ciudad del Este y se formo gracias a que un vecino de la zona comunico a las señoras que Fundación Paraguaya tenia un programa de créditos grupales y que al mismo tiempo realizaban capacitaciones para microempresarias, deseosas de salir adelante.

El comité esta constituido por 15 señoras ellas, además de ser amas de casa y cabeza de familia, trabajan para poder brindar a sus familias las necesidades básicas de comida, ropa y estudio. Las distintas actividades son: venta de ropas, comidas, despensas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de cosméticos, cubiertos, venta de plásticos, y venta de joyas.

Además ellas realizan actividades comunitarias, y trabajan para tener un pequeño ahorro. Hoy ellas solicitan un nuevo crédito que les permita adquirir nuevas mercaderías e insumos para vender. Estas señoras poseen buenas referencias anteriores.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, threads, breads, soft drinks, sweets, cooking utensils, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio is married to Ninfa López and they have four grown children, all of whom are studying in the university. Ninfa is a home maker who also works in house cleaning. Additionally, she oversees her children’s education. Dionisio sells charcoal in small bags up to one kilo in size.

The children help their father with packaging of the charcoal; Dionisio sells it on the street. The family’s goal is to be able to buy a vehicle with which to sell their merchandise. They have a good customer base built up. They have had this business for the past 6 years and opened it with capital that they obtained by selling a piece of land.

The loan that Dionisio is requesting is for buying merchandise that will allow him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionisio esta casado con la Sra. Ninfa López y tienen cuatro hijos mayores, todos estudian en la universidad. Ninfa es ama de casa y trabaja en la limpieza y con la educación de sus hijos. Dionsio se dedica a la venta de carbón en bolsas pequeñas de hasta un kilo.

Sus hijos le ayudan al padre en el empaquetado del carbón y Dionicio es quien sale a realizar las ventas en forma ambulante. El objetivo de la familia es poder comprar un vehículo para la venta de su mercadería ya que tienen buena clientela formada. Ellos tienen el negocio desde hace 6 años, con un capital que consiguieron al vender un terreno.

El crédito solicita para la compra de mercaderías para su venta y así aumentar su ingreso.

loans.use: To buy bags for charcoal.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es:
Ananías is a widow and has two grown children, both of whom are in the university. She has been a merchant for 10 years. She works all week in order to provide for her family; she is the only one who works since both of her children are studying.

Ananías owns a copetín. A copetín is a place people can go to eat and buy fast food, juices, and soft drinks. She is a dynamic and hardworking person and because of that she has a good customer base.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a variety of merchandise, which would allow her to increase her sales and income from sweets, soft drinks of several brands, natural juices, and mineral water, which are the types of merchandise most-requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ananías es viuda y tiene dos hijos mayores, todos estudian en la universidad. Ella es comerciante desde hace 10 años. Trabaja durante toda la semana para conseguir el sustento de sus hijos, ya que solo ella es la que trabaja; sus hijos se dedican a estudiar.

Ananias posee un copetín. Un copetín es donde la gente puede ir a comer y comprar comidas rápidas, jugos y gaseosas. Ella demuestra ser una persona dinámica, muy dedicada a sus actividades, y es por eso que tiene buena clientela formada.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías varias que le permitirían aumentar su venta y su ingreso como golosinas, gaseosas de distintas marcas, jugos naturales, y agua mineral que son las mercaderías más solicitadas por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, juices, and mineral water.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia is separated and has a young son who is in primary school. She has been a merchant for the past five years. She has a small grocery store located in her house, from which she sells all kinds of basic grocery goods. Her ex-husband helps her every month with a certain amount of money that he sends; their son has a heart condition that requires special care and medication.

Eladia works without rest all week in order to provide for her family and also to look after the education and health of her small son. She is a dynamic person who wants to get ahead in life so that she can give the best to her son. All she wants is to make progress. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to increase her merchandise stock, which will allow her to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Eladia, es separada, y tiene un hijo menor, que estudia en el nivel primario. Ella es comerciante hace 5 años, posee una despensa en donde comercializa todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad, la misma está ubicada en su propio domicilio. Su ex marido le ayuda mensualmente con un monto determinado de dinero que le envía pues el hijo que tienen es enfermo de corazón y requiere de cuidados y medicación especial.

Ella trabaja sin descanso durante toda la semana para conseguir el sustento de su familia y además cuidar de la educación y salud de su pequeño hijo. Elida es una persona dinámica que desea salir adelante, para brindarle a su hijo lo mejor, todo lo que ella desea es progresar. Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para aumentar el stock de su mercadería para poder así incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, and a variety of grocery items.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a young woman who is a widow and the mother of two children. She sells clothing for women and men, among other things.

Gloria has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and her store is located in a busy area. She did some remodeling of the store in order to have the amount of space that she needed.

She comments that sales this winter season sales have gone very well. It is due to this fact that she wants to obtain a greater amount of merchandise. In this way she will be able to meet the high demand that she has this season.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, es una señora joven, viuda y madre de dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, entre otras cosas.

Gloria se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de 10 años y su local comercial se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona, ella realizo refacciones y modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial.
