Gloria, comenta que en esta temporada de invierno el registro de venta es bastante alto. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en esta época del año.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts, t-shirts, slacks, sweaters, jeans, ect.

loans.name: Lelisa

texts.es:
Lelisa is an exemplary and hard-working woman. When she was a child her humble parents taught her how to produce a great variety of delicious bread, an activity which the family was always associated with. Through these long years of hard work, she managed to convert her bakery into her main source of income and thanks to that, she has also managed to provide advanced education to her children, who help her with her work in their spare time.

Lelisa plans to expand her bakery and for that she needs to purchase ingredients wholesale (flour butter, yeast etc.), to avoid passing on the normally increasing prices of these inputs onto her own customers.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Lelisa es una madre ejemplar y muy trabajadora, desde niña, sus humildes padres le enseñaron a elaborar gran variedad de deliciosos panes, actividad con la que su familia siempre se caracterizó. A través de estos largos años de trabajo, logró convertir su panadería en su principal sustento económico, gracias a ello, le brinda a sus hijos, estudios superiores, quienes en sus horas libres la apoyan activamente en su labor. Lelisa tiene planeado seguir creciendo con su panadería, para ello requiere adquirir materia prima al por mayor (harina, manteca, levadura , etc) porque constantemente el precio de estos insumos van en aumento, desfavoreciendo así el costo de la canasta familiar de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the production of bread.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina is a very cheerful woman, who is well-liked in her small home village of Santa Lucia, which she left after the birth of her children, in search of opportunities. She currently lives in the city of Juliaca, where she has a business buying and selling sheepskin, as well as fine local fibres ("Alpaca"). She then sells large quantities of these materials wholesale to a textile company in the city of Arequipa. With the profits resulting from years of hard work, this enterprising and loving mother was finally able to provide a good and safe home to her three children, who are continuing successfully with their secondary education. By increasing the level of investment in her business, Florentina expects that the quality of life for her and her family will increase.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina es una mujer muy alegre y querida en su localidad, desde que les concedió el don de vida a sus queridos hijos decidió abandonar su pueblito natal Santa Lucía, en busca de mejores oportunidades, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que vive en dicha ciudad viene dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de cuero de oveja y fibra de alpaca, luego de juntar una buena cantidad los despacha al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa. Esta emprendedora y amorosa mujer con los beneficios que logró obtener durante estos largos años de trabajo, pudo finalmente ofrecerles un techo propio y seguro a sus 3 hijos, quienes vienen siguiendo con satisfacción sus estudios secundarios; Florentina considera que aumentando su capital de inversión podrá mejorar aun más su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: To increase capital for her business.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.es:
Crescencia G. is 56 years old. She is single and has no children. She opened a grocery store in 2001 in Santa Roa neighborhood where she lives after resigning from another position in the downtown area of Ciudad del Este. Currently she is working exclusively in her store. She shops for items for her business in the neighboring country (Brazil) or in the city market. She needs this loan to purchase supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Crescencia G. cuenta con 56 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. La señora monto una despensa en el Barrio Santa Roa de Ciudad Pdte. Franco donde ella reside.

Su negocio lo tiene desde el año 2001, dicho negocio había emprendido después de renunciar a un trabajo en una casa de negocio en el microcentro de Ciudad del Este .Actualmente ella se dedica exclusivamente a su despensa. Casualmente la señora Crescencia va de compras ya sea en el vecino país (Brasil) o en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Ella está necesitando del crédito para aumentar stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of grain, oil, various kinds of meat, and sugar

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita and her husband Alberto have three children. She is 49 years old and sells pork stew, travelling throughout her neighborhood and others nearby areas. She purchases supplies daily in Brazil, specifically in the city of Foz do Yguazú. She, along with her hardworking family, has run this business since 2004. She will use this loan to purchase supplies needed to run her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita de 49 años, esta casada con Alberto, y tienen 3 hijos. La Señora Margarita se dedica a la venta de puchero de cerdo, su venta lo realiza en forma ambulante por todo el barrio y otros a los que alcanza a cubrir.

La mercadería lo compra diariamente del Brasil específicamente de la ciudad de Foz do Yguazú, pues la misma limita con nuestro país. Desde el año 2004, son una familia muy trabajadoras y luchadoras; el crédito le servirá para aumentar su stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of meat (pork) in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Luisa Valentina

texts.es:
The casseroles which Luisa prepares are a delight to her clients, who are so happy with the service they receive, that they recommend Luisa further. Thanks to this, Luisa has a large number of clients; clients who she would like to offer comfort and good service. Luisa has dedicated herself to this work for more than 20 years, and thanks to her effort during those long years of work she was able to build her own home and offer a proper and safe shelter to her dear children. Her eldest child has already started his own family and decided to support Luisa's talent, by installing cooking equipment and furniture in the restaurant. It's with the hope of starting this business that Luisa is requesting your support.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Los deliciosos potajes que prepara doña Luisa gustan a todos sus asiduos comensales, quienes complacidos por la atención que reciben multiplican sus recomendaciones, gracias a ello doña Luisa goza de gran cantidad de clientes, clientes que al mismo tiempo le hacen un sin fin de solicitudes, y a quienes desea ofrecerles un cómodo y buen servicio. Luisa viene dedicándose a esta labor hace más de 20 años, gracias al esfuerzo de estos largos años de trabajo pudo construir su propia vivienda y ofrecer un techo propio y seguro a sus queridos hijos. El mayor de ellos ya formó su propia familia y decidió apoyarle e implementar el restaurante con utensilios de cocina y algunos muebles, ya que al igual que ella tiene grandes cualidades para la cocina. Con la esperanza de implementar su negocio es que solicita su apoyo.

loans.use: To improve her restaurant's infrastructure.

loans.name: Facunda Primitiva

texts.es:
Facunda comes from a very humble background, and since she was a girl she saw the necessity to work and earn one's own money, and this is why it was hard for her to even finish her primary education. This diligent mother did not want the same for her kids, and so with determination and dedication she managed to dedicate herself to the buying and selling of red meat and giblets, merchandise that she brings in bulk from Rinconada. Through this job she was able to give her kids an education, and they are all now very proud of her. A few years ago Facunda suffered the loss of her life-long companion, her huband. This maD. her very sad, but her kids and grandkids have given her the courage to keep fighting for life. Facunda now wants to achieve her objective of increasing the capital of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Facunda proviene D. una familia muy humilD., desD. niña se vio en la necesidad D. trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos económicos, es por ello que a duras penas pudo concluir sus estudios primarios. Esta diligente madre no deseó que sus queridos hijos pasen por lo mismo, es así que con empeño y entrega logró dedicarse a la compra y venta D. carnes rojas y menudencias, mercadería que lleva al por mayor hacia la mina Rinconada, con este noble oficio logró brindarles educación a sus hijos, quienes actualmente se sienten muy orgullosos D. ella. Hace algunos años, Facunda sufrió la penosa perdida D. su compañero D. toda la vida, su esposo, este hecho la puso muy triste pero sus hijos y nietos le dieron suficiente valor para continuar luchando en la vida, actualmente doña Facunda desea cumplir su objetivo que es aumentar el monto D. su capital.

loans.use: To increase her business' capital/Incrementar el capital de su negocio.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is an industrious and diligent 22 year old woman. Her financial situation did not allow he to complete her education, but she has not lost hope of achieving this dream one day. Since she finished high school, and with support from her family, she decided to rent a small shop and work with leather (making and dying jackets, trousers, shoes etc), a trade that she learnt from her brothers who work in this area too, and that she performs efficiently. Monica would like to actively contribute to the improvement of her familiy's quality of life and she is sure that with this business she will be able to do this. She will invest the sum that she is asking for in the implementation of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, emprendedora y diligente joven de 22 años de edad, sus posibilidades económicas no le permitieron seguir sus estudios superiores pero tampoco pierde las esperanzas de concretar algún día ese gran anhelo, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios y con apoyo de sus familiares decidió alquilar un local y dedicarse a realizar trabajos en cuero (teñido y arreglo de casacas, pantalones, calzados, etc) este oficio que desempeña eficientemente lo aprendió de sus hermanos quienes encuentran en esta actividad su principal sustento. Mónica desea contribuir de manera activa al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia y está segura que a través de este servicio que brinda lo conseguirá. El aporte que solicita lo invertirá en implementar su negocio.

loans.use: To implement her business/Implementar los insumos necesarios para su negocio.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
The “Manos Unidas” (Hands United) Group is comprised of neighbors from the 29 de Agusto neighborhood in the city of Ypane. All of the members are working mothers and are united by this having this in common. Seventeen of the eighteen members are pictured in the photograph above. All members have their own activity and some have full time jobs outside of this work in which case they perform this work during their free time to augment their household incomes. The group has a well established organizational structure and the members get along harmoniously.

The membership has demonstrated its unity on several occasions and are working well together, solving problems at the group level. They have used loans as a way to expand their sales and indicate that the loans have been very helpful in accomplishing this. The are asking for a new loan which will be used for the purchase of various items, the majority of which will be for the raw materials needed for the activities of each member. Some, such as those who operate stores and work in food sales, will purchase items including: meat, sugar, rice, vegetables, dairy products and necessary utensils. Members who work in clothing sales will purchase merchandise to increase the amount and variety of products they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El Comité “Manos Unidas” se formó de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio 29 de Agosto de la ciudad de Ypane. Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que las une ambas cosas. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 17 de las 18 integrantes del comité.

Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comité lleva una organización bien establecida y las relaciones fluyen de manera armoniosa entre todos sus miembros.

Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones, ya sea desarrollando actividades en forma conjunta, como solucionando cualquier inconveniente a nivel grupal.

Ellas utilizan el crédito como medio para expandir sus ventas y manifiestan que les resulta de gran ayuda. Hoy ellas solicitan un nuevo crédito que será invertido en la compra de variados artículos, la mayoría de ellos, materia prima para las actividades de las integrantes del comité. Algunos de estos artículos son: carnes, azúcar, arroz, verduras, lácteos, etc.; estos artículos serán comprados por aquellas señoras que posee despensas, kiosco, copetín, etc. Las personas dedicadas a la venta de comidas utilizarán el crédito para la compra de materia prima y utensilios para su trabajo. Las vendedoras de ropas lo invertirán en la compra de mercaderías de manera a aumentar el stock y su variedad.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing; merchandise for stores, including sugar, milk, meat, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, utensils, rice, fruit, vegetables, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
More than 10 years ago, Ms. Francisca S. started her general store, which she has been developing little by little. It is now the most frequented general store in the area. With the profits from this business, she has been able to build her small home while at the same time support her children’s education. Because of her customers’ demands and suggestions, she sees a need to expand and develop her general store, thus completely satisfying her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más de 10 años doña Francisca viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de abarrotes, bodega que poco a poco fue implementando y que ahora se convirtió en la más concurrida de su localidad. Con los beneficios que obtuvo con este negocio pudo hacer construir su pequeña vivienda y al mismo tiempo apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Por las innumerables solicitudes y sugerencias de sus clientes se ve en la necesidad de ampliar e implementar su bodega para así satisfacer completamente a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of general store

loans.name: Gladys Janeth

texts.es:
Gladys is an industrious and hard-working young woman of 19. Upon finishing high school she decided to move from her native Caracoto and settle in the city of Juliaca. Since then she has come to buy and sell CDs and DVDs, an activity that she started with a lot of enthusiasm and the hope of making a better life for herself. Gladys is currently also buying and selling second hand clothes, as well as her CD business, and she really enjoys it. This young entrepreneur offers her products everyday in the markets in the towns and villages of the city where she lives, and this is why she always has a lot of requests; requests that she will be able to meet with your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Gladys es una hacendosa y laboriosa joven de 19 años de edad, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios decidió abandonar su pueblito natal, Caracoto, y radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces viene dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de CDs y DVDs, actividad que emprendió con mucho entusiasmo e ilusiones de buscar una mejora de su condición de vida. Adicionalmente a esta labor Gladys se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropas de segundo uso, actividad que junto a su negocio de CDs le viene generando mucha satisfacción; esta emprendedora jovencita ofrece sus productos los días de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica es por ello que cuenta con innumerable solicitudes, solicitudes que espera complacer con vuestro generoso aporte.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to meet numerous demands/Incrementar su capital para cumplir son sus numerosos pedidos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Natividad De María Group

texts.es:
The “Natividad de Maria” Group is comprised of a group of neighbors in the San Miguel neighborhood of Guarambaré. This group has demonstrated solidarity and reliability. It is one of the most punctual groups to make repayments. It is at capacity in terms of membership and all members attend the group’s meetings.

All members of the group are working mothers and are united by having this in common. The photograph above shows 18 of the 20 members. Each member has her own activities and some have full time jobs outside of this work in which case they perform this work during their free time to augment their household incomes. This group is well organized and members get along well together. The membership has demonstrated great unity on several occasions when individual members had health issues or family problems which prevented them from making a payment and the other members joined together to help out.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El Comitè “Natividad de Maria” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Guarambaré. Este comité demuestra confianza y la solidaridad. Es uno de los comités que más puntualidad en pagos a demostrado y así como también todas acuden a las reuniones que se realizan para capacitación.

Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que las une ambas cosas. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 18 de las 20 integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comité lleva una organización bien establecida y las relaciones fluyen normalmente entre todas sus miembros.

Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones en que algunas de las integrantes tuvieron problemas de salud y familiares imposibilitándolas de cumplir con algún pago, pero entre todas ayudaron y colaboraron para ayudar.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of merchandise including meat, milk, cheese, eggs, fruit, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, salt, wheat, oil, soft drinks, sweets, fabric, yarn etc. for individual businesses

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex is a young father at 20, and since his daughter was born he has had to undertake many jobs to take care of his wife and daughter. He currently sells second hand artifacts, merchandise that he brings from the city of Tacna and that he sells on foot around the city of Juliaca. As well as this job in his spare time this young father and his wife want to make clothes with the hope that this will get them more income and cement their dream of one day owning their own house. They need to buy raw material (wool) in order to start on this big project.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alex es un joven padre de 20 años, que desde que nació su pequeña niña ha realizado diferentes actividades con el fin de que su esposa e hija no pasen privaciones. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de artefactos de segundo uso, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Tacna y la vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor en sus horas libres este joven padre y esposa desean dedicarse a la confección de prendas de vestir, ellos tienen la esperanza que con ello podrán obtener mejores ingresos y así cristalizar algún día su sueño de poseer su casa propia. Ellos requieren comprar materia prima (lana) para iniciar uno de sus grandes proyectos.

loans.use: To buy raw material to start a new business/Compra de materia prima para iniciar un nuevo negocio.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
This group from the Santa María neighborhood has grown from contact between members and other women from their neighborhood which resulted in correspondingly larger meetings to organize the group. Currently there are 16 working women in the group.

The business conducted by members of this group includes: small shops, beauty shops, food preparation, jewelry and cosmetic sales, tailoring, raising chickens, and glass work. Each group member will receive an equal share of the loan of the total loan amount, which will be used to increase their income by purchasing additional supplies and raw goods such as fabric, yarn, wheat, baked goods, sweets, sugar, drinks, costume jewelry, hair and skin products and other items that are needed in their individual businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Este comité del Barrio Santa María ha surgido por contacto de otras señoras de un comité del mismo barrio, se han realizado las reuniones correspondientes para la conformación, y actualmente el comité esta formado por 16 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: Despensas, Peluquería, Elaboración de Comidas, Venta de Tapper, venta de Cosméticos, Kioscos, Venta de bijouteries, Cría de pollos, Taller de Costura, Peluquería, Vidriería y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 460.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para ampliar sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, harinas, panificados, dulces, azúcar, bebidas en general, joyas de bijouterie, artículos para el cabello, productos para la piel, etc.

loans.use: Purchase wheat, fabric, yarn, baked goods, sweets, sugar, drinks, costume jewelry, hair and skin products and other items that are needed in their individual businesses.

loans.name: Pio

texts.es:
Pío M. is married but so far has no children. He is a small businessman who sells clothing and shoes for men, women and children in addition to various other items. Pío has worked in this field for four years. He also makes deliveries in the area and sells on credit to officials of the local cooperative and to an herbal healer. He has a good clientele in the city market as well. He keeps a good stock of merchandise which allows him to make a good income. He also always works at harvest time, gathering yerba mate (a coffee/tea-like herb) during which time his business is attended to by his wife.

Pío will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise, winter clothing, blankets and other seasonal items to sell. He recommends working with the Paraguayan Foundation as it has been a great help to small business owners who are just beginning to use credit in their operation.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Pío M. está casado y actualmente vive en alquiler pero aun no tienen hijos. El mismo es micro empresario, se dedica a la venta de mercaderías ropas para criaturas, calzados, ropas para caballeros, damas, artículos de bazar, etc.

Cuenta con 4 años de antigüedad en el rubro, no esta demás mencionar que también realiza repartos de mercaderías por la zona y vende a créditos a funcionarios de una Yerbatera y Cooperativa, además posee muy buena clientela lo que le genera la zona del mercado municipal de la ciudad. Posee un buen stock de mercaderías lo que le genera un buen ingreso.

También el cliente suele trabajar en época de zafra de yerba (cosecha) y el negocio entonces es atendido por su cónyuge. El destino del crédito será para la compra de mercaderías, ropas de invierno, frazadas y otros. El cliente recomienda operar con Fundación Paraguaya ya que es una gran ayuda para los microempresarios que están comenzando a trabajar con créditos..

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as winter clothing, blankets and related items

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Her great love for her kids and her desire to see them have professional careers is what is in Lorenza's heart as she is a mother and father to them. For more than 20 years she has been buying and selling alpaca fibre and sheep's wool, merchandise that she gets every day from the markets in different towns and villages in the city where she lives. As well as this she also sells kebabs in the Rinconada mine. Thanks to these two activities she is able to pay for her each one of her kids' educations. Lorenza and her family believe that increasing the amount of capital could considerably improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El inmenso amor que siente por sus hijos y el anhelo de verlos profesionales, es el deseo que cobija en su corazón doña Lorenza, padre y madre para ellos. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de fibra de alpaca y lana de oveja, mercadería que recolecta los días de feria de los distintos pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica y adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la mina Rinconada.Gracias a estas actividades les brinda los estudios a cada uno de sus hijos. Lorenza y su familia consideran que aumentando el monto de su capital podrán mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos.

loans.use: To increase her business' capital/Aumentar el monto de su capital de negocio.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Ms. Nelva M. sells fuel (gasoline and kerosene) on one of the city of Juliaca’s main avenues. She has been in business for over 10 years, during which time she has become popular and preferred by her customers. She is now one of the most important fuel suppliers for urban drivers in the city of Juliaca. Nelva works from the early hours of the day, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has been able to keep her family from want. At this time, this hardworking, 53-year-old mother still has enough strength to keep fighting for her loved ones, so she is requesting a loan of 600 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Nelva vende combustible (gasolina y petróleo) en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad de Juliaca, se dedica a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, en ese período se hizo muy popular y querida por sus clientes, convirtiéndose en una de las proveedoras de combustible más importante de los transportistas urbanos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Nelva trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que siempre puso en su actividad logró mantener sin privaciones a su familia. En esta oportunidad esta trabajadora madre de 53 años sigue teniendo suficientes fuerzas para continuar luchando por los suyos, recurriendo a solicitar un préstamo por el monto de 600 soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Berries is 56 years old and has two children, one of whom is a minor who is not currently going to school because he is not compelled to attend. The other child is studying in a public school and his wife does not live with him. 

Berries provides photography services and he also runs a confectionary from his house.

He has been working with Leon 2000 since 2001 and has had a credit of C$ 3000 Cordobas.  Up to date he has managed 11 past credits with the last one amounting to C$ 10000 Cordobas to secure working capital. His living conditions are good and he lives in his own house. His greatest dream is to have his own photography studio.


Translated from Spanish by Erika LIndig, Kiva Volunteer.






El Señor B. tiene 56 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de ellos menor de edad, que actualmente no esta estudiando ya que el niño no quiere, y el otro que si esta estudiando en un colegio publico, su esposa no vive con él, 
El señor B. se dedica a la actividad de servicios fotograficos, además se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de oro actividad que lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación.
El señor trabaja con fundación leon 2000 desde el año 2001, iniciando con un credito de C$ 3000 córdobas, en la actualidad a manejado 11 creditos siendo el ultimo por la suma de C$ 10,000 córdobas para capital de trabajo, sus condicones de vida son regulares, vive en casa propia. Su mayor deseo es llegar a tener su propio estudio de revelado fotografico.

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
C. sells products for rug floor coverings, mattresses, and all that encompasses shoe repair.  She started with the Leon 2000 Foundation in 2001 with a credit that was put toward working capital.  She has two depedent daughters who are currently studying in University. She can count on the support of her husband who works for himself.  She has had 10 credits in the past and she has demonstrated her spirit of self-improvement and her will to be a success, in her business and in with her family.  Her quality of life has changed now that she has been able to improve her conditions.  One of her greatest dreams is to be able to have her own store, because she is currently renting her space.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora C. se dedica ala venta de productos para tapizar ,venta de colchones y todo en reparacion de calzado inicio con fundacion leon 2000 en el 2001 con un credito para capital de trabajo depende de ella dos personas hijas las cuales estan estudiando en la universidad , cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual trabaja por si solo, actualmente lleva diez creditos con nosotros tiempo durante el cual ha demiostrado su espiritu de superacion y su deseo de salir adelante tanto en su negocio como con su familia su nivel de vida ha cambiado ya que ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida , uno de sus grandes sueños es poder tener su propio establecimiento ya que actualmente alquila

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
M. is married and  two children depend on her.  Both of them are studens and live at home.  Her husband is out of country receiving help outside of Cost Rica.

She is currently involved with the Leon 2000 Foundation and has been with them for 6 years.  Her credits have been put towards working capital of her slowly growing business, a grocery store.  Her living conditions are good because as she was investing in her business she was also renovating her home.

She works every day, making her sales in cash only, and purchasing her merchandise directly from the markets since none of the local providers delivery to her home..

Her greatest dream is to establish a distributorship and to see her children successful in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora M., es casada dependen de ella dos hijos, ambos estudian, viven en casa propia su esposo se encuentra fuera del pais recibiendo ayuda del exterior en costa Rica.
Trabaja con fundacion leon 2000 desde hace 6 años,  sus creditos han sido para capital de trabajo, habiendo crecido poco a poco con su negocio siendo este una pequeña pulpería, sus condicones de vida son regulares, al mismo tiempo que ha invertido para capital de trabajo tambien le ha realizado mejoras a su casa de habitacion.
La señora ofrece sus servicios a diarios, vendiendo de contado, sus compras las hace en el mercado directamente, ya que no pasan proveedores por su domicilio.
Su mayor sueño es poner una minidistribuidora, y ver formados a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok T. earns income selling fish. She has been involved in this business for the past nine years and typically earns US$4 per day. T. purchases fish stocks from wholesale fishing businesses in the village and then sells them for profit in the local market. Her husband is a farmer and a palm-juice maker. He earns approximately US$3 per day. Mrs. Sok T. and her husband both live in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. 

Currently, T. would like to expand her fish sales business and is therefore requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more fish stocks for sale and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom V. is widowed and earns income selling groceries. She lives with her four children in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. Two of her children are married, while the other two farm to provide additional income for the family.  

Currently, V. is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This loan will enable her to expand her grocery business by increasing the variety of goods that she sells.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Sophea Soam's Group

texts.en:
The group leader in this small group is Mrs. Sophea S., and this group of borrowers consists of six members in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sophea S. currently has a soup-selling business. Since her business has improved, Mrs. Sophea S. is now requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook more delicious soup for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Vichet Chuon, just stays at home and assists his wife with her business. Mrs. Sophea S. is 38 and the mother of five children, three of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending a local school.

Mrs. Theang P.'s husband came to take a loan for his wife, so he is presented in the photo instead of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook more delicious soup for her customers.

loans.name: Thi Bao

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Bao, 35 years old, has 3 school-going children. Before joining the TYM Fund, she stayed at home to raise livestock and take care of the children, thus her family relied mainly on her husband's income. Therefore, they faced many difficulties. She joined the Fund in 1995 and borrowed loans to start a business. She used the first few loans to get used to doing business by selling fresh bamboo shoot. After 10 years of membership, she now has a small shop selling foodstuffs in the market. Besides managing the shop, she also works for various local processed-meat production companies so her family's income is very stable. Her husband works as a driver, earning 3,000,000VND (about 193USD) per month. Her children can all go to school. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150USD) to invest in her food shop. Her family's monthly income is 7,000,000VND (about 451USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Bảo năm nay 35 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị chỉ ở nhà chăn nuôi và chăm sóc con cái, thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu dựa vào lương của chồng do đó gặp không ít khó khăn. Năm 1995 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để bắt đầu công việc kinh doanh. Những vòng vốn đầu chị đã sử dụng để làm quen với công việc kinh doanh bằng việc buôn bán măng tươi. Sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ hiện nay chị có một cửa hàng nhỏ kinh doanh thực phẩm tại chợ. Ngoài thời gian bán hàng tại chợ chị còn đi làm thuê cho các lò sản xuất giò chả tại địa phương vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Chồng chị hiện đang làm công việc lái xe thuê cho thu nhập 3.000.000/ tháng. Vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại rất ổn định các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000 đ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng thực phẩm. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị là 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in selling foods

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is an invalid and receives a pension. Dilbar has been in business for more than 6 years. She began selling small goods and gradually increased the assortment and quantity of her inventory. Now, she makes enough money through her business to support her family. The family is entirely dependent on her business for money. She has financed her business through MicroInvest for three years. During this time, she has proved to be an exemplary client and has repaid all of her loans on time. The loans she has received have brought about appreciable advances in the development of her business. Having learned about Kiva, she has decided to apply for a new loan and is going to use it to replenish her stock of summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Дилбар 34 года, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж является инвалидом и получает пенсию. Дилбар занимается бизнесом уже больше 6 лет. Начинала она с мелкого товарооборота и постепенно увеличивала ассортимент и количество товара. Сейчас она получает прибыль от своего бизнеса достаточную для содержания семьи. Ведь все расходы семьи зависят от ее бизнеса. В Микроинвест она кредитуется уже 3 года. За это время показала себя образцовой клиенткой и все погашения производила вовремя. Получаемые ею займы внесли заметный вклад в развитие ее бизнеса. Узнав о КИВА она решила обратиться за новым займом и собирается использовать его для пополнения ассортимента летней одежды.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of children's clothes

loans.name: Wala Jan

texts.en:
This young man is Wala Jan, son of D. S.; he is 21 years old and married. He lives in the Shewa district of the Ningarhar Province.

Wala Jan has three children, and he graduated from class twelve last year. Because of financial problems, he had to stop his education and find a job. He tried to find a job in one of the government administrations because he wanted to help people this way, but he has been faced with some difficulties, so he decided to start a personal business.

He became a farmer and he is growing wheat, cereal, onions, and other vegetables in his land. He cannot solve all his family's problems with his small amount of income, so he wants to buy seeds and some stocks to increase his income through his farm. He requested a 50,000 Afghanis loan for 24 months from AFSG. He hopes that if he is able to solve his financial problems with this loan, then he will restart his higher education and begin to live his dreams.

loans.use: To buy seeds and some stocks

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
Nosir K. is 49 years old. He is divorced, and he has a daughter. For more than fifteen years, Nosir has been in the business of baking the national bread known as “lepeshka.” He notes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. Nosir started his business at home, but made solid profits as time went by, so he decided to expand his business with the help of IMON. Now, his business is very profitable and generates the main income for his family. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and bread so that his customers have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All of the input materials, such as flour, salt, and yeast, he purchases wholesale at the local market.

One of Nosir’s dreams is to arrange the wedding of his dearest daughter, which is why he works extremely hard. With this purpose in mind, Nosir decided to expand his business, and now he is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 over a 12-month term. With the loan proceeds, Nosir plans to purchase additional flour and coal to bake the lepeshka. Nosir has already received a loan and thereby demonstrated that he is an honest client; this time, he once again promises to promptly repay the loan. This loan would allow him to accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can change his life, so he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional flour and coal in order to bake the national bread known as “lepeshka”

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba D. is 31 years old. She is separated from her husband, and she has an adorable daughter. She started her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, and in order to have an independent income source.

More specifically, two years ago, Nasiba began selling underclothes for women and girls. Because she has always liked sales, business went well soon after she started her operation, and she has continued selling underclothes since then. At the present time, Nasiba is living with her parents. Her ultimate dream is to own her house, study a major or career, improve her business, and provide her daughter with schooling.

Today she is requesting a loan of $500, which she will repay over 12 months, in order to purchase more underclothes and to thereby have a greater variety of clothing. In turn, she hopes to earn more money. With your help, this will be possible. Please support this dedicated mother to make her dream become a reality.

loans.use: To diversify her product line by purchasing additional new underclothes to sell for women and girls

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan K. makes Cambodian Cakes and sells them in her village. She earns approximately US$2 per day. Her husband, Mr. San Ran, is a farmer in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. K. works hard every day; however, even with the income from her cake business, it is still very difficult to cover all of the family's expenses. 

Mrs. K.’s cakes are very popular, and the demand is increasing. She would therefore like to be able to expand her business and serve the new customers. A loan of US$100 will allow Mrs. K. to purchase ingredients to make more cakes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a bakery business

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Mrs. Yet S. is a farmer in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. She makes about US$1 per day. Mrs. Sameourn has twenty-nine years of experience in farming and has learned much from her parents who were also farmers. Her husband is a cook for weddings and other ceremonies in the area, earning about US$3 per day. Still, their combined income is not enough to cover the family’s expenses. Therefore, their two daughters work as cooks in a restaurant in Phnom Penh City to help pay for the schooling costs of their other two siblings. Now S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle. This motorcycle will be used by her husband for taxi services as well as for family transportation. She hopes that the loan will help increase the family's income and reduce its transportation expenses.

* * * * About HKL * * * *

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom V. is widowed and works as a grocery-seller in a market in the Sangke Meanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. She has three children, two of whom are married. Mom would currently like to expand her business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$150 to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N. earns income selling fish and vegetables and lives in Phsar Thmey Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. She makes about US$6.13 per day. Her husband is motorcycle driver, earning about US$2 per day. They both work hard, because they are responsible for supporting their six children. All of the children are young and in school. N. currently wishes to expand her business and is therefore asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more fish and vegetables for sale.

* * * * About HKL * * * *

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Toàn, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She put her first loan of 3,000,000 VND towards purchasing merchandise. Currently, her family has a general store. They get a steady income from their business of selling miscellaneous merchandise.

Even though they have the store, her family still grows rice and raises pigs. All of her children are grown. Her eldest child has moved out and has his/her own family. The other three children still live with her and are attending either high school or middle school.

Although they live in the countryside, her family is very determined to raise their children with an education. All of her children perform well in school. Her husband is a hardworking person. He is constantly active and helps with growing the rice and raising the pigs.

For this round of loans, they want to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest in their retail store. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Toàn 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa, hiện tai gia đình chị có cửa hàng tạp hóa tại chợ thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa rất đều đăn, mặc dù đi chợ nhưng gia đình chị vẫn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn, các con chị đều đã lớn con đầu chị đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang sống cùng gia đình chị đều đang đi học đại học và trung cấp, mặc dù ở nông thôn nhưng gia đình chị rất quyết tâm nuôi các con ăn học, các con chị học rất giỏi, chồng chị là người chịu khó thường xuyên động viên chi và giúp chị những công việc đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To put towards their retail store that sells general merchanise.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị T., 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She and her husband have had a hard time finding the means to raise their children with an education. By joining the fund, her family has been able to invest into the business of raising ducks and pigs. Currently, her family has 200 egg-laying ducks that create a steady average daily income of 100,000 VND. Her family also raises pigs in addition to the ducks. The family's animal rearing business has improved their financial situation significantly.

All of her children have complete educations. Two of the children have finished: one has established their own family and one has stable work that provides the family with 2,000,000 VND every month. Four of her children are still attending school.

For this round of loans, the family hopes to raise 6,000,000 VND to continue to put towards their animal rearing business. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T. 52 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006 đông con nên chị cùng chồng vất vả để kiếm tiền đầu tư cho các con ăn học, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 200 con vịt đẻ cho thu nhập đều đặn bình quân 100.000đ/ngày, ngoài việc chăn nuôi vịt gia đình chị còn nuôi thêm lợn. Từ những dự án chăn nuôi vit, lợn kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá lên rất nhiều. Các con chị đều được đi học đầy đủ, 2 con đã ra trường, 1 đã xây dựng gia đình ra ở riêng, 1 có công việc ổn định giúp gia đình thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng, 4 con chị vẫn đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To continue their animal rearing business of raising ducks and raising pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Đoan, 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She has not experienced the happiness that so many other women have because not only did she lose her husband early but he also left her with three young children. It was difficult but she kept telling herself that she had to persist in order to raise her children with a proper education. With a loan from the fund and support from a group of friends, she forcibly gathered funds to establish a store. The initial investment capital was 30,000,000 VND. She has been able to create a daily income of 100,000 VND from the investment.

She has three children; all were good students. They have all graduated and have stable employment. Her two sons work in Hanoi. Her daughter is a nurse at the military hospital. Her family's financil situation is very stable currently,

She would like to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest further into her store. The average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Đoan 49 tuổi, Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006, không được hạnh phúc như bao nhiêu phụ nữ khác chồng chị mât sớm để lại cho chị một nách 3 đứa con thơ, vât vả nhưng chị luôn tâm niệm phải cố gắng để nuôi các con được ăn học, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn và được một số người bạn giúp đỡ, chị đã mạnh dạn góp vốn đầu tư xây dựng chợ tại địa phương, số vốn ban đầu đóng góp là 30.000.000đ với số tiền đầu tư trên hiện nay gia đình chị đã có thu nhâp từ việc đầu tư chợ 100.000đ/ ngày, chị có 3 con các con chị đều ngoan ngoãn học giỏi và đã ra trường có việc làm ổn định, 2 con trai làm ở Hà nội, con gái chị làm ý tá tại bệnh viện hợp lực, kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại rất ổn định. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư xây dựng chợ. Thu nhập bình quân.5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To invest in retail store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị H., 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She grows rice and raises livestock. Her husband practices Eastern Medicine (a.k.a. "Chinese Medicine" or "Herbal Medicine"). As an experienced practitioner, he always whole-heartedly tends to patients therefore her husband is cherished and held in high esteem by people in their community.

They joined the fund to buy medicine for the treatment of illnesses. Chị H. also invested in the raising of pigs. She has four children; one has established their own family and is living on their own, while the other three are stilling living at home, and of these, two are attending school. After three years of applying borrowed funds to their businesses, the family's financial situation has clearly improved. They have been able to purchase more of life's comforts and put money towards their children's education.

For this round, they hope to raise 9,000,000 VND to put towards buying more medicine for the treatment of illnesses. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị H. 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi chồng chị làm nghề bốc thuốc đông y. Là người có nhiều năm trong nghề thầy thuốc, luôn tận tình chăm sóc bệnh nhân nên anh được bà con trong vùng quý mến và tôn trọng, tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn gia đình đã đầu tư vốn vào việc mua thuốc chữa bệnh, ngoài ra chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, chị có 4 người con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang sống cùng gia đình trong đó 2 con đang đi học. Qua 3 năm sử dụng các vòng vốn của Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, gia đình chị đã mua sắm nhiều tiện nghi trong sinh hoạt, đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua thuốc chữa bệnh. Thu nhập bình quân.6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for treatment of illnesses.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Huyên, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She is an active and responsible woman that handles all household duties. Her husband was in the military but has lost his strength and now receives and receives a monthly stipend. Her family is currently living in the countryside. The people living in this area depend entirely on agriculture as a source of income. With their firsthand knowledge of farming necessities, her family borrowed capital to invest in the business of selling fertilizer.

Her family's farming supplies business needs a lot of capital to prepare for the different seasons. The fact that their region has very few businesses like theirs has been beneficial for the family. Therefore, her family's business has been the main source of farming supplies for the people in the area.

She has four children - one has a family and three still live with her. Of the three remaining, one is attending school and the other two are working to supplement the family's income.

For this round of loans, the family wants to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest in their fertilizer retail business. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese, by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Huyên 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006 chị là người phụ nữ năng động, đảm đang lo toan mọi cônng việc trong gia đình, chồng chị là cán bộ mất sức có lương hưu hàng tháng, gia đình chị hiện đang sống ở vùng nông thôn, người dân ở đây nguồn thu nhâp chính hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào nông nghiệp. Nhận thấy nhu cầu không thể thiếu của người dân làm nông nghiệp gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư kinh doanh vật tư lân đạm. Với việc kinh doanh vật tư nông nghiệp gia đình chị cần nhiều vốn để đầu tư mỗi khi vào vụ, rất thuận lợi cho gia đình chị tại địa phương có rất ít người kinh doanh mặt hàng này, vậy cửa hàng nhà chị luôn là điểm mua bán của rất nhiều bà con trong địa phương.Chị có 4 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 3 con đang sống cùng chị, 1 con đang đi học, 2 con đã đi làm và có thu nhập phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh vật tư lân đạm. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To invest in their fertilizer retail business.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị N., 43 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. She has been in the business of selling grains and rice and of making rice mills for eight years. She used her first loan of 3,000,000 VND to purchase grains and rice. She has a flair for business and always takes advantage of market conditions - when price conditions are favorable, she sells. In conjunction with her grain and rice related businesses, she also invests in raising pigs to make use of the leftover husk and bran.

The family's dream is to establish a rice factory locally. Her husband and two children all help with the family businesses. One of her children is still attending school and the other is able to help in all facets of the business.

For this round of loans, they would like to raise 9,000,000 VND to purchase grains. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị N. 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007, có gần 8 năm trong nghề buôn bán thóc, gạo và làm máy xay sát. Tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua thóc, gạo. Chị là người nhạy bén trong kinh doanh và luôn năm bắt tốt thị trường khi thời điểm được giá là chị lại bán, kết hợp với việc làm nghề buôn bán thóc, gạo, máy xay sát chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, tận dụng cám bã thừa, với mong muốn của gia đình chị trong tương lai sẽ mở đại lý gạo ngay tại địa phương, công việc gia đình chị luôn được chồng và 2 con chị chia sẻ, 1 con chị vẫn đang đi học, 1 con đã phụ giúp các công việc gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào mua gao. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To purchase grains.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi N., 45 years old, borrows money to improve her family economy. In 2006, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed 200 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Her project in breeding pigs succeeded since the beginning. The next round of borrowed money, she used it in making wine besides breeding pigs because the waste from the fruit is a nutritious food for pigs. Her projects went well and effectively. She was able to send her oldest child to a technical school. He owns a electrical workshop. He also contributes to repaying his mother’s borrowed money. Mrs. N.’s other 2 children are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest in her son’s electrical workshop. Her average income is 250 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Nghiên 45 tuổi, với mục đích vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Năm 2006 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị mạnh dạn vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Dự án chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị thành công ở vòng vốn đầu tiên, bước sang vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã bàn bạc đầu tư dự án nấu rượu hỗ trợ chăn nuôi lợn, bã rượu là thức ăn có nhiều chất dinh dưỡng, từ những vòng vốn sử dụng hiệu quả gia đình chị đã đầu tư cho con đi học nghề sửa chữa điện tử, hiện nay con chị đã có nghề và mở cửa hàng sửa chữa điện tử, 2 người con chị đang đi học, từ khi có cửa hàng sửa chữa điện tử thu nhập kinh tế gia đình chị đã tăng cao việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị rất tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng điện tử. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: expand electrical workshop for her son

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi P., 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. She has 3 children, one of whom is working and the other 2 are still going to school. Before, her family depended mainly on several small rice fields; therefore, they met a lot of economic difficulties. After joining the Fund and being lent to some money, she had a starting fund to do business on waste materials. This activity requires more work and effort but it brings her more profit. Her husband and son also work and earn 150 USD/month. Since her business goes well and together with the contribution of her husband and son, she is able to repay regularly. Her family economy improves. This time, she wants to borrow 375 USD to breed pigs. Every year, she sells 400 kg pigs. Her average income is 250 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Phú 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, chị có 3 con, 1con đã đi làm, 2 con vẫn đang đi học, mấy năm về trước gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng do vậy kinh tế gia đình khó khăn. Tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn khi có đồng vốn chị đã mạnh dạn sử dụng vốn vay vào việc đi chợ cân phế liệu tuy công việc vất vả nhưng thu nhập cao hơn so với trước, chồng và con chị đi làm thuê hàng tháng thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ, chị đi chợ đều đặn cùng với sự cố găng đi làm của chồng và con chị nên việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị không khó khăn, kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá hơn rất nhiều các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, hàng năm gia đình chị xuất bình quân 4 tạ lợn.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi T., 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2007. After 2 years of membership, she has been using the borrowed money in breeding animals, especially ducks because the activity brings her stable daily income, making repaying easier for her. She has one child who is still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in breeding ducks. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Thắng 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007, qua 2 năm tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn sử dụng vốn vào đầu tư chăn nuôi, gia đình chị lựa chọn chăn nuôi vịt đẻ cho phù hợp với điều kiện kinh tế của gia đình, việc chăn nuôi vịt đẻ thu nhập đều đặn hàng ngày nên cũng thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả vốn vay cua gia đình chị, hàng ngày chị vẫn đi chợ hàng sáo thu nhập bình quân từ việc đi chợ 50.000đ/ tháng, chi có 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng .

loans.use: breed ducks

loans.name: Thi Nhan

texts.vi:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2006, Mrs. N. Thi Nhan, 53 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vu Thanh Dai, borrowed money to improve their family's economy. They are one of the families in the village with many years of experience in rearing pigs so all the loans were used to invest in the pig-rearing business. Their system is extensive, with large, clean pig sty and proper waste disposal system. Beside feeding the pigs everyday, Mrs. Nhan's family also bathe the pigs and clean the sty frequently. Currently, her family has 100 pigs, 50 of which are waiting to be sold and the other 50 are still small. Mrs. Nhan has 3 children, 1 of whom is still schooling. This time round, she wants to borrow 9 millions VND (550USD) to invest in her pig-rearing business. Her family's average monthly income is 6 millions VND (387USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Nguyễn Thị Nhân 53 tuổi cùng chồng anh là Vũ Thanh Đại vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Là một trong những gia đình tại địa phương có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi lợn nên các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn mô hình chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị rất lớn, chuồng trại chăn nuôi cũng được gia đình chị đầu tư rất khang trang thoáng mát, hệ thông thoát nước đảm bảo, hàng ngày ngoài việc cho ăn gia đình chị thường xuyên tắm cho lợn và vệ sinh chuồng trại, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 100 con lợn, 50 con đang chờ xuất chuồng, 50 con lợn bột, gia đình chị có 3 con hiện đang sống cùng chị, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lơn. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs rearing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rose Kasoma’S Group

texts.en:
Rose K. is a self-taught beautician who has been working with two other women at the JML beauty salon for the past four years.  She is a 38-year-old single mother with four children, ranging in age from 9 to 18 years old.  She works seven days a week, providing styling and braiding for her customers.  Both are time-consuming activities, taking several hours to style and longer to braid hair.

Rose has been a member of MCDT for two years and she and her group have received numerous loans.  The loans have helped her to invest in her business and to pay school fees for her children.  With this new loan, she will buy chemicals and braids for her business.  Her future goal is to get enough money to buy a plot and build a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for her salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Tua

texts.vi:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2006, Mrs. N. Thi Tua is now 49 years old. After 3 years, she realises that by joining the Fund, family members and herself are more hardworking and daring to do business. Her family has a butcher shop selling pork in the wet market. Her husband is the butcher while she is the seller in the market. On average, everyday her family butchers and sells one 60kg pig. During special occasions such as the New Year, her family butchers and sells more: 2 to 3 pigs. Her family is well-known in this business as they have many years of experience in butchering. the villagers always sell pigs to her family whenever they have pigs that are old enough. Her family's income is, therefore, improving. She has two school-going children. Her wish is that she can expand her business to offer duck and dog meat to meet the customers' demand. This time, she wants to borrow 9 millions VND (550USD) to invest in the butcher shop. Her family's average monthly income is 5 millions VND (about 322USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006 chị Nguyễn Thị Tựa 49 tuổi, trải qua 3 năm vay vốn của Quỹ chị nhận thấy rằng việc tham gia vào Quỹ bản thân chị cùng các thành viên trong gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn làm kinh tế và mọi người đều cố gắng hơn, gia đình chị làm ngề thịt lợn bán taị chợ, chồng chị là người đi mổ lợn còn chị là người đi bán trực tiếp tại chợ, bình quân mổi ngày gia đình chị thịt 1 con lợn khoảng 60kg, Những ngày tết, dằm gia đình chị thịt nhiều hơn từ 2->3 con, có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề nên gia đình anh chị rất có uy tín trong làm ăn, người dân trong địa phương khi cần xuất lợn lại bán cho gia đình chị. Kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, mong muốn của gia đình chị sẽ mở thêm mặt hàng thịt chó và thịt vịt để đáp ưng nhu cầu khách hàng, chị có 2 con hiện đang học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào kinh doanh giết mổ lợn, chó. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in butcher shop

loans.name: Soyaya Group

texts.fr:
Created during the year 2001, SOYAYA Group consists of two serious, dynamic young women who put their heads together in running a business. One of the two sells local drinks, the other sells shoes, towels, and baby outfits. The members of this group have been very careful about reimbursing their previous loans appropriately.

They are on their 8th loan and are asking for a loan of US$ 725 to purchase a barrel of locally produced drink, 5 dozen shoes, 40 towels, and 3 dozen baby outfits.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Créée au cours de l’année 2001, l’association SOYAYA est un groupe de deux femmes solidaires et dynamiques qui mettent leur savoir faire dans l’exercice d’une activité commerciale. L’une revendeuse de boisson locale et l’autre revendeuse de chaussures, de serviettes et de trousseaux bébé. Les membres de ce groupe ont toujours été fidèles dans le remboursement de leurs crédits antérieurs.

Elles sont à leur huitième (8ième) prêt et sollicite un crédit de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter un tonneau de boisson locale, cinq douzaines de chaussures, 40 serviettes et trois douzaines de trousseaux bébé.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, local drink, etc.

loans.name: Thi Linh

texts.vi:
Born in 1976, Mrs. T. Thi Linh joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Despite being very young, she and her husband are very sensitive and quick in doing business and improving their family's economy. Her hometown's traditional occupation is making mats, so she used the first loan T. purchase materials T. make more mats. In 2008, her family decided T. invest in buying machines for the mat production instead of making mats manually like before. Mrs. Linh does not just use the machines for her family's own production but also lends it out T. other villagers. Because of this, her family's income is increasing. She has three school-going children. This time, she wants T. borrow 9 millions VND (550USD) T. purchase more raw materials for the mat production. Her family's average monthly income is 4 millions VND (about 258USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Sinh năm 1976, Chị Tô Thị Lĩnh tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2007, mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng vợ chồng chị rất nhạy bén trong làm ăn và phát triển kinh tế, tai địa phương chị với nghề chuyền thống người dân trong đia phương chủ yếu là dêt chiếu, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị sử dụng vào mua vât liệu làm chiếu. Năm 2008 gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư mua máy vò và máy lồng loại máy để dệt chiếu thay thế cho việc làm thủ công trước. Máy đựơc phục vụ sản xuât của gia đình và dịch vụ cho các hộ có nhu cầu thuê. Từ việc kinh doanh này kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua vật liệu dệt chiếu. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Emefa Emilie

texts.fr:
Born in Kpalimé on December 31, 1982, Mrs. Emefa Emilie A. is unmarried and the mother of one child. Settled in Lomé for some time now, she had the idea of buying charcoal in her native village to sell to retailers in the city of Lomé. This lucrative idea has brought her success and she has seen her clientele grow, which has led her to ask for a loan to expand her stock.

This first loan will allow her to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Kpalimé le 31 décembre 1982, madame A. Emefa Emilie, est célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Installé à Lomé depuis un temps déjà, elle a eu l’idée d’acheter du charbon de bois dans son village d’origine pour le vendre aux détaillants dans la ville de Lomé. Cette idée lucrative lui a été porteuse car aujourd’hui sa clientèle a augmenté ce qui la poussé à prendre du crédit pour augmenter son stock.

Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 30 sacs de charbon de bois

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Rohat is 20 years old, not married, and lives with her parents, sisters and brother. She has been working in sales near her home for almost 10 years. Earlier she helped her mother and father. In due course, she took over the business. In Rohat’s stall there are a variety of trifles, from matches and shampoo to powders and drinks. She wants to get a refrigerator to store ice cream and drinks as it is now the season for it. Until now, she has rented a refrigerator; now she has her own.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Рохат не замужем ей 20 лет, она живет с родителями , с сестрами и братом. Она торгует почти 10 лет недалеко от дома, раньше она помогала матери и отцу, со временем она сама взяла бизнес в свои руки . У Рохат в ларьке есть все мелочи , от спичек и шампуня до порошков и напитков. Она хочет приобрести холодильник для хранения мороженного и напитков, так как сейчас сезон, до сих пор она арендовала холодильник, теперь у нее есть собственный.

loans.use: for the purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Pamela Nansubuga `s Group

texts.en:
N. Pamela is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, a three-year-old and a 9-month-old.  She lives and works in Mpererwe, a neighborhood near the outskirts of Kampala.  She has a shop called Amoti’s Cosmetics where she sells hair relaxer, foundation, lipsticks, lotions, wigs and other beauty products.  She travels to downtown Kampala to get the products she sells in her shop and works seven days a week.  The weekends are her busiest time.  To get to work requires her to take two minibus taxis, and she finds transportation a challenge.
Although she had worked in cosmetics for a while, it was only after she got her first loan from MCDT in 2004 that she was encouraged to start her own business.  Since then, she has had six loans and reports that she has been able to develop her business solely because of the capital that they provide.  Currently, she rents the space that she is using and her goal is to buy a plot of land to build a business near her home.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah K. is a thirty-seven-year-old mother of three and a resident of Chanika in the Dar es Salaam region. She runs a charcoal store in the area, a challenging business she has been doing for the past six years. From the profits, she has been able to send her three children to school and care for her family. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Kodzo Senyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo Senyo E. was born on October 1, 1977 in Kuma Adame, a village located 135 km from the capital of Togo. He is married and has 2 children. His business consists in selling tires and inner tubes. He is a very astute businessman who chose to locate his business in a place much frequented by his target audience.

Since 2002 when he began the business, he has seen his clientele grow and he does everything he can to respond to their needs. Thus, to fill an order he has received, he is asking for this first loan which will allow him to buy 80 tires and 100 inner tubes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur E. Kodjo Senyo est né le 01 octobre 1977 à Kuma Adame un village situé à 135 km de la capitale du TOGO. Il est marié et a 02 enfants. Son activité consiste en la vente de pneus et de chambres à air. C’est un commerçant très astucieux qui pour s’implanter à choisi un lieu très fréquenté par sa clientèle cible.

Depuis 2002 qu’il a commencé cette activité, il a vue grandir sa clientèle et surtout il fait tout pour répondre a son besoin. Ainsi pour répondre à une commande qu’il a reçu, il sollicite ce premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 80 pneus et 100 chambres à air.

loans.use:
Purchase of tires and inner tubes

Achat de pneus et de chambres à air

loans.name: Grace Anjei

texts.en:
Grace was born on 15/8/1959, and is married with seven children with one below 15 years. Faced with some challenges in life like ill health, the death of her father and younger brother, and being a school dropout, life was very difficult and complicated for her until she came to GHAPE in 2006. Thus far, she has obtained two loans of $40 and $300 respectively and the repayment was satisfactory.  The loans accomplished many things, such as paying school fees for her children and grandchildren, supporting the health of her family and feeding the family.

Given this loan, Grace plans to construct a new pig pen, electrify the pig pen to give light to the pigs when they are about to deliver at night. She also plans to buy 10 piglets to add to the ones she already has, to prepare a packing space for her firewood, and to continue buying and splitting of wood. She promises to start repayment at the fourth month from the date of disbursement.  

With the profit from the loan, she plans to expand her business, continue to pay school fees for her children and grandchildren, and take care of the health and feeding in the family.

Grace prefers a loan from GHAPE because the means  of repayment is easier, the loan scheme is encouraging, the interest paid on GHAPE loans is relatively low as compared to other financial institution, and lastly, GHAPE does proper follow up with their clients to ensure the loan is manage judiciously.

loans.use: To buy materials for new pig pen, and piglets and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purcase pigs, fowl, and dyes for fibers

loans.name: Juliet Namukwaya `s Group

texts.en:
N. Juliet is 23 years old and married with two children, a three-year-old and 
a 6 month old infant.  For the past three years, she has operated a profitable second-hand clothing business, purchasing high quality women’s clothing from a large open-air market in central Kampala, and selling it to women in Kalerwe, a distant urban neighborhood.  Each month, she is able to make a profit of about 150,000/= (Ugandan shillings, a little less than $100 US).  One of the things that makes business difficult is that the wards and town council want a lot of taxes from her on many different things.  However, her business is running and growing, she says.  

She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received numerous loans.  With a new loan, she will continue to buy clothing for her business.  She would also like to get her own house, and perhaps some day she will get her own car.

loans.use: To stock more clothes

loans.name: Ama Florence

texts.fr:
At 46, Mrs. Ama Florence E., born in Ariva in the plateau region, is married and responsible for 4 children. She is a seamstress and three years ago, she had the brilliant idea to add to her dressmaking business the sale of sewing notions and cellular phone card refills. This differentiates her from the competition and at the same time, she has become their supplier for sewing notions.

She needs this loan to bolster her stock in view of the increasing demand.

/Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 46ans, madame E. Ama Florence, née à Ariva dans la région des plateaux, est mariée avec 04 enfants à la charge. Elle est couturière et il y a trois ans de cela, elle a eu l’idée géniale d’associer à son activité, la vente des articles de mercerie et des cartes de recharge pour cellulaire. Ceci la différencie de ses concurrentes et en même temps elle devient leurs fournisseurs en articles de mercerie.

Elle nécessite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock vue que la demande augmente.

loans.use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat des articles de mercerie

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata Djitté is a 29 year-old widow with three children and has been a member of Bignona Water Tower village bank for the last two and half years. She wants to strengthen her business in dyed fabrics. Aminata buys fabric and materials in Dakar to dye and sell in Bignona. With her income she participates in her family’s spending and medical care. The loan she is seeking will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Aminata Djitté, 29 ans, veuve avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés. Aminata achète le tissu et les produits à Dakar pour faire la teinture et vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux.
